bh

bhakāra

masc. adding the syllable -bha to a name; considered derogatory [bha + kāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp, derog
Meaning adding the syllable -bha to a name; considered derogatory
Construction bha + kāra
Commentary (VINa) yakārena vā bhakārena vā'ti yakārabhakāre yojetvā yo akkoso.
bhakuṭi

fem. frown; scowl; black look; lit. brow curve [bhā + kuṭi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning frown; scowl; black look; lit. brow curve
Construction bhā + kuṭi
Compound kammadhāraya (bhā + kuṭi)
Variant bhākuṭi, bhūkuṭi
Sanskrit bhṛkuṭi

Example

atha kho, bhikkhave, vedehikā gahapatānī kāḷiṃ dāsiṃ etadavoca, he je kāḷī'ti. kiṃ, ayye'ti? kiṃ, je, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti? na khv'ayye, kiñcī'ti. no vata re kiñci, pāpi dāsi, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti kupitā anattamanā bhakuṭiṃ akāsi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
bhakkha 1

adj. eating; feeding on; feasting on [√bhakkh + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from bhakkhati
Meaning eating; feeding on; feasting on
Root Family √bhakkh
Root √bhakkh･1 a (eat)
Construction √bhakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ada, adaka, ādī, āhāra
Sanskrit bhakṣa
Sanskrit Root √bhakṣ 1 (partake of, eat)

Examples

saññā nu kho, bhante, purisassa attā, udāhu aññā saññā añño attā'ti? kaṃ pana tvaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, attānaṃ paccesī'ti? oḷārikaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, attānaṃ paccemi rūpiṃ cātumahābhūtikaṃ kabaḷīkār'āhārabhakkhan'ti.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

susukhaṃ vata jīvāma,
yesaṃ no n'atthi kiñcanaṃ,
pītibhakkhā bhavissāma,
devā ābhassarā yathā.

DHP 200 sukhavaggo
bhakkha 2

nt. food to eat [√bhakkh + a] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps, from bhakkhati
Meaning food to eat
Root Family √bhakkh
Root √bhakkh･1 a (eat)
Construction √bhakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit bhakṣa
Sanskrit Root √bhakṣ 1 (partake of, eat)

Example

andhabālo'si, mahārāja, kiñ'cā'pi mahābhakkho'si, anekasūpabyañjanavikatikaṃ doṇapākaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjasi, dvīsu raṭṭhesu rajjaṃ kāresi, paññā pana te mandā'ti

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu
bhakkha 3

nt. prey [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkha 4

adj. fit to be eaten, eatable [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhaka

masc. who eats [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhati

pr. (+acc) eats, feeds upon [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhana

nt. eating [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhayitvā

abs. having eaten [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhasa

nt. food [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhi

aor. ate, fed upon [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhita

pp. eaten, fed upon [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhituṃ

inf. (+acc) to eat, to feed upon [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakkhitvā

abs. (+acc) having eaten; having munched [√bhakkh + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of bhakkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having eaten; having munched
Root Family √bhakkh
Root √bhakkh･1 a (eat)
Construction √bhakkh + itvā
Commentary (ANa) yāvadatthaṃ bhakkhitvā'ti kaṇṭhappamāṇena khāditvā.
Sanskrit bhakṣitvā
Sanskrit Root √bhakṣ 1 (partake of, eat)
bhakkheti

pr. (+acc) eats, feeds upon [√bhakkh] ✗
bhakhituṃ

bhaga 1

nt. luck, fortune [√bhaj] ✗
bhaga 2

nt. perineum; vulva; lit. divide [√bhaj + a] ~

Meaning perineum; vulva; lit. divide
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhaga
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)
bhaga 3

nt. female organ [√bhaj] ✗
bhagandalā

fem. fistula [bhagaṃ + dala + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning fistula
Construction bhagaṃ + dala + ā
bhagandala + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Commentary (NIDD1a) bhagaṃ dālayatī'ti bhagandalā, vaccamaggaṃ phāletī'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhagaṃdara

Example

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pakkhandikā sūlā visūcikā kuṭṭhaṃ gaṇḍo kilāso soso apamāro daddu kaṇḍu kacchu nakhasā vitacchikā lohitaṃ pittaṃ madhumeho aṃsā piḷakā bhagandalā

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
bhagalavatī

fem. name of a deity [bhagala + vatī] ~

Grammar fem, from bhagala
Meaning name of a deity
Construction bhagala + vatī
bhagavatā

masc. by the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + ā] ✓

Grammar masc, instr sg of bhagavant
Meaning by the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant + ā
bhagavant + ā
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavatā
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti. evam'evaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.

DN 14.13 mahāpadānasuttaṃ
bhagavati

masc. under the Sublime One, Blessed One, Fortunate One, Buddha [√bhaj] ✗
bhagavato 1

masc. to the Buddha; for the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + to] ✓

Grammar masc, dat sg of bhagavant
Meaning to the Buddha; for the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant + to
bhagavant + to
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavate
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho therā bhikkhū yāvatako ahosi sabbeh'eva saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo, taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesuṃ.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo mahatiyā kaṃsapātiyā pāyāsaṃ vaḍḍhetvā bhagavato upanāmesi, bhuñjatu bhavaṃ gotamo pāyasaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhagavato 2

masc. of the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + to] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of bhagavant
Meaning of the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant + to
bhagavant + to
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavataḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudassana, bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā mama bhatt'ābhihāre bhāsa. ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ

idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhagavato 3

masc. from the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + to] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of bhagavant
Meaning from the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant + to
bhagavant + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavataḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ

etassa bhagavā kālo, etassa sugata kālo, yaṃ bhagavā dhammaṃ deseyya. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
bhagavato santike

idiom. in the Buddha’s presence; lit. in near of the Buddha ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + prep
Meaning in the Buddha’s presence; lit. in near of the Buddha
Sanskrit bhagavataḥ + samantikam

Examples

atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ

atha kho tā devatā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho ekā devatā bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ
bhagavant 1

masc. Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; Auspicious One; epithet of the Buddha; lit. having good fortune quality [√bhaj + a + vant] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhaga
Meaning Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; Auspicious One; epithet of the Buddha; lit. having good fortune quality
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + vant
bhaga + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change j > g
Synonym sugata
Sanskrit bhagavat
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
bhagavant 2

adj. fortunate [√bhaj] ✗
bhagavantarūpa

masc. someone like the Buddha ✗
bhagavannettika

adj. guided by the Blessed one; led by the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + nettika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning guided by the Blessed one; led by the Buddha
Construction bhagavaṃ + nettika
Phonetic Change ṃ > n
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhagavaṃ + nettika)
Variant bhagavaṃnettika
Commentary (SNa) bhagavaṃnettikā'ti, bhagavā hi dhammānaṃ netā vinetā anunetāti. yathāsabhāvato pāṭiyekkaṃ pāṭiyekkaṃ nāmaṃ gahetvā dassitā dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā nāma honti.
Sanskrit bhagavat + netṛ +
bhagavampaṭisaraṇa

adj. relying on the Blessed One; depending on the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning relying on the Blessed One; depending on the Buddha
Construction bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa)
Variant bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇa
Commentary (SNa) bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā'ti catubhūmakadhammā sabbaññutaññāṇassa āpāthaṃ āgacchamānā bhagavati paṭisaranti nāmāti bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā
Sanskrit bhagavat + pratisaraṇa
bhagavaṃnettika

adj. guided by the Blessed one; led by the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + nettika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning guided by the Blessed one; led by the Buddha
Construction bhagavaṃ + nettika
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhagavaṃ + nettika)
Variant bhagavannettika
Commentary (SNa) bhagavaṃnettikā'ti, bhagavā hi dhammānaṃ netā vinetā anunetāti. yathāsabhāvato pāṭiyekkaṃ pāṭiyekkaṃ nāmaṃ gahetvā dassitā dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā nāma honti.
Sanskrit bhagavat + netṛ +

Example

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇa

adj. relying on the Blessed One; depending on the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning relying on the Blessed One; depending on the Buddha
Construction bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhagavaṃ + paṭisaraṇa)
Variant bhagavampaṭisaraṇa
Commentary (SNa) bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā'ti catubhūmakadhammā sabbaññutaññāṇassa āpāthaṃ āgacchamānā bhagavati paṭisaranti nāmāti bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā

Example

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
bhagavaṃmūlaka

adj. rooted in the Blessed One; stemming from the Buddha [bhagavaṃ + mūlaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning rooted in the Blessed One; stemming from the Buddha
Construction bhagavaṃ + mūlaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhagavaṃ + mūlaka)
Commentary (SNa) bhagavaṃmūlakā'ti, bhagavā mūlaṃ etesanti bhagavaṃmūlakā.
Sanskrit bhagavat + mūlaka

Example

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
bhagavā

masc. Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; epithet of the Buddha [√bhaj + a + vant + ā] ✓

Grammar masc, nom sg of bhagavant
Meaning Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; epithet of the Buddha
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag > bhāg + a + vant + ā
bhaga + vā
Phonetic Change j > g
Sanskrit bhagavat
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.

DN 16.36 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhaginicitta

nt. attitude as to the sister, state of mind like to the sister; lit. sister-mind ✗

Meaning fraternal affection; love for one's sister

Construction bhaginibhūta + pubba
Antonym nabhaginibhūtapubba
bhaginimattī

fem. woman of an age to be a sister; lit. sister-measure ✗
bhaginimaraṇa

Construction bhaginī + maraṇa
Commentary (NIDD1a) bhaginimaraṇan'ti jeṭṭhakaniṭṭhabhaginīnaṃ maraṇaṃ.
bhaginirakkhita

adj. protected by a sister [bhaginī + rakkhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning protected by a sister
Construction bhaginī + rakkhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhaginiyā + rakkhita)
Sanskrit bhaginī + rakṣita

Example

yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
bhaginivāda

masc. the word "sister" [bhaginī + vāda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning the word "sister"
Construction bhaginī + vāda
bhaginisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 15.17 (SN15.17) ✗
bhaginī 1

fem. sister [√bhaj + a + inī] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhaga
Meaning sister
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + inī
bhaga + inī
Derivative taddhita (inī)
Phonetic Change j > g
Variant bhagini
Sanskrit bhaginī
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

mātā'pi puttena vivadati, putto'pi mātarā vivadati, pitā'pi puttena vivadati, putto'pi pitarā vivadati, bhātā'pi bhātarā vivadati, bhātā'pi bhaginiyā vivadati, bhaginī'pi bhātarā vivadati, sahāyo'pi sahāyena vivadati.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi. tena kho pana, pāpima, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
bhaginī 2

fem. respectful address to a woman; lit. sister [√bhaj + a + inī] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhaga
Meaning respectful address to a woman; lit. sister
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag + a + inī
bhaga + inī
Derivative taddhita (inī)
Phonetic Change j > g
Variant bhagini
Sanskrit bhaginī
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

evam'etaṃ bhaginiyo evam'etaṃ bhaginiyo!

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

muṭṭhīhi'pi yujjhanti, raṅgamajjhe'pi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti, idha, bhagini, naccassū'ti, nalāṭikam'pi denti, vividham'pi anācāraṃ ācaranti.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsaka sikkhāpadaṃ
bhaginīsama

adj. like a sister; similar to a sibling [bhaginī + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a sister; similar to a sibling
Construction bhaginī + sama
Compound kammadhāraya (bhaginī + sama)
Sanskrit bhaginī + sama

Example

vadhakasamā, corīsamā, ayyasamā, mātāsamā, bhaginīsamā, sakhīsamā, dāsīsamā. imā kho, sujāte, satta purisassa bhariyāyo.

AN 7.63 bhariyāsuttaṃ
bhagu 1

masc. name of a monk ✗
bhagu 2

masc. name of a Vedic sage ✗
bhaguttheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 187 (TH187) ✗
bhagga 1

pp. broken; shattered; fractured [√bhañj + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhañjati
Meaning broken; shattered; fractured
Root Family √bhañj
Root √bhañj･1 a (break, destroy)
Construction √bhañj > bhañg + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > gg
Synonym pabhinna, phuṭa
Sanskrit bhagna
Sanskrit Root √bhañj 7 (break)

Example

gahakāraka diṭṭho'si,
puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā,
gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ,
taṇhānaṃ khayam'ajjhagā.

DHP 154 jarāvaggo
bhagga 2

pp. destroyed; ended [√bhañj + ta] ~

Grammar pp of bhañjati
Meaning destroyed; ended
Root Family √bhañj
Root √bhañj･1 a (break, destroy)
Construction √bhañj > bhañg + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > gg
Synonym upacchinna
Sanskrit bhagna
Sanskrit Root √bhañj 7 (break)
bhagga 3

nt. luck, fortune [√bhaj] ✗
bhaggajātaka

nt. Jātaka 155 (JA 155) ✗
bhaggava

masc. family name; lit. from Bhaggu [bhaggu + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, patr, from bhaggu
Meaning family name; lit. from Bhaggu
Construction bhaggu > bhaggav + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Notes (MW) bhārgava relating to or coming from Bhṛgu
Sanskrit bhārgava

Example

evam'etaṃ tadā āsi,
yathā bhāsasi bhaggava,
kumbhakāro pure āsi,
vekaḷiṅge ghaṭīkaro,
mātāpettibharo āsi,
kassapassa upāsako.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
bhaggavagotta

masc. name of a wandering ascetic; lit. from the Bhaggava family clan [bhaggava + gotta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a wandering ascetic; lit. from the Bhaggava family clan
Construction bhaggava + gotta
bhaggā

masc. name of the people of Bhagga; Bhaggans [bhagga + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl of bhagga
Meaning name of the people of Bhagga; Bhaggans
Construction bhagga + ā
Commentary (MNa) bhaggesū'ti evaṃnāmake janapade, vacan'attho pan'ettha vutt'ānusāren'eva veditabbo.
Sanskrit bharga

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahāmoggallāno magadhesu kallavāḷaputtagāme pacalāyamāno nisinno hoti.

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.

MN 15 anumānasuttaṃ
bhaṅga 1

masc. breaker; destroyer [√bhañj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from bhañjati
Meaning breaker; destroyer
Root Family √bhañj
Root √bhañj･1 a (break, destroy)
Construction √bhañj > bhaṅg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ñj > ṅg
Sanskrit bhaṅga
Sanskrit Root √bhañj 7 (break)

Example

sare hatthehi bhañjitvā,
katvāna kuṭim'acchisaṃ,
tena me sarabhaṅgo'ti,
nāmaṃ sammutiyā ahu.

TH 228 sarabhaṅgattheragāthā

bhaṅga 3

adj. hempen; canvas; made of hemp [√bhañj + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhañjati
Meaning hempen; canvas; made of hemp
Root Family √bhañj
Root √bhañj･1 a (break, destroy)
Construction √bhañj > bhaṅg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ñj > ṅg
Notes six types of robe cloth 1. khoma, 2. kappāsika, 3. koseyya, 4. kambala, 5. sāṇa, 6. bhaṅga
Sanskrit bhaṅga
Sanskrit Root √bhañj 7 (break)

Examples

suttaṃ nāma cha suttāni, khomaṃ kappāsikaṃ koseyyaṃ kambalaṃ sāṇaṃ bhaṅgaṃ

VIN 1.4.3.6 suttaviññattisikkhāpadaṃ

channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataran'ti khomaṃ, kappāsikaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kambalaṃ, sāṇaṃ, bhaṅgan'ti imesaṃ channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ.

bhaṅgānupassanā

fem. insight into disruption ✗
bhacca 1

adj. to be supported; to be nurtured; lit. to be borne [√bhar + tya] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, ptp of bharati
Meaning to be supported; to be nurtured; lit. to be borne
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar + tya

Sanskrit bhṛtya
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

Example

atha kho jīvako komārabhacco seṭṭhiṃ gahapatiṃ mañcake nipātetvā sambandhitvā sīsacchaviṃ uppāṭetvā sibbiniṃ vināmetvā dve pāṇake nīharitvā mahājanassa dassesi.

VIN 4.8.205 rājagahaseṭṭhi vatthu
bhacca 2

masc. servant, dependant [√bhar] ✗
bhajati 1.1

pr. (+acc) associates (with); keeps company (with) [√bhaj + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning associates (with); keeps company (with)
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (associate, keep company)
Base √bhaj + a > bhaja
Construction bhaja + ti
Synonym sevati, upasevati
Sanskrit bhajati
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ,
yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ,
t'ādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
t'ādisaṃ bhajamānassa,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.

DHP 76 paṇḍitavaggo

nihīyati puriso nihīnasevī,
na ca hāyetha kadāci tulyasevī,
seṭṭham'upanamaṃ udeti khippaṃ,
tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethā'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

Examples

yasobhogasamappito,
yaṃ yaṃ padesaṃ bhajati,
tattha tatth'eva pūjito.

DHP 303 pakiṇṇakavaggo

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivittaṃ sen'āsanaṃ bhajati

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
bhajati 2.1

Construction bhaja + ti

Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Example

ye naṃ dadanti saddhāya,
vippasannena cetasā,
tam'eva annaṃ bhajati,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

methunaṃ vippajahe savibhūsaṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
bhajana

nt. association with [√bhaj] ✗
bhajanta 1

prp. (+acc) associating (with); keeping company (with) [√bhaj + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of bhajati, trans (+acc)
Meaning associating (with); keeping company (with)
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (associate, keep company)
Base √bhaj + a > bhaja
Construction bhaja + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym bhajamāna
Sanskrit bhajat
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Example

yathārūpe anāsane nisinnaṃ yathārūpe agocare carantaṃ yathārūpe pāpake mitte bhajantaṃ viññū sabrahmacārī pāpakesu ṭhānesu okappeyyuṃ, so tañ'ca anāsanaṃ tañ'ca agocaraṃ te ca pāpake mitte paṭisaṅkhā yoniso parivajjeti

bhajanta 2

Example

bhikkhuno vijigucchato,
bhajato rittam'āsanaṃ,
rukkhamūlaṃ susānaṃ vā,
pabbatānaṃ guhāsu vā.

kalyāṇamittatā muninā,
lokaṃ ādissa vaṇṇitā,
kalyāṇamitte bhajamāno,
api bālo paṇḍito assa.

THI 63 kisāgotamītherīgāthā
bhajamāna 2

prp. (+acc) resorting (to); retiring (to); lit. associating [√bhaj + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of bhajati, trans (+acc)

Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Example

patilīnacarassa bhikkhuno,
bhajamānassa vivittam'āsanaṃ,
sāmaggiyam'āhu tassa taṃ,
yo attānaṃ bhavane na dassaye.

bhaji 2

Sanskrit bhajitavya, bhajanīya
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Example

katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo.

sīh'āsane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

na harāmi na bhañjāmi,
ārā siṅghāmi vārijaṃ,
atha kena nu vaṇṇena,
gandhattheno'ti vuccati.

Example

Examples

Meaning hired worker; wage labourer
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar + ta + ka
bhaṭa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change rt > ṭ
Variant bhataka, bhatika
Commentary (THa) bhatako yathā'ti yathā bhatako parassa kammaṃ karonto kammasiddhiṃ anabhinandanto'pi kammaṃ karonto'va divasakkhayaṃ udikkhati, evaṃ aham'pi jīvitaṃ anabhinandanto'pi attabhāvassa yāpanena maraṇaṃ anabhinandanto'pi pariyosānakālaṃ paṭikaṅkhāmī'ti.
Sanskrit bhṛtaka
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)
bhaṭapatha

masc. official position; government job; lit. mode of employment [bhaṭa + patha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning official position; government job; lit. mode of employment
Construction bhaṭa + patha
Commentary (VINa) taññ'eva bhaṭapathaṃ yācissāmī'ti rañño keṇiṃ datvā puna taṃ'y'eva ṭhān'antaraṃ yācissāmī'ti cintento. (VBt) taññ'eva bhaṭapathan'ti taṃ'y'eva bhattavetanan'ti atthaṃ vadanti.
bhaṭasenā

fem. infantry ✗
bhaṭṭha 1.1

pp. (+abl) fallen down (from); dropped (from) [√bhas + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhassati (+abl)
Meaning fallen down (from); dropped (from)
Root Family √bhas
Root √bhas･3 ya (fall down)
Construction √bhas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit bhraṣṭā
Sanskrit Root √bhraś √bhraṅś 1, 4 (fall)

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ubhato bhaṭṭho ubhato parihīno, seyyathā'pi sā gāvī pabbateyyā bālā abyattā akhettaññū akusalā visame pabbate carituṃ.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ
bhaṭṭha 2.1

pp. spoken; said [√bhās + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhāsati, in comps
Meaning spoken; said
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction √bhās + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Synonym utta, udīrita, pabhāvita, pavutta, bhaṇita, bhāsita, lapita, vutta
Sanskrit bhāṣita
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Example

anusūyāyamāno so,
samma'd'aññāya bhāsati,
subhāsitaṃ anumodeyya,
dubbhaṭṭhe n'āpasādaye.

bhaṇata

pp. spoke, told, preached [√bhaṇ] ✗
bhaṇati 1

pr. (+acc) speaks; says; tells [√bhaṇ + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaks; says; tells
Root Family √bhaṇ
Root √bhaṇ･1 a (talk, speak)
Base √bhaṇ + a > bhaṇa
Construction bhaṇa + ti
Synonym akkhāti, ācikkhati, āmantayati, ārocayati, āroceti, kathayati, katheti, pabrūti, pāvadati, pilapati, bravīti, brūti, lapayati, vadati
Sanskrit bhaṇati
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

Examples

sace musā na bhaṇasi,
sace pāṇaṃ na hiṃsasi,
sace adinnaṃ n'ādiyasi,
saddahāno amaccharī,
kiṃ kāhasi gayaṃ gantvā,
udapāno'pi te gayā'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, rāhula, yassa kassaci sampajānamusāvāde n'atthi lajjā, n'āhaṃ tassa kiñci pāpaṃ akaraṇīyan'ti vadāmi. tasmā't'iha te, rāhula, hassā'pi na musā bhaṇissāmī'ti.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
bhaṇati 2

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena sā kumārikā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā tassā kumārikāya saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṃkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappesi kālayuttaṃ samullapanto kālayuttaṃ dhammaṃ bhaṇanto

bhaṇita 1

Root √bhaṇ･1 a (talk, speak)

Sanskrit bhaṇita
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

Example

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
bhaṇita 2

pp. (+instr) said (by); spoken (by); preached (by) [√bhaṇ + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of bhaṇati (+instr)
Meaning said (by); spoken (by); preached (by)

Root √bhaṇ･1 a (talk, speak)
Construction √bhaṇ + ita

Sanskrit bhaṇita
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

Examples

bhante nāgasena, bhāsitam'p'etaṃ tathāgatena, abyāvaṭā tumhe, ānanda, hotha tathāgatassa sarīrapūjāyā'ti. puna ca bhaṇitaṃ,
pūjetha naṃ pūjaniyassa dhātuṃ,
evaṃ karā saggamito gamissathā'ti.

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho

tucchaṃ musā vilapin'ti tucchakaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, musā mayā bhaṇitaṃ, abhūtaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, ajānantena mayā bhaṇitaṃ.

bhaṇitabba

Grammar ptp of bhaṇati

Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

alaṃ, bhaṇe jīvaka, tuyham'eva hotu. amhākaññ'eva antepure nivesanaṃ māpehī'ti.

alaṃ, bhikkhave, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ mā kalahaṃ mā viggahaṃ mā vivādan'ti

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
bhaṇḍanasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.125 (AN3.125) ✗
bhaṇḍanasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.50 (AN10.50) ✗
bhaṇḍanta

prp. (+instr) blaming; accusing; arguing (with) [√bhaṇḍ + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of bhaṇḍati, intrans (+instr)
Meaning blaming; accusing; arguing (with)
Root Family √bhaṇḍ
Root √bhaṇḍ･1 a (blame, accuse)
Base √bhaṇḍ + a > bhaṇḍa
Construction bhaṇḍa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym abhaṇḍanta
Sanskrit bhaṇḍat
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇḍ 1 (reprove)

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭiseneti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkosantaṃ paccakkosati, rosantaṃ paṭirosati, bhaṇḍantaṃ paṭibhaṇḍati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭiseneti.

nt. warehouse; storehouse; treasury [bhaṇḍa + agāra] ✓

Grammar nt, comp

MIL 2.3.10 milindapañho, saññālakkhaṇapañho
bhaṇḍāgārika

masc. warehouse keeper; storekeeper quartermaster; treasurer [bhaṇḍa + agāra + ika] ✓

Meaning warehouse keeper; storekeeper quartermaster; treasurer
Construction bhaṇḍa + agāra + ika
bhaṇḍāgāra + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Compound kammadhāraya (bhaṇḍa + agārika)
Sanskrit bhāṇḍa + āgārika

Example

opammaṃ karohī'ti. yathā, mahārāja, rañño bhaṇḍ'āgāriko bhaṇḍ'āgāraṃ pavisitvā nīlapītalohit'odātamañjiṭṭhāni rājabhogāni rūpāni passitvā sañjānāti. evaṃ kho, mahārāja, sañjānanalakkhaṇā saññā'ti.

MIL 2.3.10 milindapañho, saññālakkhaṇapañho
bhaṇḍānamuttama

nt. best goods; supreme merchandise; lit. best of wares [bhaṇḍānaṃ + uttama] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning best goods; supreme merchandise; lit. best of wares
Construction bhaṇḍānaṃ + uttama
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhaṇḍānaṃ + uttama)
Commentary (SNa) itthī'ti avissajjanīyabhaṇḍattā, itthī bhaṇḍānam'uttamaṃ, varabhaṇḍan'ti āha. atha vā sabbe'pi bodhisattā ca cakkavattino ca mātukucchiyaṃ'y'eva nibbattantī'ti, itthī bhaṇḍānam'uttaman'ti āha.
Sanskrit bhāṇḍānām + uttama

Examples

kiṃsu issariyaṃ loke,
kiṃsu bhaṇḍānam'uttamaṃ.
kiṃsu satthamalaṃ loke,
kiṃsu lokasmim'abbudaṃ.

SN 1.77 issariyasuttaṃ

vaso issariyaṃ loke,
itthī bhaṇḍānam'uttamaṃ,
kodho satthamalaṃ loke,
corā lokasmim'abbudā.

SN 1.77 issariyasuttaṃ
bhaṇḍi

aor. (+instr) quarrelled [√bhaṇḍ] ✗
bhaṇḍikā

fem. parcel; wrap; bundle [bhaṇḍa + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhaṇḍa
Meaning parcel; wrap; bundle
Construction bhaṇḍa + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Commentary (VINa) rajakabhaṇḍikan'ti rajakānaṃ bhaṇḍikaṃ. rajakā sāyanhasamaye nagaraṃ pavisantā bahūni vatthāni ek'ekaṃ bhaṇḍikaṃ bandhanti. tato ekaṃ bhaṇḍikaṃ tesaṃ pamādena apassantānaṃ avaharitvā thenetvā'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhāṇḍaka

Example

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū rajak'attharaṇaṃ gantvā rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avaharitvā ārāmaṃ haritvā bhājesuṃ.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ

Meaning bundled together; tied up together; lit. parcel bound
Construction bhaṇḍikā + ābaddha

bhaṇḍesi

aor. (+acc) quarrelled [√bhaṇḍ] ✗
bhata 1

pp. nurtured; raised; supported; borne [√bhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bharati
Meaning nurtured; raised; supported; borne
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Synonym edhita, paribhata
Sanskrit bhṛta
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

Example

yāya mātu bhato poso,
imaṃ lokaṃ avekkhati,
tam'pi pāṇadadiṃ santiṃ,
hanti kuddho puthujjano.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
bhata 2

masc. servant ✗
bhata 3

pp. laden; loaded [√bhar] ✗
bhataka

masc. hired worker; wage labourer [√bhar + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from bhata
Meaning hired worker; wage labourer
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar + ta + ka
bhata + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Variant bhaṭaka, bhatika
Commentary (THa) bhatako yathā'ti yathā bhatako parassa kammaṃ karonto kammasiddhiṃ anabhinandanto'pi kammaṃ karonto'va divasakkhayaṃ udikkhati, evaṃ aham'pi jīvitaṃ anabhinandanto'pi attabhāvassa yāpanena maraṇaṃ anabhinandanto'pi pariyosānakālaṃ paṭikaṅkhāmī'ti.
Sanskrit bhṛtaka
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

Examples

n'ābhinandāmi maraṇaṃ,
n'ābhinandāmi jīvitaṃ,
kālañ'ca paṭikaṅkhāmi,
nibbisaṃ bhatako yathā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

paṇḍito'ti samaññāto,
sāriputto akodhano,
app'iccho sorato danto,
kālaṃ kaṅkhati bhatako sudanto'ti.

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
bhatakavāda

masc. the word "hired worker"; the phrase "wage labourer" [bhataka + vāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning the word "hired worker"; the phrase "wage labourer"
Construction bhataka + vāda
Compound kammadhāraya (bhataka + vāda)
Commentary (UDa) bhatakavādenā'ti bhatako'ti vādena. yo hi bhatiyā kammaṃ karoti, so bhatako'ti vuccati, ayam'pi āyasmā accharāsambhoganimittaṃ brahmacariyaṃ caranto bhatako viya hotī'ti vuttaṃ bhatakavādenā'ti.
Sanskrit bhṛtaka + vāda

Example

atha kho āyasmato nandassa sahāyakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ nandaṃ bhatakavādena ca upakkitakavādena ca samudācaranti, bhatako kir'āyasmā nando upakkitako kir'āyasmā nando accharānaṃ hetu brahmacariyaṃ carati, bhagavā kir'assa pāṭibhogo pañcannaṃ accharāsatānaṃ paṭilābhāya kakuṭapādānan'ti.

piṇḍikāya carissāmi,
atthi jaṅghābalaṃ mamā'ti.

tatr'ime bhattantarāyā kapimiddho'pi bhattaṃ na bhuñjati, dukkhito'pi bhattaṃ na bhuñjati, byādhito'pi bhattaṃ na bhuñjati, uposathiko'pi bhattaṃ na bhuñjati, alābhaken'api bhattaṃ na bhuñjati.

VIN 1.4.1.10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
bhattavelā

fem. mealtime ✗
bhattasammada

masc. drowsiness after eating; passing out after eating; lit. food intoxication [bhatta + sammada] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning drowsiness after eating; passing out after eating; lit. food intoxication
Construction bhatta + sammada
Compound kammadhāraya (bhatta + sammada)
Commentary (SNa) bhattasammado'ti bhattamucchā bhattakilamatho. (SNa) bhattasammado'ti bhattapariḷāho. (VIBH) tattha katamo bhattasammado? yā bhuttāvissa bhattamucchā bhattakilamatho bhattapariḷāho kāyaduṭṭhullaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhattasammado.
Sanskrit bhakta + samada

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, arati tandī vijambhikā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ

AN 1.13 nīvaraṇappahānavaggo

niddā tandī vijambhitā,
aratī bhattasammado,
etena nappakāsati,
ariyamaggo idha pāṇinan'ti.

bhattādakasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.138 (AN5.138) ✗
bhattābhihāra 1

masc. mealtime; serving time; lit. bringing food [bhatta + abhihāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mealtime; serving time; lit. bringing food
Construction bhatta + abhihāra

Sanskrit bhakta + abhihāra

Examples

ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudassana, bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā mama bhatt'ābhihāre bhāsa. ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītithālipākasahassāni ahesuṃ, sāyaṃ pātaṃ bhatt'ābhihāro abhihariyittha.

Sanskrit bhakta + abhihāra

Example

bhattika 1.1

adj. who eats; eating [√bhaj + ta + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhatta
Meaning who eats; eating
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)

bhatta + ika

Sanskrit bhaktika
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, pariyāyabhattikassa pariyāyabhattikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

bhattu 1

masc. to husband; for master [√bhar + tar + u] ✓

Grammar masc, dat sg of bhattar
Meaning to husband; for master
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar + tar + u
bhattar + u
Phonetic Change r > t
Sanskrit bhartre
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

Examples

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo ye te bhattu abbhantarā kamm'antā, uṇṇā'ti vā kappāsā'ti vā, tattha dakkhā hoti analasā tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgatā alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
bhattu 2

masc. of husband; of master; belonging to husband [√bhar + tar + u] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of bhattar
Meaning of husband; of master; belonging to husband
Root Family √bhar
Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar + tar + u
bhattar + u
Phonetic Change r > t
Sanskrit bhartuḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

Examples

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano, dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, tesaṃ katañ'ca katato jānāti akatañ'ca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañ'ca bal'ābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañ'c'assa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

sa kho so, bhikkhave, paṇḍito byatto kusalo sūdo sakassa bhattu nimittaṃ uggaṇhāti, idaṃ vā me ajja bhattu sūpeyyaṃ ruccati, imassa vā abhiharati, imassa vā bahuṃ gaṇhāti, imassa vā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.

Example

yā evarūpā purisassa bhariyā,
bhaginī ca bhariyā’ti ca sā pavuccati.

aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi aṭṭhahi?

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

māro bhañji punappunaṃ.

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning foot of an auspicious sal tree
Construction bhadda + sālamūla
Commentary (SNa) bhaddasālamūle'ti pālileyyavāsino bhagavato dānaṃ datvā pālileyyato avidūre rakkhitavanasaṇḍo nāma atthi, tattha bhagavato paṇṇasālaṃ katvā ettha vasathā'ti paṭiññaṃ kāretvā vāsayiṃsu. bhaddasālo pana tatth'eko manāpo laddhako sālarukkho. bhagavā taṃ nagaraṃ upanissāya tasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe paṇṇasālasamīpe tasmiṃ rukkhamūle viharati. tena vuttaṃ bhaddasālamūle'ti.
bhaddaṃ vo

idiom. good luck to you!; bless you! ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pron, excl
Meaning good luck to you!; bless you!
Commentary (DHPa) bhaddaṃ vo'ti bhaddaṃ tumhākaṃ hotu, mā ahaṃ kapilo viya vināsaṃ pāpuṇathā'ti attho
Sanskrit bhadraṃ + te, bhadraṃ + vaḥ

Example

taṇhāya mūlaṃ khaṇatha,
usīr'attho'va bīraṇaṃ,
mā vo naḷaṃ'va soto'va,
māro bhañji punappunaṃ.

AN 6.14 bhaddakasuttaṃ

bhaddikā, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā. kalyāṇī, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā. piyā me, bhante, ñātisālohitā imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṃ, piyānam'pi me assa ñātisālohitānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya.

AN 4.193 bhaddiyasuttaṃ
bhaddikā 2

adj. fine; good quality; excellent; valuable [√bhad] ✗
bhaddikā 3

fem. well-behaved woman [√bhad] ✗
bhadditthivimānavatthu

nt. Vimānavatthu 22 (VV 22) ✗
bhaddiya 1

masc. name of an arahant; lit. lucky; fortunate [√bhad + ra + iya] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhadda
Meaning name of an arahant; lit. lucky; fortunate

Root √bhad×1 a (be good, lucky)
Construction √bhad + ra + iya
bhadda + iya

Phonetic Change r > d
Sanskrit bhadrika
Sanskrit Root √bhand 1 (be bright)

Example

upako palagaṇḍo ca,
pukkusāti ca te tayo,
bhaddiyo khaṇḍadevo ca,
bāhuraggi ca siṅgiyo.
te hitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
dibbayogaṃ upaccagun'ti.

AN 4.193 bhaddiyasuttaṃ
bhaddiya 3

nt. name of a town; capital of Aṅga; lit. lucky; fortunate [√bhad + ra + iya] ~

Grammar nt, from bhadda
Meaning name of a town; capital of Aṅga; lit. lucky; fortunate
Root Family √bhad
Root √bhad×1 a (be good, lucky)
Construction √bhad + ra + iya
bhadda + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Phonetic Change r > d
Commentary (ANa) bhaddiye'ti bhaddiyanagare.
Sanskrit bhadrika
Sanskrit Root √bhand 1 (be bright)
bhaddiyasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 55.48 (SN55.48) ✗
bhaddiyasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.193 (AN4.193) ✗
bhaddiyasutta 3

nt. Udāna 20 (UD 20) ✗
bhadde

fem. (used to address an esteemed woman) madam; ma’am; good lady [√bhad + rā + e] ✓

Grammar fem, voc sg of bhaddā
Meaning (used to address an esteemed woman) madam; ma’am; good lady
Root Family √bhad
Root √bhad×1 a (be good, lucky)
Construction √bhad + rā + e
bhaddā + e
Phonetic Change r > d
Synonym ayye
Sanskrit bhadra
Sanskrit Root √bhand 1 (be bright)

Example

sā vejjenāgantvā kīdisaṃ, bhadde'ti puṭṭhā, pubbe me akkhīni thokaṃ rujiṃsu, idāni pana atirekataraṃ rujantī'ti āha

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu
bhaddeka

adj. single auspicious (in reference to MN131 Bhaddekarattasutta) [bhadda + eka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning single auspicious (in reference to MN131 Bhaddekarattasutta)
Construction bhadda + eka
bhaddekaratta 1

nt. single auspicious night; (or) auspicious night alone [bhadda + ekaratta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning single auspicious night; (or) auspicious night alone
Construction bhadda + ekaratta
Commentary (MNa) bhadd'ekarattassā'ti vipassan'ānuyogasamannāgatattā bhaddakassa ekarattassa.
Sanskrit bhadra + ekarātra

Example

bhagavā etadavoca, bhadd'ekarattassa vo, bhikkhave, uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.

MN 131 bhaddekarattasuttaṃ
bhaddekaratta 2

adj. having a single auspicious night; (or) having an auspicious night alone [bhadda + ekaratta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having a single auspicious night; (or) having an auspicious night alone
Construction bhadda + ekaratta
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (bhadda + ekaratta)
Commentary (MNa) evaṃ paṭipannattā bhaddo ekaratto assā'ti bhaddekaratto. iti taṃ evaṃ paṭipannapuggalaṃ bhaddekaratto ayan'ti.
Sanskrit bhadra + ekarātra

Example

evaṃ vihāriṃ ātāpiṃ,
ahorattam'atanditaṃ.
taṃ ve bhadd'ekaratto'ti,
santo ācikkhate munī'ti.

MN 131 bhaddekarattasuttaṃ
bhaddekarattasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 131; Discourse on the Auspicious Single Night (MN131) [bhadda + ekaratta + sutta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Majjhima Nikāya 131; Discourse on the Auspicious Single Night (MN131)
Construction bhadda + ekaratta + sutta
Sanskrit bhadra + ekarātra + sūtra
bhadra 1

adj. fortunate; blessed; lucky; auspicious; good [√bhad + ra] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning fortunate; blessed; lucky; auspicious; good
Root Family √bhad
Root √bhad×1 a (be good, lucky)
Construction √bhad + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Synonym kalyāṇī, dhañña, bhadda, bhaddikā, maṅgala, sādhu, sirīmant, siva, sugatī, subhaga, subhagiya
Commentary (VINa) bhadro'ti apāpako (SNa) bhadrenā'ti bhaddakena.
Sanskrit bhadra
Sanskrit Root √bhand 1 (be bright)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu daharo hoti yuvā susu kāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo samayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ

attā hi attano nātho,
attā hi attano gati,
tasmā saññamay'attānaṃ,
assaṃ bhadraṃ'va vāṇijo.

DHP 380 bhikkhuvaggo
bhadra 2

masc. fortunate one; lucky guy; good man [√bhad + ra] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning fortunate one; lucky guy; good man
Root Family √bhad
Root √bhad×1 a (be good, lucky)
Construction √bhad + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Sanskrit bhadra
Sanskrit Root √bhand 1 (be bright)

Example

bhadro'pi passati pāpaṃ,
yāva bhadraṃ na paccati,
yadā ca paccati bhadraṃ,
atha bhadro bhadrāni passati.

bhadrakasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 42.11 (SN42.11) ✗
bhadramukha

masc. fine fellow; my dear; beautiful; lit. lucky face [bhadra + mukha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp

Examples

tam'enaṃ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā jātam'eva naṃ saṅghāṭikaṃ kareyyuṃ, saṅghāṭikattam'eva samādapeyyuṃ, ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, etadahosi, alaṃ dāni me aḍḍakaraṇena, bhadramukho dāni aḍḍakaraṇena paññāyissatī'ti.

SN 3.7 aḍḍakaraṇasuttaṃ
bhadrātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 9 (THI9) ✗
bhadrāvudhamāṇavapucchā

fem. Sutta Nipāta 5.13 (SNP 67) ✗
bhanta 1

pp. (of a human) staggering; swaying; spinning; lit. spun [√bham + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhamati
Meaning (of a human) staggering; swaying; spinning; lit. spun
Root Family √bham
Root √bham･1 a (turn, revolve, buzz)
√ In Comps bbham
Construction √bham + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change m > n
Sanskrit bhramita
Sanskrit Root √bhram 1, 4 (wander)

Example

ubbiggā tasitā bhītā,
bhantā byāthitamānasā,
mahājanā samāgamma,
dīpaṅkaram'upāgamuṃ.

BV 2.170 sumedha patthanā kathā
bhanta 2

pp. (of a vehicle) swerving; veering off course; out of control; lit. spun [√bham + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhamati
Meaning (of a vehicle) swerving; veering off course; out of control; lit. spun
Root Family √bham
Root √bham･1 a (turn, revolve, buzz)
√ In Comps bbham
Construction √bham + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change m > n
Variant vibbhanta, bhamanta
Commentary (SNa) bhantenā'ti ito cito ca paribbhamantena uddhatacārinā.
Sanskrit bhramita
Sanskrit Root √bhram 1, 4 (wander)

Examples

yo ve uppatitaṃ kodhaṃ,
rathaṃ bhantaṃ'va vāraye,
tam'ahaṃ sārathiṃ brūmi,
rasmiggāho itaro jano.

DHP 222 kodhavaggo

eko pubbe caritvāna,
methunaṃ yo nisevati,
yānaṃ bhantaṃ va taṃ loke,
hīnam'āhu puthujjanaṃ.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto vāt'erito calito bhanto ūmijāto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

masc. sir(s); lord(s); venerable sir(s); reverend(s) [√bhad + anta + e] ✓

bhadanta + e

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti. evam'evaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.

DN 14.13 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
bhabba 1

adj. (+inf or +dat) able (to); capable (of); possible (to); likely (to); fit (to); lit. to be [√bhū + *ya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of bhavati (+inf or +dat)
Meaning able (to); capable (of); possible (to); likely (to); fit (to); lit. to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav > bhab + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change ū > av
v > b
Antonym abhabba
Synonym kalla, khama, pahu, sakka, sakya, samattha
Variant bhabya
Commentary (MNa) bhabbo'ti anurūpo, anucchaviko.
Sanskrit bhavya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

catūh'apāyehi ca vippamutto,
cha c'ābhiṭhānāni bhabba kātuṃ,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo sammāsamādhiṃ upasampajja viharituṃ. katamehi pañcahi?

AN 5.113 sammāsamādhisuttaṃ
bhabba 2

adj. effective; operative; capable of producing a result; lit. to be [√bhū + *ya] ~

Meaning effective; operative; capable of producing a result; lit. to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav > bhab + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change ū > av
v > b
Sanskrit bhavya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)
bhabbatā

fem. ability; capability [√bhū + *ya + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from bhabba
Meaning ability; capability
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav > bhab + *ya + tā
bhabba + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change ū > av
v > b
y > b
Antonym abhabbatā
Synonym samatthatā
Sanskrit bhavyatā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

yassa kassaci ca abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññāsacchikiriyāya tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ
bhabbarūpa

adj. of good appearance; handsome; beautiful; lit. suitable form [bhabba + rūpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of good appearance; handsome; beautiful; lit. suitable form
Construction bhabba + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (bhabba + rūpa)
Synonym abhirūpa, sundarika
Sanskrit bhavyarūpa

Example

mohasambandhano loko,
bhabbarūpo'va dissati,
upadhibandhano bālo,
tamasā parivārito,
sassato'riva khāyati,
passato n'atthi kiñcanan'ti.

UD 70 utenasuttaṃ
bhabbarūpatā

fem. suitability of appearance; looking the part; lit. suitable form state [bhabba + rūpa + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from bhabbarūpa
Meaning suitability of appearance; looking the part; lit. suitable form state
Construction bhabba + rūpa + tā
bhabbarūpa + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Commentary (ANa) mā bhabbarūpatāyā'ti ayaṃ bhikkhu bhabbarūpo, imassa kathaṃ gahetuṃ yuttan'ti'pi mā gaṇhittha.
Sanskrit bhavya + rūpatā

Example

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
bhabbābhāsa

adj. appearing effective; seemingly operative [bhabba + ābhāsa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning appearing effective; seemingly operative
Construction bhabba + ābhāsa
bhabbhara

masc. crinkling sound; crackling sound [bhara + bhara] ✓

Grammar masc, onom
Meaning crinkling sound; crackling sound
Construction bhara + bhara > bhabbhara
Phonetic Change bhara + bhara > bhabbhara (contraction)
Variant bharabhara
Commentary (MNa) chinnabhabbharā'ti chinnabhabbharasaddā.
Sanskrit ?? gargara, bababā

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, biḷārabhastā madditā sumadditā suparimadditā, mudukā tūlinī chinnasassarā chinnabhabbharā. atha puriso āgaccheyya kaṭṭhaṃ vā kathalaṃ vā ādāya.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
bhabya

adj. who are able to be; who will be; who could be; lit. to be [√bhū + *ya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of bhavati
Meaning who are able to be; who will be; who could be; lit. to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav > bhab + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change ū > av
v > b
Variant bhabba
Sanskrit bhavya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

eso hi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto añña'd'atthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṃ.

MN 10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
bhamati

pr. (+loc) roams about (in); whirls about (in); spins about (in) [√bham + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning roams about (in); whirls about (in); spins about (in)
Root Family √bham
Root √bham･1 a (turn, revolve, buzz)
√ In Comps bbham
Base √bham + a > bhama
Construction bhama + ti
Sanskrit bhramati
Sanskrit Root √bhram 1, 4 (wander)

Example

jhāya bhikkhu mā pamādo,
mā te kāmaguṇe bhamassu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto,
mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.

DHP 371 bhikkhuvaggo
bhamanta

prp. revolving, whirling about, roaming [√bham] ✗
bhamara

masc. bee; bumblebee [√bham + ara] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhamati
Meaning bee; bumblebee
Root Family √bham
Root √bham･1 a (turn, revolve, buzz)
√ In Comps bbham
Construction √bham + ara
Derivative kita (ara)
Sanskrit bhramara
Sanskrit Root √bhram 1, 4 (wander)

Examples

yathā'pi bhamaro pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇagandham'aheṭhayaṃ,
paleti rasam'ādāya,
evaṃ gāme munī care.

DHP 49 pupphavaggo

tasmiṃ samaye mūlato paṭṭhāya yāva aggasākhā sabbaṃ ekapāliphullaṃ ahosi, sākh'antarehi c'eva pupph'antarehi ca pañcavaṇṇā bhamaragaṇā nānappakārā ca sakuṇasaṅghā madhurassarena vikūjantā vicaranti.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
bhamaragaṇa

Meaning swarm of bees

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
bhamarikā

fem. humming top [√bham] ✗
bhamassu

imp. (+loc) you yourself must spin about (in); you yourself must whirl about (in) [√bham + a + ssu] ✓

Grammar imp, reflx 2nd sg of bhamatu, intrans (+loc)
Meaning you yourself must spin about (in); you yourself must whirl about (in)
Root Family √bham
Root √bham･1 a (turn, revolve, buzz)
√ In Comps bbham
Base √bham + a > bhama
Construction bhama + ssu

Sanskrit bhramasva

Example

mā te kāmaguṇe bhamassu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto,
mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.

DHP 371 bhikkhuvaggo
bhami

aor. revolved, whirled about, roamed [√bham] ✗

fem. eyebrow ~

Meaning eyebrow

Notes MW suggests from √bhram (pāḷi √bham)
English Cognate brow
Sanskrit bhrū

Meaning in-between the eyebrows
Construction bhamukā + antara + e
bhamukantara + e
Commentary (MNa) bhamukantare'ti dvinnaṃ bhamukānaṃ vemajjhe nāsikamatthake'y'eva jātā
Sanskrit bhruvāntare

Example

uṇṇā kho pan'assa bhoto gotamassa bhamuk'antare jātā odātā mudutūlasannibhā, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
bhamukā

fem. eyebrow [bhamu + kā] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhamu
Meaning eyebrow
Construction bhamu + kā
Derivative taddhita (kā)
Synonym bhamu
Variant bhamukha
Notes MW suggests from √bhram (pāḷi √bham)
English Cognate brow
Sanskrit bhrū

Examples

uṇṇā kho pan'assa bhoto gotamassa bhamuk'antare jātā odātā mudutūlasannibhā, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

cakkhussa rahonāma na sakkā hoti akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇīyamāne bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne sīsaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne passituṃ. sotassa rahonāma na sakkā hoti pakatikathā sotuṃ.

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyatasikkhāpadaṃ
bhaya 1

adj. dangerous; perilous; frightening [√bhī + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhāyati
Meaning dangerous; perilous; frightening
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī > bhay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym abhaya
Synonym akkhema, saītika, sappaṭibhaya, sabhaya
Sanskrit bhaya
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Example

vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ,
appasattho mahaddhano,
visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va,
pāpāni parivajjaye.

DHP 123 pāpavaggo
bhaya 2

nt. (+loc) fear (of); terror (of); fright; dismay [√bhī + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bhāyati (+loc)
Meaning fear (of); terror (of); fright; dismay
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī > bhay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym abhaya
Synonym bhīta
Commentary (MNa) bhayaṃ sāvajj'aṭṭhena akusalaṃ
Sanskrit bhaya
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Examples

khīṇāya bhavanettiyā,
diṭṭhe dhamme yathātathe,
na bhayaṃ maraṇe hoti,
bhāranikkhepane yathā.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.

SN 11.3 dhajaggasuttaṃ
bhaya 3

nt. (+gen or +abl) danger (of; from); peril (of; from) [√bhī + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bhāyati (+gen or +abl)
Meaning danger (of; from); peril (of; from)
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī > bhay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym abhaya
Sanskrit bhaya
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Examples

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, bhayāni udak'orohantassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni. katamāni cattāri? ūmibhayaṃ, kumbhīlabhayaṃ, āvaṭṭabhayaṃ, susukābhayaṃ

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

pañcannaṃ dhīro bhayānaṃ na bhāye,
bhikkhu sato sapariyantacārī,
ḍaṃs'ādhipātānaṃ sarīsapānaṃ,
manussaphassānaṃ catuppadānaṃ.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
bhayakathā

Example

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu

fem. state of being motivated by fear; state of being driven by dread; lit. going by fear state [bhaya + gāmī + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from bhayagāmī
Meaning state of being motivated by fear; state of being driven by dread; lit. going by fear state
Construction bhaya + gāmī + tā
bhayagāmī + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Commentary (VINa) chandagāmitā … bhayagāmitā pāpentī'ti ete chandagāmino ca … bhayagāmino cā'ti evaṃ chandagāmitāya'pi … bhayagāmitāya'pi pāpenti, yojentī'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhaya + gāmin +
bhayagāmī

adj. motivated by fear; driven by dread; lit. going by fear [bhaya + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning motivated by fear; driven by dread; lit. going by fear
Construction bhaya + gāmī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhayena + gāmī)
Sanskrit bhaya + gāmin

Example

chandagāmino ca bhikkhū, dosagāmino ca bhikkhū, mohagāmino ca bhikkhū, bhayagāmino ca bhikkhū t'ādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti, ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti.

VIN PAT SA 13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
bhayaṅkara

adj. dreadful, horrible ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with fear
Construction bhaya + aṭṭa

Meaning startled by fear; threatened by danger
Construction bhaya + tajjita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhayena + tajjita)
Sanskrit bhaya + tarjita

Examples

bahuṃ ve saraṇaṃ yanti,
pabbatāni vanāni ca,
ārāmarukkhacetyāni,
manussā bhayatajjitā.

ye'pi'ssa te honti dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, te'pi daṇḍatajjitā bhayatajjitā assumukhā rudamānā parikammāni karonti.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
bhayatupaṭṭhāna

nt. appearance as fearful (stage in insight) ✗
bhayato

ind. as dangerous, as fearful [√bhī] ✗
bhayadassāvī

adj. (+loc) who has seen the danger (of); aware of the danger (in) [bhaya + dassāvī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning who has seen the danger (of); aware of the danger (in)
Construction bhaya + dassāvī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhayaṃ + dassāvī)
Variant bhayadassī
Commentary (SNa) bhayadassāvī'ti bhayadassī.
Sanskrit bhaya + darśin

Examples

ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti

sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
bhayadassī

adj. (+loc) knowing the danger (of); wary (of); fearful (of); apprehensive (of); lit. seeing danger [bhaya + dassī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning knowing the danger (of); wary (of); fearful (of); apprehensive (of); lit. seeing danger
Construction bhaya + dassī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhayaṃ + dassī)
Antonym abhayadassī
Variant bhayadassāvī
Sanskrit bhayadarśin

Examples

appamādarato bhikkhu,
pamāde bhayadassi vā,
saṃyojanaṃ aṇuṃ thūlaṃ,
ḍahaṃ aggī'va gacchati.

DHP 31 appamādavaggo

appamādarato bhikkhu,
pamāde bhayadassi vā,
abhabbo parihānāya,
nibbānass'eva santike'ti.

Meaning fearful and terrifying

Sanskrit bhaya + bhairava

Example

atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato avidūre mahantaṃ bhayabheravaṃ saddam'akāsi, apissudaṃ pathavī maññe undrīyati

SN 4.17 chaphassāyatanasuttaṃ
bhayabherava 2

masc. fear and terror; fright and dread [bhaya + bherava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fear and terror; fright and dread
Construction bhaya + bherava
Compound dvanda (bhaya ca bherava ca)
Commentary (MNa) bhayabheravan'ti bhayañ'ca bheravañ'ca. citt'utrāsassa ca bhayānakārammaṇassa cetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit bhaya + bhairava

Examples

upadhī te samatikkantā,
āsavā te padālitā,
sīho'si anupādāno,
pahīnabhayabheravo.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

bhayabheravasaho assaṃ, na ca maṃ bhayabheravo saheyya, uppannaṃ bhayabheravaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya vihareyyan'ti

Meaning who overcomes fear and terror

Examples

bhayabheravasaho hoti, na ca taṃ bhayabheravaṃ sahati, uppannaṃ bhayabheravaṃ abhibhuyya viharati.

appagabbho kulesu ananugiddho.

bhava 1

Examples

so karohi dīpam'attano,
khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava,
niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo,
dibbaṃ ariyabhūmiṃ upehisi.

DHP 236 malavaggo

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
dukkaraṃ durabhisambhavaṃ,
handa te naṃ pavakkhāmi,
santhambhassu daḷho bhava.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
bhava 2

masc. being; becoming; existence [√bhū + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhavati
Meaning being; becoming; existence
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Antonym vibhava
Synonym sambhava
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

bhavasaṃyojane ca kho appahīne bhavo'pi appahīno hotī'ti, iti vadaṃ dhammam'eva deseti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'cā'pi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
bhava 3

masc. state of existence; form of becoming [√bhū + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhavati
Meaning state of existence; form of becoming
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

kati pan'āvuso, bhavā'ti? tayo'me, āvuso, bhavā, kāmabhavo, rūpabhavo, arūpabhavo'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

passāmi loke pariphandamānaṃ,
pajaṃ imaṃ taṇhagataṃ bhavesu,
hīnā narā maccumukhe lapanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
bhava 4

nt. state of existence; form of becoming [√bhū + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bhavati
Meaning state of existence; form of becoming
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Commentary (ITIa) bhavānī'ti liṅgavipallāsena vuttaṃ, upapattibhavā sabbaso anavasesā nirujjhanti, na pavattanti.
Notes normally masc
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

duve imā cakkhumatā pakāsitā,
nibbānadhātū anissitena tādinā,
ekā hi dhātu idha diṭṭhadhammikā,
saupādisesā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
anupādisesā pana samparāyikā,
yamhi nirujjhanti bhavāni sabbaso.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ
bhava 5

masc. well-being; prosperity; development [√bhū + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhavati
Meaning well-being; prosperity; development
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Antonym vibhava, abhava
Commentary (DHPa) bhavāya vibhavāya cā'ti vuddhiyā ca avuddhiyā ca.
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

yogā ve jāyatī bhūri,
ayogā bhūrisaṅkhayo,
etaṃ dvedhāpathaṃ ñatvā,
bhavāya vibhavāya ca,
tath'āttānaṃ niveseyya,
yathā bhūri pavaḍḍhati.

DHP 282 maggavaggo
bhavagga

nt. the highest existence; superior state of being [bhava + agga] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning the highest existence; superior state of being
Construction bhava + agga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + agga)
Sanskrit bhavāgra
bhavaṅga 1

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning life-continuum consciousness; lit. factor of being
Construction bhava + aṅga
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bhavassa + aṅga)
bhavaṅga 2

nt. sub- consciousness ✗

Meaning ?? attainment of the fruit of the life-continuum

Meaning like the stream of life-continuum
Construction bhavaṅga + sota + sadisa
bhavacakka

nt. wheel of rebirth ✗
bhavajātika

adj. born from being; produced by existence [bhava + jātika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from being; produced by existence

bhavajjhosāna

nt. clinging to being; attachment to existence [bhava + ajjhosāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning clinging to being; attachment to existence
Construction bhava + ajjhosāna
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavesu + ajjhosāna)
Sanskrit bhava + adhyavasāya

Example

tassa bhavānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo bhavesu bhavarāgo bhavanandī bhavasneho bhavamucchā bhavapipāsā bhavapariḷāho bhav'ajjhosānaṃ bhavataṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavataṇhā

fem. craving for becoming; craving for existence [bhava + taṇhā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning craving for becoming; craving for existence
Construction bhava + taṇhā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavamhi + taṇhā)
Sanskrit bhava + tṛṣṇā

Examples

ye bhūtaṃ bhūtato disvā,
bhūtassa ca atikkamaṃ,
yathābhūte vimuccanti,
bhavataṇhā parikkhayā.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ

y'āyaṃ taṇhā ponobhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā

DN 22.16 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
bhavatasinā

fem. thirst for existence [bhava + tasinā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning thirst for existence
Construction bhava + tasinā
bhavataṃ

masc. of the sirs; of the masters; of you all [√bhū + a + anta + ānaṃ] ✓

Grammar masc, gen pl of bhavant, irreg
Meaning of the sirs; of the masters; of you all
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + anta + ānaṃ > ataṃ
bhavanta + ataṃ
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavatām
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

kāmaṃ kho pana m'āhu paro loko, hotu nesaṃ bhavataṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ saccaṃ vacanaṃ, atha ca pan'āyaṃ bhavaṃ purisapuggalo diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ gārayho

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
bhavati 1

pr. (+nom) is; is being; becomes [√bhū + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+nom)
Meaning is; is being; becomes
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + ti
Phonetic Change ū > av
Synonym bhoti, hoti
Sanskrit bhavati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

tama't'agge mete, ānanda, bhikkhū bhavissanti ye keci sikkhākāmā'ti

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ

tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma. evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhavati 2

pr. (+dat) exists (for) [√bhū + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+dat)
Meaning exists (for)
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + ti
Phonetic Change ū > av
Synonym hoti, tiṭṭhati
Sanskrit bhavati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

saritāni sinehitāni ca,
somanassāni bhavanti jantuno,
te sātasitā sukh'esino,
te ve jātijar'ūpagā narā.

DHP 341 taṇhāvaggo

hoti so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ mahāsamuddo ussussati visussati na bhavati, na tv'ev'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi.

SN 22.99 gaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
bhavatta

nt. fact of being [√bhū + *a + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from bhava
Meaning fact of being
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *a + tta
bhava + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhava +
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)
bhavattaya

nt. three states of existence ✗
bhavattha

pr. (+nom) you all are [√bhū + a + tha] ✓

Grammar pr 2nd pl of bhavati, irreg form of bhavatha, intrans (+nom)
Meaning you all are
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + tha > bhavattha
Phonetic Change ū > av
Synonym attha
Variant bhavatha
Sanskrit bhavatha
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

evaṃ mano chassu yadā subhāvito,
phuṭṭhassa cittaṃ na vikampate kvaci,
te rāgadose abhibhuyya bhikkhavo,
bhavattha jātimaraṇassa pāragā'ti.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
bhavadiṭṭhi

fem. view of existence; belief in being [bhava + diṭṭhi] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning view of existence; belief in being
Construction bhava + diṭṭhi
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavasmiṃ + diṭṭhi)
Antonym vibhavadiṭṭhi
Commentary (MNa) bhavadiṭṭhī'ti sassatadiṭṭhi.
Sanskrit bhava + dṛṣṭi

Example

dve'mā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiyo, bhavadiṭṭhi ca vibhavadiṭṭhi ca.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

Sanskrit bhavana
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

patilīnacarassa bhikkhuno,
bhajamānassa vivittam'āsanaṃ,
sāmaggiyam'āhu tassa taṃ,
yo attānaṃ bhavane na dassaye.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6

samantam'asāro loko,
disā sabbā sameritā,
icchaṃ bhavanam'attano,
n'āddasāsiṃ anositaṃ.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavanidāna

adj. having being as origin [bhava + nidāna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having being as origin
Construction bhava + nidāna
bhavanirodha

masc. ending of becoming; cessation of being; end of existence; (comm) Nibbāna [bhava + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of becoming; cessation of being; end of existence; (comm) Nibbāna
Construction bhava + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + nirodha)
Commentary (MNa) bhavanirodho'ti nibbānaṃ.
Sanskrit bhava + nrodha

Examples

evaṃdiṭṭhino, bhikkhave, etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, yā c'āyaṃ bhave appaṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissati. yā c'āyaṃ bhavanirodhe pāṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissatī'ti.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ
bhavanirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the ending of existence; leading to the cessation of being [bhavanirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of existence; leading to the cessation of being
Construction bhavanirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhavanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit bhava + nirodha + gāmin

Example

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako bhavañ'ca pajānāti, bhavasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, bhavanirodhañ'ca pajānāti, bhavanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
bhavanetti

fem. conduit to existence; channel to becoming [bhava + netti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning conduit to existence; channel to becoming
Construction bhava + netti
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhavaṃ + netti)
Sanskrit bhava + netrī

Examples

pariciṇṇo mayā satthā,
kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ,
ohito garuko bhāro,
bhavanetti samūhatā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

khīṇāya bhavanettiyā,
diṭṭhe dhamme yathātathe,
na bhayaṃ maraṇe hoti,
bhāranikkhepane yathā.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
bhavanettikhīṇa

adj. who have worn away the conduit to existence; who have destroyed the channel to becoming [bhavanetti + khīṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who have worn away the conduit to existence; who have destroyed the channel to becoming
Construction bhavanetti + khīṇa
bhavanettinirodha

masc. ending of the conduit to existence; cessation of the channel to becoming [bhavanetti + nirodha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of the conduit to existence; cessation of the channel to becoming
Construction bhavanetti + nirodha
bhavanettisaṅkhaya

masc. destruction of the conduit to existence; ending of the channel to becoming; (comm) extinction of craving [bhava + netti + saṅkhaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning destruction of the conduit to existence; ending of the channel to becoming; (comm) extinction of craving
Construction bhava + netti + saṅkhaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavanettiyā + saṅkhaya)
Commentary (ITIa) bhavanettisaṅkhayā'ti bhavanettiyā taṇhāya parikkhayā.
Sanskrit bhava + netrī + saṃkṣaya

Examples

duve imā cakkhumatā pakāsitā,
nibbānadhātū anissitena tādinā,
ekā hi dhātu idha diṭṭhadhammikā,
saupādisesā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
anupādisesā pana samparāyikā,
yamhi nirujjhanti bhavāni sabbaso.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ

ye etadaññāya padaṃ asaṅkhataṃ,
vimuttacittā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
te dhammasār'ādhigamā khaye ratā,
pahaṃsu te sabbabhavāni tādino'ti.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ
bhavanettisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 23.3 (SN23.3) ✗
bhavant

masc. master; sir; friend; respected person; lit. being present [√bhū + *ant] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhavati, irreg
Meaning master; sir; friend; respected person; lit. being present
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *ant
Derivative kita (*ant)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Synonym ayya, bhavaṃ, bho, sāmī
Sanskrit bhavan
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

labheyya nu kho so coro coraghātesu, āgamentu tāva bhavanto coraghātā, amukasmiṃ me gāme vā nigame vā mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā, yāvāhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti

DN 23.5 pāyāsisuttaṃ

handa, kuto nu bhavaṃ vacchāyano āgacchati divādivassā'ti?

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
bhavanta

prp. becoming, existing [√bhū] ✗
bhavantaga

adj. gone to the end of existence ✗
bhavantagū

adj. gone to the end of existence ✗
bhavantara

nt. another existence ✗
bhavantarūpa

masc. gentleman such as yourself; such a respectable person [bhavanta + rūpa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning gentleman such as yourself; such a respectable person
Construction bhavanta + rūpa
bhavantaṃ

masc. sir, master, good man (respectful address) [√bhū] ✗
bhavanti vattāro

idiom. (+dat) there will be those who say (to); lit. there are speakers ✓

Grammar idiom, pr + masc (+dat)
Meaning there will be those who say (to); lit. there are speakers
Sanskrit bhavanti + vaktāraḥ

Examples

tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā āgamaṃ pariyāpuṇassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro.

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ
bhavanto

masc. sirs, masters, good men (respectful address) [√bhū] ✗
bhavapaccayā

Example

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
bhavapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 38.13 (SN38.13) ✗
bhavapaṭilābhiya

Meaning related to acquiring existence; getting (another) existence

Commentary (ANa) bhavapaṭilābhiyānī'ti upapattibhavassa paṭilābhāya paccayāni.
bhavapariḷāha

masc. fever for being; burning passion for existence [bhava + pariḷāha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fever for being; burning passion for existence

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavapareta

adj. afflicted by being; overwhelmed by existence [bhava + pareta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted by being; overwhelmed by existence
Construction bhava + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhavena + pareta)
Sanskrit bhava + parīta

Example

aññathābhāvī bhavasatto loko,
bhavapareto bhavam'ev'ābhinandati,
yadabhinandati taṃ bhayaṃ,
yassa bhāyati taṃ dukkhaṃ,
bhavavippahānāya kho pan'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ vussati.

UD30 lokasuttaṃ
bhavapipāsā

fem. thirst for being; craving for existence [bhava + pipāsā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning thirst for being; craving for existence
Construction bhava + pipāsā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavesu + pipāsā)
Sanskrit bhava + pipāsā

Example

tassa bhavānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo bhavesu bhavarāgo bhavanandī bhavasneho bhavamucchā bhavapipāsā bhavapariḷāho bhav'ajjhosānaṃ bhavataṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavappabhava

adj. generated by being [bhava + pabhava] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning generated by being
Construction bhava + pabhava
bhavabandhana

nt. attachment to existence; bondage to being [bhava + bandhana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning attachment to existence; bondage to being
Construction bhava + bandhana
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhave + bandhana)
Synonym bhavasaṃyojana
Sanskrit bhava + bandhana

Example

kusalī bhāsasī tesaṃ,
mārapāsappahāyinaṃ,
kassa te dhammam'aññāya,
acchiduṃ bhavabandhanan'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
bhavabandhanacchida

adj. who has severed attachment to existence; who has broken bondage to being [bhavabandhana + chida] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has severed attachment to existence; who has broken bondage to being
Construction bhavabandhana + chida
bhavamatthu

sandhi. may you be well!; may you be happy!; lit. may one be well! [bhavaṃ + atthu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + imp
Meaning may you be well!; may you be happy!; lit. may one be well!
Construction bhavaṃ + atthu
Sanskrit bhavika + astu

Example

bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti

DN 19.7 mahāgovindasuttaṃ
bhavamāna 1

prp. (+nom) being possible; lit. being; existing [√bhū + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning being possible; lit. being; existing
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Commentary (MNa) kiṃ so bhavamāno saccako nigaṇṭhaputto, yo bhagavato vādaṃ āropessatī'ti yo saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati, so kiṃ bhavamāno kiṃ yakkho bhavamāno udāhu indo, udāhu brahmā bhavamāno bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati? na hi sakkā pakatimanussena bhagavato vādaṃ āropetun'ti ayam'ettha adhippāyo.
Sanskrit bhavamāna
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

ekacce licchavī evam'āhaṃsu, kiṃ so bhavamāno saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yo bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati, atha kho bhagavā saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa vādaṃ āropessatī'ti?

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
bhavamāna 2

prp. (+nom) becoming, existing [√bhū] ✗
bhavamicchi

aor. wished for the well-being (of); desired the prosperity (of) [bhavaṃ + icchi] ~

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning wished for the well-being (of); desired the prosperity (of)
Construction bhavaṃ + icchi
Commentary (SNa) bhavam'icchisan'ti vuḍḍhiṃ patthayiṃ.
bhavamucchā

fem. infatuation with being; fixation on existence [bhava + mucchā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning infatuation with being; fixation on existence
Construction bhava + mucchā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavesu + mucchā)
Sanskrit bhava + mūrchā

Example

tassa bhavānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo bhavesu bhavarāgo bhavanandī bhavasneho bhavamucchā bhavapipāsā bhavapariḷāho bhav'ajjhosānaṃ bhavataṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavamūla

nt. root of existence; source of being [bhava + mūla] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning root of existence; source of being
Construction bhava + mūla
bhavayoga

masc. bond of being; bondage of existence [bhava + yoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bond of being; bondage of existence
Construction bhava + yoga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavesu + yoga)
Commentary (ANa) rūp'ārūpabhavesu chandarāgo bhavayogo, tathā jhānanikanti ... bhavesu yojetī'ti bhavayogo.
Sanskrit bhava + yoga

Example

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, yogā. katame cattāro? kāmayogo, bhavayogo, diṭṭhiyogo, avijjāyogo.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavayogayutta

adj. harnessed to the yoke of becoming; bound to the yoke of existence; lit. yoked by the yoke of being [bhavayoga + yutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning harnessed to the yoke of becoming; bound to the yoke of existence; lit. yoked by the yoke of being
Construction bhavayoga + yutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhavayogena + yutta)
Commentary (ITIa) rūp'ārūpabhavesu chandarāgo bhavayogo, tathā jhānanikanti sassatadiṭṭhisahagato ca rāgo, tena yutto bhavayogayutto, appahīnabhavarāgo'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhava + yoga + yukta

Example

kāmayogayutto, bhikkhave, bhavayogayutto āgāmī hoti āgantā itthattaṃ. kāmayogavisaṃyutto, bhikkhave, bhavayogayutto anāgāmī hoti anāgantā itthattaṃ.

ITI96 kāmayogasuttaṃ
bhavayogavisaññoga

masc. detachment from the bondage of existence [bhavayoga + visaññoga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning detachment from the bondage of existence
Construction bhavayoga + visaññoga
bhavayogavisaṃyutta

adj. unharnessed from the yoke of becoming; detached from the bond of being; lit. unyoked from the yoke of being [bhavayoga + visaṃyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning unharnessed from the yoke of becoming; detached from the bond of being; lit. unyoked from the yoke of being
Construction bhavayoga + visaṃyutta
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (bhavayogamhā + visaṃyutta)
Sanskrit bhava + yoga + visaṃyukta

Example

kāmayogavisaṃyutto, bhikkhave, bhavayogayutto anāgāmī hoti anāgantā itthattaṃ. kāmayogavisaṃyutto, bhikkhave, bhavayogavisaṃyutto arahā hoti, khīṇ'āsavo'ti. etam'atthaṃ bhagavā avoca.

ITI96 kāmayogasuttaṃ
bhavayogavisaṃyoga

masc. detachment from the bond of being; disconnection from bondage to existence [bhavayoga + visaṃyoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning detachment from the bond of being; disconnection from bondage to existence
Construction bhavayoga + visaṃyoga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavayogamhā + visaṃyoga)
Commentary (ANa) kāmayogavisaṃyogo'ti kāmayogato visaṃyojanakāraṇaṃ. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit bhava + visaṃyoga

Example

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, visaṃyogā. katame cattāro? kāmayogavisaṃyogo, bhavayogavisaṃyogo, diṭṭhiyogavisaṃyogo, avijjāyogavisaṃyogo.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavarata

adj. delighted with being; enjoying existence; taking pleasure in being; devoted to existence [bhava + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning delighted with being; enjoying existence; taking pleasure in being; devoted to existence
Construction bhava + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhave + rata)
Sanskrit bhava + rata

Examples

bhavarāmāya vata, bho, pajāya bhavaratāya bhavasammuditāya samūlaṃ bhavaṃ udabbahī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ
bhavarāga

masc. passion for existence; desire to be; desire to become [bhava + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning passion for existence; desire to be; desire to become
Construction bhava + rāga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhave + rāga)
Sanskrit bhava + rāga

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, aniccasaññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā sabbaṃ kāmarāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ rūparāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ bhavarāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ avijjaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ asmimānaṃ samūhanati.

SN 22.102 aniccasaññāsuttaṃ

āsīsanti thomayanti abhijappanti juhanti,
kām'ābhijappanti paṭicca lābhaṃ,
te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā,
n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3
bhavarāgapareta

adj. afflicted with passion for existence; overcome by the desire to be; overwhelmed by the desire to become [bhavarāga + pareta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with passion for existence; overcome by the desire to be; overwhelmed by the desire to become
Construction bhavarāga + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhavarāgena + pareta)
bhavarāgasaññojana

nt. bond of passion for existence; fetter of desire to exist [bhavarāga + saññojana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bond of passion for existence; fetter of desire to exist
Construction bhavarāga + saññojana
bhavarāgasaṃyojana
