Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bond of passion for existence; fetter of the desire to exist
Construction bhavarāga + saṃyojana
bhavarāgānusaya

masc. underlying tendency towards passion for existence; inherent inclination to desire to become; lit. lust for being sleeping alongside [bhava + rāga + anusaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning underlying tendency towards passion for existence; inherent inclination to desire to become; lit. lust for being sleeping alongside
Construction bhava + rāga + anusaya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bhavarāgassa + anusaya)
Sanskrit bhava + rāga + anuśaya

Example

kāmarāg'ānusayassa ... paṭigh'ānusayassa ... diṭṭh'ānusayassa ... vicikicch'ānusayassa ... mān'ānusayassa ... bhavarāg'ānusayassa ... avijj'ānusayassa pahānāya samucchedāya brahmacariyaṃ vussati.

AN 7.12 dutiānusayassayānusayasuttaṃ
bhavarāgānusārī

adj. following passion for existence; acting according to the desire to be; motivated by the desire to become [bhavarāga + anusārī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning following passion for existence; acting according to the desire to be; motivated by the desire to become
Construction bhavarāga + anusārī
bhavarāma

adj. pleased by existence; enjoying being [bhava + rāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleased by existence; enjoying being
Construction bhava + rāma
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhave + rāma)
Sanskrit bhava + rāma

Example

bhavarāmāya vata, bho, pajāya bhavaratāya bhavasammuditāya samūlaṃ bhavaṃ udabbahī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
bhavalobhajappā

fem. desire and yearning for existence [bhava + lobha + jappā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning desire and yearning for existence
Construction bhava + lobha + jappā
Commentary (SN) bhavalobhajappan'ti bhavalobhasaṅkhātaṃ taṇhaṃ.
bhavavippahāna

nt. abandoning of being; giving up existence [bhava + vippahāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning abandoning of being; giving up existence
Construction bhava + vippahāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + vippahāna)
Commentary (UDa) tattha bhavavippahānāyā'ti kām'ādibhavassa pajahan'atthāya.
Sanskrit bhava + viprahāṇa

Example

aññathābhāvī bhavasatto loko,
bhavapareto bhavam'ev'ābhinandati,
yadabhinandati taṃ bhayaṃ,
yassa bhāyati taṃ dukkhaṃ,
bhavavippahānāya kho pan'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ vussati.

UD30 lokasuttaṃ
bhavavimokkha

masc. liberation from being; freedom from existence [bhava + vimokkha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning liberation from being; freedom from existence
Construction bhava + vimokkha
bhavavimokkhasaññī

adj. perceiving liberation from being [bhavavimokkha + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning perceiving liberation from being
Construction bhavavimokkha + saññī
bhavasaṅkhāra

masc. intention to live; will to exist ✗
bhavasatta

adj. attached to being; clinging to existence [bhava + satta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attached to being; clinging to existence
Construction bhava + satta
Commentary (SNa) aññathābhāvī bhavasatto loko bhavamevābhinandatī'ti aññathābhāvaṃ vipariṇāmaṃ upagamanena aññathābhāvī hutvā'pi bhavesu satto laggo lagito palibuddho ayaṃ loko bhavaṃ'y'eva abhinandati.
bhavasamudaya 1

masc. source of being; arising of existence [bhava + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of being; arising of existence
Construction bhava + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + samudaya)
Sanskrit bhava + samudaya

Example

bhavasamudayā jātisamudayo, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo jātinirodhagāminī paṭipadā

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
bhavasamudaya 2

adj. arising from being [bhava + samudaya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning arising from being
Construction bhava + samudaya
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (bhavamhā + samudaya)
Commentary (MNa) bhavasamudayā'ti ettha pana jātiyā paccayabhūto kammabhavo veditabbo.
bhavasammudita

adj. pleased with being; enjoying existence; happy to be [bhava + sammudita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleased with being; enjoying existence; happy to be
Construction bhava + sammudita
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhave + sammudita)
Sanskrit bhava + sumudita

Examples

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ

bhavarāmāya vata, bho, pajāya bhavaratāya bhavasammuditāya samūlaṃ bhavaṃ udabbahī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
bhavasalla

nt. barb of being; arrow of existence; (comm) dart leading to being [bhava + salla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning barb of being; arrow of existence; (comm) dart leading to being
Construction bhava + salla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + salla)
Commentary (DHPa) acchindi bhavasallānī'ti sabbāni'pi bhavagāmīni sallāni acchindi.
Sanskrit bhava + śalya

Example

niṭṭhaṅ'gato asantāsī,
vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni,
antimo'yaṃ samussayo.

DHP 351 taṇhāvaggo
bhavasaṃyojana

nt. bondage to being; chain to existence [bhava + saṃyojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bondage to being; chain to existence
Construction bhava + saṃyojana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + saṃyojana)
Sanskrit bhava + saṃyojana

Examples

yesaṃ kesañci bhavasaṃyojanaṃ appahīnaṃ, sabbe te sadukkhā saupaghātā saupāyāsā sapariḷāhā micchāpaṭipannā'ti, iti vadaṃ itth'eke apasādeti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

bhavasaṃyojane ca kho appahīne bhavo'pi appahīno hotī'ti, iti vadaṃ dhammam'eva deseti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
bhavasaṃyojanakkhaya

masc. wearing away the chain of existence; exhausting the bond of being [bhava + saṃyojana + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away the chain of existence; exhausting the bond of being
Construction bhava + saṃyojana + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavasaṃyojanassa + khaya)
Sanskrit bhava + saṃyojana + kṣaya

Example

tato aññā vimuttassa,
ñāṇaṃ ve hoti tādino,
akuppā me vimuttī'ti,
bhavasaṃyojanakkhayā.

ITI 62 indriyasuttaṃ
bhavasāta

nt. attraction in being, pleasure of being ✗
bhavasātabaddha

adj. tied to the pleasure of existence; bound to the pleasure of being [bhava + sāta + baddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning tied to the pleasure of existence; bound to the pleasure of being
Construction bhava + sāta + baddha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhavasātaṃ + baddha)
Sanskrit bhava + śāta + baddha

Example

icchānidānā bhavasātabaddhā,
te duppamuñcā na hi aññamokkhā,
pacchā pure v'āpi apekkhamānā,
ime'va kāme purime'va jappaṃ.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
bhavasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.164 (SN45.164) ✗
bhavasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.105 (AN6.105) ✗
bhavasota

masc. stream of existence; current of being [bhava + sota] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning stream of existence; current of being
Construction bhava + sota
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + sota)
Sanskrit bhava + srotas

Example

tesaṃ phassaparetānaṃ,
bhavasota-anusārinaṃ,
kummaggapaṭipannānaṃ,
ārā saṃyojanakkhayo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
bhavasotānusārī

adj. flowing along the stream of being; following the current of existence [bhava + sota + anusārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning flowing along the stream of being; following the current of existence
Construction bhava + sota + anusārī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhavasotaṃ + anusārī)
Commentary (SNa) bhavasot'ānusārīsū'ti vaṭṭasotaṃ anusarantesu.
Sanskrit bhava + srotas + anusārin

Examples

tesaṃ phassaparetānaṃ,
bhavasot'ānusārinaṃ,
kummaggapaṭipannānaṃ,
ārā saṃyojanakkhayo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

tesu ussukkajātesu,
bhavasot'ānusārisu,
ke'dha taṇhaṃ pajahiṃsu,
ke lokasmiṃ anussukā'ti.

SN 1.28 mahaddhanasuttaṃ
bhavasneha

masc. affection for being; love for sensual existence [bhava + sneha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning affection for being; love for sensual existence
Construction bhava + sneha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavesu + sneha)
Sanskrit bhava + sneha

Example

tassa bhavānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo bhavesu bhavarāgo bhavanandī bhavasneho bhavamucchā bhavapipāsā bhavapariḷāho bhav'ajjhosānaṃ bhavataṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
bhavassāda

masc. gratification in being; satisfaction in existence ✗
bhavaṃ 1

masc. venerable; respectable person; honourable person; lit. being present [√bhū + a + anta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar masc, nom sg of bhavant, irreg
Meaning venerable; respectable person; honourable person; lit. being present
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + anta + aṃ
bhavant + aṃ
Phonetic Change ū > av
Antonym parābhavo
Sanskrit bhavān
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

suvijāno bhavaṃ hoti,
suvijāno parābhavo,
dhammakāmo bhavaṃ hoti,
dhammadessī parābhavo.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6

puṭṭho kho pana pañh'ābhinīto ahāpetvā alambitvā paripūraṃ vitthārena parassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti. veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ayaṃ bhavan'ti.

AN 4.73 sappurisasuttaṃ
bhavaṃ 2

masc. master; sir; you [√bhū + a + anta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar masc, nom sg of bhavant, irreg
Meaning master; sir; you
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + anta + aṃ
bhavant + aṃ
Phonetic Change ū > av
Synonym ayya, bhavant, sāmī
Sanskrit bhavān
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

kim'etaṃ bhavaṃ gotamo āha puna bhavaṃ gotamo bravitū'ti

DN 3.7 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ

atha ca pana bhavaṃ gotamo evam'āha, aham'pi kho, brāhmaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhavātha

imp. (+nom) you all must be! [√bhū + a + atha] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd pl of bhavatu, irreg form of bhavatha, intrans (+nom)
Meaning you all must be!
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + atha > bhavātha
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ā
Sanskrit bhavata
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho,
ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,
samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.

DHP 144 daṇḍavaggo
bhavābhava

masc. existence or non-existence; being and non-being; any state of existence; (comm) repeated existence [bhava + abhava] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning existence or non-existence; being and non-being; any state of existence; (comm) repeated existence
Construction bhava + abhava
Compound dvanda (bhava ca abhava ca)
Commentary (SNPa) bhav'ābhavesū'ti kāmabhav'ādīsu. atha vā bhav'ābhavesū'ti bhavabhavesu, punappunabhavesū'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit bhavābhava

Examples

yass'ūbhay'ante paṇidh'īdha n'atthi,
bhav'ābhavāya idha vā huraṃ vā,
nivesanā tassa na santi keci,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

vidvā ca yo vedagū naro idha,
bhav'ābhave saṅgamimaṃ visajja,
so vītataṇho anīgho nirāso,
atāri so jātijaranti brūmī'ti.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
bhavābhinandī

adj. who delights in existence; loving life; very happy with life [bhava + abhinandī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who delights in existence; loving life; very happy with life
Construction bhava + abhinandī
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavasmiṃ + abhinandī)
Sanskrit bhava + abhinandin

Example

ye tuyha chandena vasena vattino,
narā ca nārī ca anubhonti yaṃ sukhaṃ,
aviddasū māravas'ānuvattino,
bhav'ābhinandī tava citta sāvakā'ti.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhavāma

pr. (+nom) we are; we become [√bhū + a + āma] ✓

Grammar pr 1st pl of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning we are; we become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + āma
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavāmaḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

tvaññ'eva no citta karosi brāhmaṇo,
tvaṃ khattiyo rājadasī karosi,
vessā ca suddā ca bhavāma ekadā,
devattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhavāmase

imp. (+nom) we ourselves must become [√bhū + a + āmase] ✓

Grammar imp, reflx 1st pl of bhavatu, intrans (+nom)
Meaning we ourselves must become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + āmase
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavāmahai
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

tav'eva hetū asurā bhavāmase,
tvaṃmūlakaṃ nerayikā bhavāmase,
atho tiracchānagatā'pi ekadā,
petattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhavārāma

adj. enjoying being; taking pleasure in existence; fond of life [bhava + ārāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enjoying being; taking pleasure in existence; fond of life
Construction bhava + ārāma
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhavasmiṃ + ārāma)
Sanskrit bhava + ārāma

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ
bhavāsava

masc. effluent of becoming; effluent of being [bhava + āsava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning effluent of becoming; effluent of being
Construction bhava + āsava
Compound kammadhāraya (bhava + āsava)
Sanskrit bhava + āsrava

Examples

tayo'me, bhikkhave, āsavā, kām'āsavo, bhav'āsavo, avijj'āsavo.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kām'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati bhav'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati avijj'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
bhavāhi

imp. (+nom) be!; please be!; you must be! [√bhū + a + āhi] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd sg of bhavatu, intrans (+nom)
Meaning be!; please be!; you must be!
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + āhi
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhava
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

kaṅkhī vecikicchī āgamaṃ,
pañhe pucchituṃ abhikaṅkhamāno,
tes'antakaro bhavāhi pañhe me puṭṭho,
anupubbaṃ anudhammaṃ byākarohi me.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
bhavi

aor. became, existed [√bhū] ✗
bhavitabba 1

ptp. there should be; it must be; it should exist; lit. to be present [√bhū + *itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of bhavati, impers
Meaning there should be; it must be; it should exist; lit. to be present
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *itabba
Derivative kicca (*itabba)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavitavya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ, tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

so, bhariyaṃ me nissāya bhayena uppannena bhavitabban'ti cintetvā rañño āṇaṃ paṭibāhituṃ asakkonto gantvā rājānaṃ vanditvā aṭṭhāsi

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu
bhavitabba 2

ptp. (+instr) it should be done (with); lit. to be present [√bhū + *itabba] ~

Grammar ptp of bhavati, impers (+instr)
Meaning it should be done (with); lit. to be present
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhav + *itabba
Derivative kicca (*itabba)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhavitavya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)
bhavituṃ

inf. (+nom) to be; to become [√bhū + a + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning to be; to become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + ituṃ
Phonetic Change ū > av
Synonym hotuṃ
Sanskrit bhavituṃ
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

rājā arahasi bhavituṃ,
cakkavattī rathesabho,
cāturanto vijitāvī,
jambusaṇḍassa issaro.

MN 92 selasuttaṃ
bhavituṃ vaṭṭati

idiom. (+instr) it is suitable to be (something) ✓

Grammar idiom, inf + pr, impers (+instr)
Meaning it is suitable to be (something)

Example

kataññunā me bhavituṃ vaṭṭatī'ti ekaṃ satasahassaṃ gāhāpetvā cūḷaseṭṭhissa samīpaṃ gato

JAa 4 cūḷaseṭṭhi jātakavaṇṇanā
bhavitvā

abs. having existed [√bhū] ✗
bhavissa

cond. (+nom) would have been [√bhū] ✗
bhavissati 1

fut. (+nom) could be; should be; lit. will be [√bhū + a + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning could be; should be; lit. will be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a + issa > bhavissa (fut)
Construction bhavissa + ti
Phonetic Change ū > av
Notes Kacc 507, 501
Sanskrit bhaviṣyáti
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

ettha ca te, māluṅkyaputta, diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati, mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati, viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha te, gahapati, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, āturakāyassa me sato cittaṃ anāturaṃ bhavissatī'ti. evañ'hi te, gahapati, sikkhitabban'ti.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
bhavissati 2

fut. (+dat) it belongs (to); lit. it will be [√bhū + a + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of bhavati, impers, intrans (+dat)
Meaning it belongs (to); lit. it will be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a + issa > bhavissa (fut)
Construction bhavissa + ti
Phonetic Change ū > av
Notes Kacc 507, 501
Sanskrit bhaviṣyáti
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

ratanaṃ vā pana bhikkhunā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipitabbaṃ, yassa bhavissati, so harissatī'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

VIN PAT PC 84 ratanasikkhāpadaṃ
bhavissati 3

fut. will happen; will occur; lit. it will be [√bhū + a + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of bhavati, impers, intrans
Meaning will happen; will occur; lit. it will be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a + issa > bhavissa (fut)
Construction bhavissa + ti
Phonetic Change ū > av
Commentary (THIa) na puno edisakaṃ bhavissatī'ti ito paraṃ evarūpaṃ anācāracaraṇaṃ na bhavissati, na karissāmī'ti attho.
Notes Kacc 507, 501
Sanskrit bhaviṣyáti
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

tassa ca viramāsi tāva'd'e,
rāgo tattha khamāpayī ca naṃ,
sotthi siyā brahmacārinī,
na puno edisakaṃ bhavissati.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
bhavissanti

sandhi. "I could be"; "I will be"; "may I be" [bhavissaṃ + iti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, cond + ind
Meaning "I could be"; "I will be"; "may I be"
Construction bhavissaṃ + iti
Commentary (ANa) bhavissan'tiādīni pana cattāri anāgatavasena vuttāni. tesam'pi purimacatukke vuttanayen'eva attho veditabbo.
Sanskrit abhaviṣyam + iti

Examples

asmī'ti, bhikkhave, maññitam'etaṃ, ayam'aham'asmī'ti maññitam'etaṃ, bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, na bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, rūpī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ

bhavissan'ti hoti, itthaṃ bhavissan'ti hoti, evaṃ bhavissan'ti hoti, aññathā bhavissan'ti hoti. imāni aṭṭhārasa taṇhāvicaritāni ajjhattikassa upādāya.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
bhavissantī

fem. (gram) future tense; lit. will be [√bhū + a + issa + nta + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhavissanta
Meaning (gram) future tense; lit. will be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + issa + nta + ī
bhavissanta + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhaviṣyantī
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

421, 473. anāgate bhavissantī.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 421

429, 472. bhavissantī ssati ssanti, ssasi ssatha, ssāmi ssāma, ssate ssante, ssase ssavhe, ssaṃ ssāmhe.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 429
bhavissantīvibhatti

fem. (gram) inflections of the future tense; conjugation of the future tense; lit. will be conjugation [bhavissantī + vibhatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning (gram) inflections of the future tense; conjugation of the future tense; lit. will be conjugation
Construction bhavissantī + vibhatti
Compound kammadhāraya (bhavissantī + vibhatti)
Sanskrit bhaviṣyantī + vibhakti

Example

anāgate kāle bhavissantīvibhatti hoti. so gacchissati, karissati. te gacchissanti, karissanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 421
bhavissaṃ

fut. (+nom) I myself will be [√bhū + a + issa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar fut, reflx 1st sg of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning I myself will be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a + issa > bhavissa (fut)
Construction bhavissa + aṃ
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit bhaviṣye
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

kadā iṇ'aṭṭo'va daliddako nidhiṃ,
ārādhayitvā dhanikehi pīḷito,
tuṭṭho bhavissaṃ adhigamma sāsanaṃ,
mah'esino taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, na bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, rūpī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, arūpī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, saññī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, asaññī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, n'evasaññīn'āsaññī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ.

bhavūpanisa

adj. with being as pre-condition [bhava + upanisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with being as pre-condition
Construction bhava + upanisa
bhavūpapatti

fem. rebirth into new existence [bhava + upapatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning rebirth into new existence
Construction bhava + upapatti
Compound kammadhāraya (bhava + upapatti)
Sanskrit bhava + upapatti

Example

et'ādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi,
nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ,
diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ,
bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
bhave

opt. (+nom) could be; should be; will be [√bhū + a + e] ✓

Grammar opt of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning could be; should be; will be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bhava
Construction bhava + e
Phonetic Change ū > av
Synonym assa, siyā
Sanskrit bhavet
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

kadā nu'haṃ sabbhi samāgamesu,
diṭṭho bhave dhammagarūhi tādibhi,
yāthāvadassīhi jit'indriyehi,
padhāniyo taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhavesanā

fem. seeking existence [bhava + esanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning seeking existence
Construction bhava + esanā
bhavogha

masc. flood of being; torrent of existence [bhava + ogha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning flood of being; torrent of existence
Construction bhava + ogha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhavassa + ogha)
Commentary (SNa) bhav'ogho'ti rūp'ārūpabhavesu chandarāgo.
Notes cattāro oghā 1. kāmogha, 2. bhavogha, 3. diṭṭhogha, 4. avijjogha.
Sanskrit bhava + ogha

Example

mahā udakaṇṇavo'ti kho, bhikkhave, catunn'etaṃ oghānaṃ adhivacanaṃ, kām'oghassa, bhav'oghassa, diṭṭh'oghassa, avijj'oghassa.

SN 35.238 āsīvisopamasuttaṃ
bhavobhirādhito

sandhi. enjoyed the state; successfully attained existence [bhavo + abhirādhito] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + pp
Meaning enjoyed the state; successfully attained existence
Construction bhavo + abhirādhito
Commentary (THa) mānuso'pi ca bhavo'bhirādhito'ti manuss'attabhāvo'pi mayā t'ādisena kusalakammunā samavāyena abhirādhito sādhito adhigato. kāṇakacchap'opamasuttam'ettha udāharitabbaṃ.
Sanskrit bhavaḥ + abhirāddhaḥ

Example

mānuso'pi ca bhavo'bhirādhito,
saggakāyam'agamaṃ sakiṃ sakiṃ,
rūpadhātusu arūpadhātusu,
n'evasaññisu asaññisuṭṭhitaṃ.

TH 183 gotamattheragāthā
bhavyarūpatā

fem. apparent ability ✗
bhastā 1

fem. body; lit. leather bag ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning body; lit. leather bag
Synonym kaḷebara, kaḷevara, kāyadhātu, gahaka, deha, sandeha, samussaya, sarīra
Sanskrit bhastrā

Example

dhitipparaṃ kiṃ mama citta kāhisi,
na te alaṃ citta vas'ānuvattako,
na jātu bhastaṃ ubhatomukhaṃ chupe,
dhi'r'atthu pūraṃ nava sotasandaniṃ.

Meaning bellows

bhasma

masc. ash [√bhas + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group
Meaning ash
Root Family √bhas
Root √bhas×1 a (make ashes)
Construction √bhas + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Synonym chārikā, seṭṭhi
Variant bhassa
Commentary (MNa) bhasmaṃ ... chārikaṃ
Sanskrit bhasman
Sanskrit Root bhas - (ashes)

Examples

māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro,
kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ,
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ,
attā sudanto purisassa joti.

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

na hi pāpaṃ kataṃ kammaṃ,
sajju khīraṃ'va muccati,
ḍahantaṃ bālam'anveti,
bhasmacchanno'va pāvako.

bhasmapuṭa 1

adj. deserving the bag of ashes as punishment ✗
bhasmapuṭa 2

masc. bag of ashes (used as symbolic punishment) ✗
bhassa 1.1

nt. speech; talk; conversation [√bhās + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bhāsati
Meaning speech; talk; conversation
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction √bhās > bhassa + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ās > ass
Synonym bhaṇita, bhāsita, vākya
Sanskrit bhāṣya
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Example

etha tumhe, āvuso, appabhassā hotha, bhasse pariyantakārino'ti, iti bhassapariyante samādapetabbā nivesetabbā patiṭṭhāpetabbā.

AN 5.114 andhakavindasuttaṃ
bhassa 1.2

adj. talkative; argumentative [√bhās] ✗
bhassa 2.1

masc. ash [√bhas + ma] ~

Meaning ash
Root Family √bhas

prp. falling down [√bhas] ✗

Construction bhassa + pavādaka

disvāna bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ, bhante, saccako nigaṇṭhaputto āgacchati bhassappavādako paṇḍitavādo sādhusammato bahujanassa.

prp. falling down [√bhas] ✗
bhassara

adj. bright, shining, resplendent [√bhās] ✗
bhassarata

adj. taking pleasure in speech; addicted to talk [bhassa + rata] ✓

Meaning taking pleasure in speech; addicted to talk

Example

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu kamm'ārāmo hoti kammarato kamm'ārāmataṃ anuyutto, bhass'ārāmo hoti bhassarato bhass'ārāmataṃ anuyutto, nidd'ārāmo hoti niddārato nidd'ārāmataṃ anuyutto

AN 6.14 bhaddakasuttaṃ
bhassasamācāra

masc. verbal conduct; behaviour in speech [bhassa + samācāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning verbal conduct; behaviour in speech
Construction bhassa + samācāra
bhassasamācārādidesanā

fem. teaching about verbal conduct, etc. [bhassa + samācāra + ādi + desanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning teaching about verbal conduct, etc.
Construction bhassa + samācāra + ādi + desanā
bhassārāma

adj. enjoying talk; taking pleasure in speech [bhassa + ārāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enjoying talk; taking pleasure in speech
Construction bhassa + ārāma
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhasse + ārāma)
Sanskrit bhāṣya + ārāma

Example

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu kamm'ārāmo hoti kammarato kamm'ārāmataṃ anuyutto, bhass'ārāmo hoti bhassarato bhass'ārāmataṃ anuyutto, nidd'ārāmo hoti niddārato nidd'ārāmataṃ anuyutto

bhassārāma + tā

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu kamm'ārāmo hoti kammarato kamm'ārāmataṃ anuyutto, bhass'ārāmo hoti bhassarato bhass'ārāmataṃ anuyutto, nidd'ārāmo hoti niddārato nidd'ārāmataṃ anuyutto

AN 6.14 bhaddakasuttaṃ
bhassi

aor. fell down, dropped [√bhas] ✗

abs. having fell down [√bhas] ✗
bhā 1.1

fem. light, splendour ✗
bhā 2.1

fem. brow; eyebrow ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning brow; eyebrow
Variant bhū
English Cognate brow
Sanskrit bhrū

Example

atha kho, bhikkhave, vedehikā gahapatānī kāḷiṃ dāsiṃ etadavoca, he je kāḷī'ti. kiṃ, ayye'ti? kiṃ, je, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti? na khv'ayye, kiñcī'ti. no vata re kiñci, pāpi dāsi, divā uṭṭhāsī'ti kupitā anattamanā bhākuṭiṃ akāsi.

bhāga 1

masc. part; portion; share; measure [√bhaj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhajati
Meaning part; portion; share; measure
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag > bhāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Synonym aṃsa, koṭṭhāsa, khaṇḍa, paṭivisa, padesa
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.3) dve bhāgā ... dve tulā (VINa) dve bhāgā'ti dve koṭṭhāsā.
Sanskrit bhāga
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Examples

samānabhāgaṃ kubbetha,
gāme akkuṭṭhavanditaṃ,
manopadosaṃ rakkheyya,
santo anuṇṇato care.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

saṅkham'pi na upeti upanidhim'pi na upeti kalabhāgam'pi na upeti mahāpathaviṃ upanidhāya bhagavatā paritto nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsu āropito'ti.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ
bhāga 2

masc. class; category; group; subdivision [√bhaj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhajati
Meaning class; category; group; subdivision
Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 a (divide, distribute)
Construction √bhaj > bhag > bhāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Synonym kāya, koṭṭhāsa, khandha, guṇa, pabheda
Commentary (MNa) ekaṃ bhāgan'ti ... ekaṃ koṭṭhāsam'akāsiṃ.
Sanskrit bhāga
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)

Example

so kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, yo c'āyaṃ kāmavitakko yo ca byāpādavitakko yo ca vihiṃsāvitakko, imaṃ ekaṃ bhāgam'akāsiṃ. yo c'āyaṃ nekkhammavitakko yo ca abyāpādavitakko yo ca avihiṃsāvitakko, imaṃ dutiyaṃ bhāgam'akāsiṃ.

j > g

na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

DHP 19 yamakavaggo

appam'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
dhammassa hoti anudhammacārī,
rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca pahāya mohaṃ,
sammappajāno suvimuttacitto,
anupādiyāno idha vā huraṃ vā,
sa bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

Root Family √bhaj
Root √bhaj･1 *e (divide, distribute)
Base √bhaj + *e > bhāje (caus)
Construction bhāje + tvā
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit bhājayitvā
Sanskrit Root √bhaj 1 (divide, share)
bhājenta

prp. dividing, distributing [√bhaj] ✗
bhājesi

aor. divided, distributed [√bhaj] ✗
bhāṇaka 1

masc. (of scriptures) reciter; chanter [√bhaṇ + *aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from bhaṇati
Meaning (of scriptures) reciter; chanter
Root Family √bhaṇ
Root √bhaṇ･1 a (talk, speak)
Construction √bhaṇ > bhāṇ + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit bhāṇaka
Sanskrit Root √bhaṇ 1 (speak)

Example

paripāceti nāma pubbe adātu'kāmānaṃ akattu'kāmānaṃ, ayyo bhāṇako, ayyo bahussuto, ayyo suttantiko, ayyo vinayadharo, ayyo dhammakathiko, detha ayyassa, karotha ayyassā'ti esā paripāceti nāma.

Examples

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

porāṇam'etaṃ atula,
n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ,
nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti,
n'atthi loke anindito.

Phonetic Change ī > āy
Synonym tasati, bheti
Sanskrit bibheti
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Examples

sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa,
sabbe bhāyanti maccuno,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā,
na haneyya na ghātaye.

DHP 129 daṇḍavaggo

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi, yaṃ taṃ sukhaṃ aññatr'eva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī'ti?

Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)
Construction √bhar > bhār + *a + iya
bhāra + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym garuka, duṭṭhulla
Sanskrit bhārya
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

Examples

rājā satthu vacanaṃ sutvā, aho, bhante, bhāriyaṃ kammaṃ, ettake nāma bhoge vijjamāne n'eva attanā paribhuñji, na tumhādise buddhe dhuravihāre viharante puññakammaṃ akāsī'ti āha.

DHPa 2.24.11 aputtakaseṭṭhi vatthu

taṃ sutvā itaro saṃvegajāto, bhāriyaṃ vata me sāhasikaṃ ananucchavikaṃ kammaṃ katan'ti bāhā paggayha kandanto vanasaṇḍaṃ pakkhanditvā tathā pakkanto'va ahosi.

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu

Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)

bhāra + iya

bhāva 1

masc. state; condition; characteristic; nature [√bhū + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, in comps, from bhavati
Meaning state; condition; characteristic; nature
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhāv + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Antonym abhāva
Synonym patha, samaya
Sanskrit bhāva
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ, tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc'eva akkhātaṃ sabbeh'eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo

DN 16.32 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

bhāva 3

masc. sex [√bhū] ✗

bhāvataddhita

masc. (gram) derivative forming abstract nouns ✗
bhāvanapuṃsaka

nt. (gram) neuter gender abstract noun ✗
bhāvanamanvāya

ind. (+gen) by means of developing; through the development (of) [bhāvanaṃ + anvāya] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp (+gen)
Meaning by means of developing; through the development (of)
Construction bhāvanaṃ + anvāya
bhāvanā 1

fem. developing; cultivating; meditating; lit. causing to be [√bhū + *e + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from bhāveti, caus
Meaning developing; cultivating; meditating; lit. causing to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Commentary (SNa) bhāvanāyā'ti cittavūpasamabhāvanāya. (ANa) bhāvanaṃ desessāmī'ti brūhanaṃ vaḍḍhanaṃ pakāsayissāmi.
Sanskrit bhāvanā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

dullabhaṃ v'āpi labhanti,
cittavūpasame ratā,
yesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
bhāvanāya rato mano'ti.

SN 2.6 kāmadasuttaṃ
bhāvanā 2

fem. honour; reverence; status; reputation; lit. causing to be [√bhū + *e + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from bhāveti, caus
Meaning honour; reverence; status; reputation; lit. causing to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym sambhāvanā
Sanskrit bhāvanā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

asantaṃ bhāvanam'iccheyya,
purekkhārañ'ca bhikkhusu,
āvāsesu ca issariyaṃ,
pūjā parakulesu ca.

DHP 73 bālavaggo
bhāvanā 3

fem. by developing; through cultivating; lit. by causing to be [√bhū + *e + anā + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, instr sg of bhāvanā, caus
Meaning by developing; through cultivating; lit. by causing to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + anā + ā
bhāvanā + ā
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Commentary (MNa) dassanā pahātabbā'ti dassanena pahātabbā. esa nayo sabbattha.
Notes see SCPN §6
Sanskrit bhāvanayā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā saṃvarā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā.

bhāvanānuyoga

masc. meditation practice; lit. devotion to development [bhāvanā + anuyoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning meditation practice; lit. devotion to development
Construction bhāvanā + anuyoga
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvanā + anuyoga)
Sanskrit bhāvanā + anuyoga

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhāvan'ānuyogaṃ anuyuttassa bhikkhuno viharato kiñ'cā'pi na evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti, ettakaṃ vata me ajja āsavānaṃ khīṇaṃ, ettakaṃ hiyyo, ettakaṃ pare'ti, atha khv'assa khīṇe khīṇan'tv'eva ñāṇaṃ hoti.

SN 22.101 vāsijaṭasuttaṃ
bhāvanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to meditation practice; engaged in mental cultivation [bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to meditation practice; engaged in mental cultivation
Construction bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (bhāvanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Sanskrit bhāvanā + anuyoga + anuyukta

Example

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

Examples

tassa cittaṃ rakkhato āsavesu ca s'āsavesu ca dhammesu saddhindriyam'pi bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati. vīriyindriyam'pi bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

bhāvanīya 1

Grammar adj, ptp of bhāveti, caus

Examples

AN 10.71 ākaṅkhasuttaṃ

aniccadassāvī kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato manobhāvanīyānañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
bhāvanīya 2

adj. to be cultivated [√bhū] ✗
bhāvayati

pr. (+acc) cultivates; develops; lit. causes to become [√bhū + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of bhavati, trans (+acc)
Meaning cultivates; develops; lit. causes to become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *aya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *aya > bhāvaya (caus)
Construction bhāvaya + ti
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym bhāveti
Sanskrit bhāvayati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ,
āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

tath'eva tvam'pi ahitahite,
samaṃ mettāya bhāvaya,
mettāpāramitaṃ gantvā,
sambodhiṃ pāpuṇissasī'ti.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
bhāvayate

pr. (+acc) one oneself cultivates; one oneself develops [√bhū + *aya + te] ✓

Grammar pr, reflx 3rd sg of bhāvayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning one oneself cultivates; one oneself develops
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *aya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *aya > bhāvaya (caus)
Construction bhāvaya + te
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Sanskrit bhāvayate
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

vitakk'ūpasame ca yo rato,
asubhaṃ bhāvayate sadā sato,
esa kho byanti kāhiti,
esa checchati mārabandhanaṃ.

DHP 350 taṇhāvaggo
bhāvayanta

prp. (+acc) cultivating; developing [√bhū + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of bhāvayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning cultivating; developing
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *aya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *aya > bhāvaya (caus)
Construction bhāvaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym anubrūhayamāna, bhāventa
Commentary (SNa) cittaṃ paññañ'ca bhāvayan'ti samādhiñ'c'eva vipassanañ'ca bhāvayamāno
Sanskrit bhāvayat
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

sīle patiṭṭhāya naro sapañño,
cittaṃ paññañ'ca bhāvayaṃ,
ātāpī nipako bhikkhu,
so imaṃ vijaṭaye jaṭaṃ.

SN 7.6 jaṭāsuttaṃ

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
bhāvayamāna

prp. increasing, cultivating, developing [√bhū] ✗
bhāvayitvā

abs. (+acc) having cultivated; having developed; lit. having caused to become [√bhū + *aya + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of bhāvayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having cultivated; having developed; lit. having caused to become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *aya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *aya > bhāvaya (caus)
Construction bhāvaya + itvā
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym bhāvetvā, vibhāvetvā
Sanskrit bhāvayitvā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

ete dhamme bhāvayitvā,
tayo sukhasamuddaye,
abyāpajjhaṃ sukhaṃ lokaṃ,
paṇḍito upapajjatī'ti.

ITI 22 mettasuttaṃ
bhāvaye

opt. (+acc) should cultivate; should develop [√bhū + *aya + e] ✓

Grammar opt of bhāvayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning should cultivate; should develop
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *aya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *aya > bhāvaya (caus)
Construction bhāvaya + e
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Sanskrit bhū
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

pañca chinde pañca jahe,
pañca c'uttari bhāvaye,
pañca saṅg'ātigo bhikkhu,
oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

DHP 370 bhikkhuvaggo

mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ,
āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
bhāvasādhana

nt. (gram) formula of establishment by state (e.g. socanan'ti soko) ✗
bhāvita 1

pp. cultivated; developed; lit. caused to be [√bhū + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of bhāveti, caus
Meaning cultivated; developed; lit. caused to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Antonym abhāvita
Synonym vaḍḍhita
Commentary (ANa) bhāvitā'ti vaḍḍhitā.
Sanskrit bhāvita
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,
bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ,
pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me,
tasmā buddho'smi brāhmaṇa.

TH 253 selattheragāthā

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā sati no bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
bhāvita 2

nt. (comm) Jain doctrinal term for the pleasure of the five senses; lit. caused to be [√bhū + *e + ita] ~

Grammar nt, from bhāveti, caus
Meaning (comm) Jain doctrinal term for the pleasure of the five senses; lit. caused to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Commentary (MNa) bhāvitan'ti pañcakāmaguṇā.
Sanskrit bhāvita
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)
bhāvitaiddhipāda

masc. basis for success is developed [bhāvita + iddhipāda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning basis for success is developed
Construction bhāvita + iddhipāda
bhāvitakāya 1

adj. developed in body; physically cultivated [bhāvita + kāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning developed in body; physically cultivated
Construction bhāvita + kāya
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + kāya)
Antonym abhāvitakāya
Sanskrit bhāvita + kāya

Example

kāyabhāvanam'pi kho tvaṃ, aggivessana, na aññāsi, kuto pana tvaṃ cittabhāvanaṃ jānissasi? api ca, aggivessana, yathā abhāvitakāyo ca hoti abhāvitacitto ca, bhāvitakāyo ca hoti bhāvitacitto ca.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bhāvitakāya 2

adj. physically restrained; lit. developed in body [bhāvita + kāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning physically restrained; lit. developed in body
Construction bhāvita + kāya
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + kāya)
Antonym abhāvitakāya
Sanskrit bhāvita + kāya

Examples

bhāvanāvādaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu vadamāno, bhāvitakāyo'mhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño'ti. tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, doso abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati

AN 10.24 mahācundasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
bhāvitakāla

masc. time of being developed [bhāvita + kāla] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of being developed
Construction bhāvita + kāla
Antonym abhāvitakāla
bhāvitacitta

adj. developed in mind; mentally cultivated [bhāvita + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning developed in mind; mentally cultivated
Construction bhāvita + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + citta)
Antonym abhāvitacitta
Sanskrit bhāvita + citta

Examples

bhāvanāvādaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu vadamāno, bhāvitakāyo'mhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño'ti. tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, doso abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati

AN 10.24 mahācundasuttaṃ

kāyabhāvanam'pi kho tvaṃ, aggivessana, na aññāsi, kuto pana tvaṃ cittabhāvanaṃ jānissasi? api ca, aggivessana, yathā abhāvitakāyo ca hoti abhāvitacitto ca, bhāvitakāyo ca hoti bhāvitacitto ca.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bhāvitatta 1.1

masc. who is enlightened; who is holy; who has a developed mind; who is self-developed; lit. developed self [bhāvita + atta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, atta group
Meaning who is enlightened; who is holy; who has a developed mind; who is self-developed; lit. developed self
Construction bhāvita + atta
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + atta)
Notes (MW) one whose soul is purified by meditating on the universal soul, whose thoughts are fixed on the Supreme Spirit, meditative, devout, holy, a sage, saint
Sanskrit bhāvitātman

Examples

māse māse sahassena,
yo yajetha sataṃ samaṃ,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ,
muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo,
yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.

DHP 106 sahassavaggo

pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ,
maññāmi taṃ vedaguṃ bhāvit'attaṃ,
kuto nu dukkhā samudāgatā ime,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
bhāvitatta 1.2

adj. enlightened; self-developed; lit. developed self [bhāvita + atta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enlightened; self-developed; lit. developed self
Construction bhāvita + atta
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + atta)
Notes (MW) one whose soul is purified by meditating on the universal soul, whose thoughts are fixed on the Supreme Spirit, meditative, devout, holy, a sage, saint
Sanskrit bhāvitātman

Example

ariyassa bhāvit'attassa,
pattipattassa veyyākaraṇassa,
satimato vipassissa,
anabhinatassa no apanatassa,
anejassa vasippattassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
bhāvitatta 1.3

adj. well-trained, self-composed ✗
bhāvitatta 1.4

masc. name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. developed self [bhāvita + atta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. developed self
Construction bhāvita + atta
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + atta)
Sanskrit bhāvitātman
bhāvitatta 2.1

nt. (+gen) fact of being cultivated; state of being developed (of); lit. developed state [√bhū + *e + ita + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from bhāvita, caus (+gen)
Meaning fact of being cultivated; state of being developed (of); lit. developed state
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + ita + tta
bhāvita + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Sanskrit bhāvitatva
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

imesañ'ca pan'āhaṃ, āvuso, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇāmi dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā'ti

SN 52.13 dibbasotasuttaṃ

tassa kho esā, aggivessana, uppannā'pi sukhā vedanā cittaṃ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati bhāvitattā kāyassa, uppannā'pi dukkhā vedanā cittaṃ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati bhāvitattā cittassa.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bhāvitattatā

fem. fact of being enlightened; fact of being self-developed; lit. developed self state [na + bhāvita + atta + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from bhāvitatta
Meaning fact of being enlightened; fact of being self-developed; lit. developed self state
Construction na > a + bhāvita + atta + tā
abhāvitatta + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Antonym abhāvitattatā
Sanskrit bhāvitātman +
bhāvitapañña

adj. developed in wisdom; cultivated in understanding [bhāvita + pañña] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning developed in wisdom; cultivated in understanding
Construction bhāvita + pañña
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + pañña)
Antonym abhāvitapañña
Sanskrit bhāvita + prajñā

Examples

bhāvanāvādaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu vadamāno, bhāvitakāyo'mhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño'ti. tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, doso abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
bhāvitasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.34 (SN47.34) ✗
bhāvitindriya

adj. with developed faculties [bhāvita + indriya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with developed faculties
Construction bhāvita + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāvita + indriya)
Sanskrit bhāvita + indriya

Example

evaṃ sante kho, uttara, andho bhāvit'indriyo bhavissati, badhiro bhāvit'indriyo bhavissati yathā pārāsiviyassa brāhmaṇassa vacanaṃ

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ
bhāviyamāna

prp. being cultivated; being developed [√bhū + *e + iya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of bhāviyati, caus, pass, intrans
Meaning being cultivated; being developed
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e + iya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e + iya > bhāviya (caus, pass)
Construction bhāviya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Sanskrit bhāvyamāna
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, kālā sammā bhāviyamānā sammā anuparivattiyamānā anupubbena āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpenti

AN 4.147 dutiyakālasuttaṃ
bhāvī

adj. going to be; fated; inevitable; predestined [√bhū + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhavati
Meaning going to be; fated; inevitable; predestined
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhāv + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Sanskrit bhāvin
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

so imam'eva kāyaṃ upasaṃharati, ayam'pi kho kāyo evaṃdhammo evaṃbhāvī evaṃanatīto'ti

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
bhāvīyati

pr. (+acc) is cultivated; is developed; lit. is caused to become [√bhū + *e + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of bhāveti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning is cultivated; is developed; lit. is caused to become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e + īya (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e + īya > bhāvīya (caus, pass)
Construction bhāvīya + ti
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Commentary (ANa) cittaṃ bhāvīyatī'ti maggacittaṃ bhāvīyati brūhīyati vaḍḍhīyati.
Sanskrit bhāvyate
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

samatho, bhikkhave, bhāvito kam'attham'anubhoti? cittaṃ bhāvīyati. cittaṃ bhāvitaṃ kam'attham'anubhoti? yo rāgo so pahīyati.

AN 2.33 bālavaggo

vipassanā, bhikkhave, bhāvitā kam'attham'anubhoti? paññā bhāvīyati. paññā bhāvitā kam'attham'anubhoti? yā avijjā sā pahīyati.

AN 2.33 bālavaggo
bhāvetabba

ptp. should be cultivated; should be developed; lit. to cause to be [√bhū + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of bhāveti, caus
Meaning should be cultivated; should be developed; lit. to cause to be
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Commentary (DNa) bhāvetabbo'ti vaḍḍhetabbo.
Sanskrit bhāvayitavya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

yā c'āvuso, paññā yañ'ca viññāṇaṃ, imesaṃ dhammānaṃ saṃsaṭṭhānaṃ no visaṃsaṭṭhānaṃ paññā bhāvetabbā, viññāṇaṃ pariññeyyaṃ. idaṃ nesaṃ nānākaraṇan'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,
bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ,
pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me,
tasmā buddho'smi brāhmaṇa.

TH 253 selattheragāthā
bhāvetabbadhammasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.195 (AN10.195) ✗
bhāvetabbasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.151 (AN10.151) ✗
bhāveti

pr. (+acc) cultivates; develops; lit. causes to become [√bhū + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of bhavati, trans (+acc)
Meaning cultivates; develops; lit. causes to become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + ti
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym bhāvayati
Sanskrit bhāvayati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya,
sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito,
okā anokam'āgamma,
viveke yattha dūramaṃ.

DHP 87 paṇḍitavaggo

kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvetha. sakkā, bhikkhave, kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ. no ce'daṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvethā'ti.

AN 2.19 adhikaraṇavaggo
bhāvetukāma

adj. wanting to develop; wishing to cultivate [bhāvetuṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting to develop; wishing to cultivate
Construction bhāvetuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (bhāvetuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit bhāvitum + kāma

Example

karuṇaṃ bhāvetu'kāmena pana nikkaruṇatāya ādīnavaṃ karuṇāya ca ānisaṃsaṃ paccavekkhitvā karuṇābhāvanā ārabhitabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
bhāvetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to cultivate; to develop; to grow; to increase [√bhū + *e + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of bhāveti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to cultivate; to develop; to grow; to increase
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + tuṃ
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym ropetuṃ, vaḍḍhetuṃ
Sanskrit bhāvitum
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvetha. sakkā, bhikkhave, kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ. no ce'daṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvethā'ti.

AN 2.19 adhikaraṇavaggo

karuṇaṃ bhāvetu'kāmena pana nikkaruṇatāya ādīnavaṃ karuṇāya ca ānisaṃsaṃ paccavekkhitvā karuṇābhāvanā ārabhitabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
bhāvetvā

abs. (+acc) having cultivated; having developed; lit. having caused to become [√bhū + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of bhāveti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having cultivated; having developed; lit. having caused to become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + tvā
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym bhāvayitvā, vibhāvetvā
Sanskrit bhāvayitvā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇa

nt. (gram) absolute construction ✗
bhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇe bhummaṃ

idiom. (gram) locative absolute construction ✗
bhāventa

prp. (+acc) cultivating; developing [√bhū + *e + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of bhāveti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning cultivating; developing
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym anubrūhayamāna, bhāvayanta
Sanskrit bhāvayat
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

taṃ nimittaṃ āsevantena bhāventena bahulīkarontena mettāya vuttanayen'eva tikacatukkajjhānavasena appanā vaḍḍhetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
bhāvesi 1

aor. (+acc) cultivated; developed [√bhū + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of bhāveti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning cultivated; developed
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 *e (be, become)
Base √bhū + *e > bhāve (caus)
Construction bhāve + si
Phonetic Change ū > āv
Synonym anubrūhayi
Sanskrit bhū
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvesiṃ. satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvetvā satta saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe na'y'imaṃ lokaṃ punāgamāsiṃ.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
bhāvesi 2

aor. (+acc) increased [√bhū] ✗
bhāsa 1.1

adj. shining; radiating [√bhās + a] ~

Meaning shining; radiating
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (shine)
Construction √bhās + a

Sanskrit bhāsa

bhāsa 2.1

masc. speech; talk [√bhās + a] ~

Grammar masc, in comps, from bhāsati
Meaning speech; talk
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction √bhās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym bhaṇita

bhāsati 1.1

pr. (+acc) speaks (about); talks (about) [√bhās + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaks (about); talks (about)
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction bhāsa + ti
Synonym ālapati, katheti, byāharati, sallapati
Sanskrit bhāṣati
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Examples

na ca katthitā siyā bhikkhu,
na ca vācaṃ payuttaṃ bhāseyya,
pāgabbhiyaṃ na sikkheyya,
kathaṃ viggāhikaṃ na kathayeyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci sammukhā avaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
bhāsati 1.2

pr. (of verse) recites; utters [√bhās] ✗
bhāsati 2.1

pr. shines; radiates [√bhās + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning shines; radiates
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (shine)
Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction bhāsa + ti
Synonym ābhāti, tapati, dibbati, pakāseti, sobhati
Sanskrit bhāsate
Sanskrit Root √bhās 1 (shine)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve ādicco nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno sabbaṃ ākāsagataṃ tamagataṃ abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yam'idaṃ dhammasamādānaṃ paccuppannasukhañ'c'eva āyatiñ'ca sukhavipākaṃ tadaññe puthusamaṇabrāhmaṇaparappavāde abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocate cā'ti.

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ
bhāsati 2.2

pr. (+acc) illuminates; lights up [√bhās + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning illuminates; lights up
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (shine)
Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction bhāsa + ti
Synonym pakāsati, bhāti
Sanskrit bhāsate
Sanskrit Root √bhās 1 (shine)
bhāsana

nt. speech, saying, talk [√bhās] ✗
bhāsanta

prp. (+acc) speaking (about); talking (about) [√bhās + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of bhāsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaking (about); talking (about)
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction bhāsa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym abhāsanta
Synonym udīrayanta, bhaṇamāna, bhāsamāna
Sanskrit bhāṣat
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Examples

tatra, bhikkhave, taramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi kilamati, cittam'pi upahaññati, saro'pi upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi āturīyati, avisaṭṭham'pi hoti aviññeyyaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, diṭṭhaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ na bhāsitabban'ti vadāmi.

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ
bhāsantara

nt. different language ✗
bhāsamāna

prp. (+acc) speaking (about); talking (about); saying [√bhās + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of bhāsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning speaking (about); talking (about); saying
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction bhāsa + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Antonym abhāsamāna
Synonym udīrayanta, bhaṇanta, bhaṇamāna, bhāsanta, vadanta, vadamāna, vadāna, vadenta
Sanskrit bhāṣamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Examples

bahum'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
na takkaro hoti naro pamatto,
gopo'va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ,
na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

DHP 19 yamakavaggo

n'ābhāsamānaṃ jānanti,
missaṃ bālehi paṇḍitaṃ,
bhāsamānañ'ca jānanti,
desentaṃ amataṃ padaṃ.

AN 4.48 visākhasuttaṃ
bhāsayati

pr. (+acc) makes shine; illuminates [√bhās + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of bhāsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes shine; illuminates
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 *aya (shine)
Base √bhās + aya > bhāsaya (caus)
Construction bhāsaya + ti
Sanskrit bhāsayati
Sanskrit Root √bhās 1 (shine)

Example

bhāsaye jotaye dhammaṃ,
paggaṇhe isinaṃ dhajaṃ,
subhāsitadhajā isayo,
dhammo hi isinaṃ dhajo'ti.

AN 4.48 visākhasuttaṃ
bhāsayi

aor. spoke; said [√bhās] ✗
bhāsasī

pr. (+acc) you speak; you talk [√bhās + a + si] ~

Grammar pr 2nd sg of bhāsati, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning you speak; you talk
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction bhāsa + si > bhāsasī
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ī
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)
bhāsā

fem. language; articulate speech [√bhās + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from bhāsati
Meaning language; articulate speech
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction √bhās + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit bhāṣā
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Example

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ ... akkharappabhedaṃ padaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ bhāsamaggaṃ uppātaṃ supinaṃ nimittaṃ chaḷaṅgaṃ ... sikkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
bhāsi 1

aor. (+acc) spoke; said; told [√bhā + si] ✓

Grammar aor of bhāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning spoke; said; told
Root Family √bhā
Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)
Construction √bhā + si
Synonym akkhāsi, abhāsi, avacāsi, ācikkhi, ārocayi, ārocesi, kathayi, kathesi, bhaṇi, vadesi
Sanskrit abhāsīt
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

Example

apārutā tesaṃ amatassa dvārā,
ye sotavanto pamuñcantu saddhaṃ,
vihiṃsasaññī paguṇaṃ na bhāsiṃ,
dhammaṃ paṇītaṃ manujesu brahme'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
bhāsi 2

aor. (+acc) shone [√bhā] ✗
bhāsita 1

nt. saying; speech; statement; utterance; talk; words; lit. what was said [√bhās + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of bhāsati
Meaning saying; speech; statement; utterance; talk; words; lit. what was said
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction √bhās + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym bhaṇita, bhassa, vacana, vākya
Sanskrit bhāṣita
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Examples

yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni,
bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe,
sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu,
atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhāsita 2

pp. (+instr) said (by); spoken (by); recited (by) [√bhās + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of bhāsati (+instr)
Meaning said (by); spoken (by); recited (by)
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction √bhās + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym abhāsita
Synonym utta, udīrita, gīta, pabhāvita, pavutta, bhaṭṭha, bhaṇita, lapita, vutta
Sanskrit bhāṣita
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Examples

kassa nu kho, bhante, subhāsitan'ti? sabbesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, subhāsitaṃ pariyāyena, api ca yaṃ mayā sandhāya bhāsitaṃ pārāyane metteyyapañhe

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

imassa khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā saṃkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṃ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmi. saḷ'āyatananirodhaṃ no etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitaṃ

kaccāyana samāsakappa 331
bhāsita 4

nt. speaking; talking; saying; lit. spoken [√bhās + ita] ✓

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
bhāsitattha

masc. meaning of what was said [bhāsita + attha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning meaning of what was said
Construction bhāsita + attha
bhāsitaparikkanta

adj. said and done; spoken and committed [bhāsita + parikkanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning said and done; spoken and committed
Construction bhāsita + parikkanta

Sanskrit bhāṣita + parikrānta

Example

tena kho pana samayena bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivād'āpannānaṃ viharataṃ bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ ajjhāciṇṇaṃ hoti bhāsitaparikkantaṃ.

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) word with masculine meaning
Construction bhāsita + puma
Sanskrit bhāṣita + puṃs

Example

bhāsitapume'ti kim'atthaṃ? brāhmaṇabandhu ca sā bhariyā cā'ti brāhmaṇabandhubhariyā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 331
bhāsitapumitthī

fem. (gram) ?? feminine word with masculine meaning [bhāsita + puma + itthī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning (gram) ?? feminine word with masculine meaning
Construction bhāsita + puma + itthī
Sanskrit bhāṣita + puṃs + strī

Examples

itthiyaṃ tuly'ādhikaraṇe pade ce bhāsitapum'itthī pumā'va daṭṭhabbā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 331

kammadhārayasaññe ca samāse itthiyaṃ tuly'ādhikaraṇe pade pubbe bhāsitapum'itthī ce, pumā'va daṭṭhabbā. brāhmaṇadārikā, khattiyakaññā, khattiyakumārikā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 332
bhāsitabba

ptp. speakable; should be spoken about; should be told; lit. to be spoken [√bhās + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of bhāsati
Meaning speakable; should be spoken about; should be told; lit. to be spoken
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction √bhās + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Sanskrit bhāṣitavya
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Example

n'āhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ diṭṭhaṃ bhāsitabban'ti vadāmi, na pan'āhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ diṭṭhaṃ na bhāsitabban'ti vadāmi

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ
bhāsitamatta

nt. mere speech; mere act of saying [bhāsita + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mere speech; mere act of saying
Construction bhāsita + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (bhāsita + matta)
Sanskrit bhāṣita + mātra

Example

na y'idaṃ bhāsitamattena,
ek'antasavanena vā,
anukkamitave sakkā,
yāyaṃ paṭipadā daḷhā,
yāya dhīrā pamuccanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ
bhāsitamanubhāsati

pr. continuously repeats what was said [bhāsitaṃ + anubhāsati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning continuously repeats what was said
Construction bhāsitaṃ + anubhāsati
Commentary (DNa) bhāsitam'anubhāsantī'ti tehi bhāsitaṃ sajjhāyitaṃ anusajjhāyanti.
bhāsitampetaṃ

sandhi. (+instr) this too was said (by) [bhāsitaṃ + api + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pp + ind + pron (+instr)
Meaning this too was said (by)
Construction bhāsitaṃ + api + etaṃ
Sanskrit bhāṣita + api + etam

Example

bhante nāgasena, bhāsitam'p'etaṃ tathāgatena, abyāvaṭā tumhe, ānanda, hotha tathāgatassa sarīrapūjāyā'ti. puna ca bhaṇitaṃ,
pūjetha naṃ pūjaniyassa dhātuṃ,
evaṃ karā saggamito gamissathā'ti.

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
bhāsitar

masc. (+acc) speaker; who talks (about) [√bhās + itar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from bhāsati (+acc)
Meaning speaker; who talks (about)
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction √bhās + itar
Derivative kita (itar)
Sanskrit bhāṣitṛ
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Examples

iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo gūthabhāṇī.

AN 3.28 gūthabhāṇīsuttaṃ

idha, potaliya, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇ'ārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇ'ārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.

AN 4.100 potaliyasuttaṃ
bhāsituṃ

inf. (+acc) to speak; to say; to tell [√bhās + ituṃ] ✓

Construction √bhās + ituṃ
Synonym lapetave
Sanskrit bhāṣitum
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Example

UD 46 soṇasuttaṃ
bhāsitvā

abs. having said, having spoken, having shone [√bhās] ✗

Example

kāyena idha puggalo.

adj. bright, shining [√bhās] ✗

DHP 102 sahassavaggo

pāṇaṃ na haññe na c'adinnam'ādiye,
musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā,
abrahmacariyā virameyya methunā,
rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojanaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
bhāhiti

fut. will shine; will illuminate; will brighten [√bhā + a + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of bhāsati, intrans
Meaning will shine; will illuminate; will brighten
Root Family √bhā
Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)
Base √bhā + a + issa > bhavissa > bhāhi (fut, irreg)
Construction bhāhi + ti
Sanskrit bhāṣiṣyati
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

Example

ek'āsanassa sikkhetha,
samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,
ekattaṃ monam'akkhātaṃ,
eko ce abhiramissasi,
atha bhāhisi dasadisā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

bhikkhaka

masc. beggar; mendicant [√bhikkh + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from bhikkhati
Meaning beggar; mendicant
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Synonym yācaka, vanibbaka
Commentary (VINa) bhikkhako, labhanto vā alabhanto vā ariyāya yācanāya yācatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhikṣuka
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Examples

na tena bhikkhako hoti,
yāvatā bhikkhate pare,
vissaṃ dhammaṃ samādāya,
bhikkhu hoti na tāvatā.

SN 7.20 bhikkhakasuttaṃ

bhikkhū'ti bhikkhako'ti bhikkhu, bhikkh'ācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu, bhinnapaṭadharo'ti bhikkhu, samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
bhikkhakasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 7.20 (SN7.20) ✗
bhikkhatā

Grammar fem, abstr, from bhikkha
Meaning fact of begging; fact of asking
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + a + tā

Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit bhikṣā +
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)
bhikkhati

pr. (+loc) begs (in); begs for alms [√bhikkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning begs (in); begs for alms
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)

Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Examples

asso'va jiṇṇo nibbhogo,
khādanā apanīyati,
bālakānaṃ pitā thero,
par'āgāresu bhikkhati.

SN 7.14 mahāsālasuttaṃ

abhutvā bhikkhasi bhikkhu,
na hi bhutvāna bhikkhasi,
bhutvāna bhikkhu bhikkhassu,
mā taṃ kālo upaccagā'ti.

bhikkhana

nt. begging [√bhikkh] ✗

satiñ'ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabb'atthikaṃ vadāmī'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
bhikkhavo 1

masc. monks [√bhikkh + u + avo] ✓

Grammar masc, nom pl of bhikkhu
Meaning monks
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + avo
bhikkhu + avo
Synonym bhikkhave
Commentary (SNa) tatra bhikkhavo'ti tasmiṃ sannipātaṭṭhāne bhikkhū.
Sanskrit bhikṣavaḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Examples

tatra bhikkhavo samādahaṃsu,
cittam'attano ujukaṃ akaṃsu,
sārathī'va nettāni gahetvā,
indriyāni rakkhanti paṇḍitā'ti.

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ

avihaṃ upapannāse,
vimuttā satta bhikkhavo,
rāgadosaparikkhīṇā,
tiṇṇā loke visattikan'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
bhikkhavo 2

Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + avo
bhikkhu + avo

Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Examples

avijjā paramaṃ malaṃ,

nimmalā hotha bhikkhavo.

DHP 243 malavaggo

araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.

SN 11.3 dhajaggasuttaṃ
bhikkhasu

imp. (+loc) you yourself must beg (among) [√bhikkh + a + assu] ✓

Grammar imp, reflx 2nd sg of bhikkhatu, irreg form of bhikkhassu, intrans (+loc)
Meaning you yourself must beg (among)
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Base √bhikkh + a > bhikkha
Construction bhikkha + assu > bhikkhasu
Phonetic Change ss > s
Variant bhikkhassu
Sanskrit bhikṣasva
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Example

muṇḍo virūpo abhisāpam'āgato,
kapālahattho'va kulesu bhikkhasu,
yuñjassu satthuvacane mah'esino,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhikkhassu

imp. you yourself must beg for alms [√bhikkh + a + assu] ✓

Grammar imp, reflx 2nd sg of bhikkhatu, intrans
Meaning you yourself must beg for alms
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Base √bhikkh + a > bhikkha
Construction bhikkha + assu
Sanskrit bhikṣasva
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Example

abhutvā bhikkhasi bhikkhu,
na hi bhutvāna bhikkhasi,
bhutvāna bhikkhu bhikkhassu,
mā taṃ kālo upaccagā'ti.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
bhikkhā 1

fem. beggings; begged food [√bhikkh + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhikkhati
Meaning beggings; begged food
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + ā

Sanskrit bhikṣā
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Examples

anagāriy'upetassa,
bhikkhācariyaṃ jigīsato,
muni pabrūhi me puṭṭho,
moneyyaṃ uttamaṃ padaṃ.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
bhikkhā 2

fem. grant; donation; allowance [√bhikkh + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhikkhati
Meaning grant; donation; allowance
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit bhikṣā
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Example

ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ niccaṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ
bhikkhācariyavatta

Meaning practice of walking for alms

bhikkhācariyā

fem. wandering for alms; roaming for food [bhikkhā + cariyā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning wandering for alms; roaming for food
Construction bhikkhā + cariyā
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bhikkhāya + cariyā)
Synonym bhikkhācāra
Commentary (VINa) piṇḍiyālopabhojanaṃ nissāya pabbajjāya ussāhajātattā vā bhikkhācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu.
Sanskrit bhikṣucaryā

Examples

anagāriy'upetassa,
bhikkhācariyaṃ jigīsato,
muni pabrūhi me puṭṭho,
moneyyaṃ uttamaṃ padaṃ.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

bhikkhū'ti bhikkhako'ti bhikkhu, bhikkhācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu, bhinnapaṭadharo'ti bhikkhu, samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
bhikkhācāra

masc. wandering for alms; roaming for food [bhikkhā + cāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wandering for alms; roaming for food
Construction bhikkhā + cāra
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bhikkhāya + cāra)
Synonym bhikkhācariyā
Sanskrit bhikṣācarya

Example

paṭipadāya na saṇṭhātī'ti paṭipattiyaṃ na tiṭṭhati, vattaṃ ajānitvā apucchitabbaṭṭhāne pucchatī'ti attho. ayaṃ pañho nāma cetiy'aṅgaṇe pucchitena na kathetabbo, tathā bhikkhācāramagge gāmaṃ piṇḍāya caraṇakāle.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
bhikkhudassana

nt. seeing the monks; meeting the monastics [bhikkhu + dassana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning seeing the monks; meeting the monastics
Construction bhikkhu + dassana

Sanskrit bhikṣu + darśana

Example

bhikkhudassanaṃ hāpeti, saddhammassavanaṃ pamajjati, adhisīle na sikkhati, appasādabahulo hoti, bhikkhūsu theresu c'eva navesu ca majjhimesu ca upārambhacitto dhammaṃ suṇāti randhagavesī, ito bahiddhā dakkhiṇeyyaṃ gavesati, tattha ca pubbakāraṃ karoti. ime kho, bhikkhave, satta dhammā upāsakassa parihānāya saṃvattanti.

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ

cha, bhikkhave, ānisaṃse sampassamānena alam'eva bhikkhunā sabbasaṅkhāresu anodhiṃ karitvā aniccasaññaṃ upaṭṭhāpetuṃ. katame cha?

bhikkhunidūsaka

masc. who has raped a nun [bhikkhunī + dūsaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning who has raped a nun
Construction bhikkhunī + dūsaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhuniyā + dūsaka)
Commentary (VINa) bhikkhunidūsako bhikkhave'ti ettha yo pakatattaṃ bhikkhuniṃ tiṇṇaṃ maggānaṃ aññatarasmiṃ dūseti, ayaṃ bhikkhunidūsako nāma. etassa pabbajjā ca upasampadā ca vāritā. yo pana kāyasaṃsaggena sīlavināsaṃ pāpeti, tassa pabbajjā ca upasampadā ca na vāritā. balakkārena odātavatthavasanaṃ katvā anicchamānaṃ'y'eva dūsento'pi bhikkhunidūsako'y'eva.
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + dūṣaka

Example

paṇḍako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti, paṇḍakakathā vippakatā hoti, bhikkhunidūsako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti, bhikkhunidūsakakathā vippakatā hoti, ime kho, upāli, dasa pātimokkhaṭṭhapanā'ti.

Example

paṇḍako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti, paṇḍakakathā vippakatā hoti, bhikkhunidūsako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti, bhikkhunidūsakakathā vippakatā hoti, ime kho, upāli, dasa pātimokkhaṭṭhapanā'ti.

AN 10.32 pātimokkhaṭṭhapanāsuttaṃ

Example

Examples

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paccavekkhaṇā bahukārā hoti kusalesu dhammesu

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
bhikkhuno 2

masc. of monk; monk's [√bhikkh + u + uno] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of bhikkhu
Meaning of monk; monk's
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + uno
bhikkhu + uno
Variant bhikkhussa
Sanskrit bhikṣuṇaḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, matajaṃ nāma āvudhajātaṃ ubhatodhāraṃ pītanisitaṃ. tadassa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutaṃ sampaliveṭhitaṃ. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yen'aññataro bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca, kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno dassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ hotī'ti?

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
bhikkhuno 3

masc. when a monk [√bhikkh + u + uno] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of bhikkhu, gen abs
Meaning when a monk
Root Family √bhikkh
Root √bhikkh･1 a (beg)
Construction √bhikkh + u + uno
bhikkhu + uno
Sanskrit bhikṣuṇaḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhāvan'ānuyogaṃ anuyuttassa bhikkhuno viharato kiñ'cā'pi na evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti, ettakaṃ vata me ajja āsavānaṃ khīṇaṃ, ettakaṃ hiyyo, ettakaṃ pare'ti, atha khv'assa khīṇe khīṇan'tv'eva ñāṇaṃ hoti.

SN 22.101 vāsijaṭasuttaṃ

patilīnacarassa bhikkhuno,
bhajamānassa vivittam'āsanaṃ,
sāmaggiyam'āhu tassa taṃ,
yo attānaṃ bhavane na dassaye.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
bhikkhunoāyuvaṇṇādivaḍḍhanakathā

fem. discussion about increasing the life-span and beauty of a monk [bhikkhuno + āyu + vaṇṇa + ādi + vaḍḍhana + kathā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning discussion about increasing the life-span and beauty of a monk
Construction bhikkhuno + āyu + vaṇṇa + ādi + vaḍḍhana + kathā
bhikkhunovādaka

masc. instructor of the nuns; exhorter of nuns [bhikkhunī + ovādaka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning instructor of the nuns; exhorter of nuns
Construction bhikkhunī + ovādaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhunīnaṃ + ovādaka)
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + avavādaka

Example

evaṃ vadeyyā'ti upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ bhikkhun'ovādakaṃ avaṇṇaṃ kattu'kāmo ayasaṃ kattu'kāmo maṅkukattu'kāmo evaṃ vadeti

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
bhikkhunovādakasammuti

fem. designation as instructor of the nuns; appointment as exhorter of nuns [bhikkhunovādaka + sammuti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning designation as instructor of the nuns; appointment as exhorter of nuns
Construction bhikkhunovādaka + sammuti
Sanskrit bhiksuṇī + avavādaka + sammati

Example

tassapāpiyasikakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā vattitabbaṃ, na upasampādetabbo, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo, na bhikkhun'ovādakasammuti sāditabbā, sammaten'api bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā, na kāci saṅghasammuti sāditabbā, na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbo, na ca tena mūlena vuṭṭhāpetabbo.

AN 8.90 sammāvattanasuttaṃ
bhikkhupaccatthika

masc. enemy monk; hostile monastic [bhikkhu + paccatthika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning enemy monk; hostile monastic
Construction bhikkhu + paccatthika
Commentary (VINa) tattha paṭipakkhaṃ atthayanti icchantī'ti paccatthikā, bhikkhū eva paccatthikā bhikkhupaccatthikā, visabhāgānaṃ veribhikkhūnam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
bhikkhuparisā

fem. assembly of monks; gathering of monastics [bhikkhu + parisā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning assembly of monks; gathering of monastics
Construction bhikkhu + parisā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + parisā)
Sanskrit bhikṣu + pariṣad

Example

tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo, yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te bhikkhu patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

VIN PAT NP 22 ūnapañcabandhanasikkhāpadaṃ

Grammar nt, abstr, comp

Sanskrit bhikṣu + paiśunya

Example

bhikkhupesuññe pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 3 pesuññasikkhāpadaṃ
bhikkhubhāva

Grammar masc, abstr, comp

Examples

catunnaṃ māsānaṃ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti, upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya. api ca m'ettha puggalavemattatā viditā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti bhikkhubhāvā cāveyyaṃ, samaṇadhammā cāveyyaṃ, sīlakkhandhā cāveyyaṃ, tapoguṇā cāveyyaṃ.

Construction bhikkhu + bhikkhunī + iyo
bhikkhubhikkhunī + iyo
bhikkhumajjhagata

adj. among the monks; gone amidst monastics [bhikkhu + majjhagata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning among the monks; gone amidst monastics
Construction bhikkhu + majjhagata
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + majjhagata)
Sanskrit bhikṣu + madhyagata

Example

gacchanto'pi sukhaṃ sātaṃ n'ādhigacchati, ṭhito'pi … nisinno'pi … sayāno'pi … gāmagato'pi … araññagato'pi … rukkhamūlagato'pi … suññ'āgāragato'pi … abbhokāsagato'pi … bhikkhumajjhagato'pi sukhaṃ sātaṃ n'ādhigacchati. anabhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ dukkhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ.

AN 10.66 dutiyasukhasuttaṃ
bhikkhumānatta

nt. paying respect to monks; deference to the monks [bhikkhu + mānatta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning paying respect to monks; deference to the monks
Construction bhikkhu + mānatta
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + mānatta)
Commentary (VINa) bhikkhumānattāyā'ti bhikkhūnaṃ mānanabhāvāya, ārādhanatthāyā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit bhikṣu + mānatva

Example

parivutthaparivāsena bhikkhunā uttari chārattaṃ bhikkhumānattāya paṭipajjitabbaṃ, ciṇṇamānatto bhikkhu yattha siyā vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho, tattha so bhikkhu abbhetabbo.

bhikkhusaṅgha

masc. community of monks; monastic order [bhikkhu + saṅgha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp

Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhikkhūnaṃ + saṅgha)

Examples

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu bhikkhusaṅghaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti, aham'pi bhikkhu, aham'pi bhikkhū'ti.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ

es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca, labheyyāhaṃ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhikkhusaṅghaparivuta

adj. surrounded by a community of monks; encircled by the monastic order [bhikkhu + saṅgha + parivuta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning surrounded by a community of monks; encircled by the monastic order
Construction bhikkhu + saṅgha + parivuta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhikkhusaṅghena + parivuta)
Sanskrit bhikṣusaṃgha + parivṛtta

Examples

tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadah'uposathe pannarase puṇṇāya puṇṇamāya rattiyā bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto abbhokāse nisinno hoti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vajjīsu viharati ukkacelāyaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aciraparinibbutesu sāriputtamoggallānesu. tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto ajjhokāse nisinno hoti.

Commentary (APAa) bhikkhusaṅghapurakkhato bhikkhusaṅghena parivuto.

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā videhesu cārikaṃ carati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākassapo pāvāya kusināraṃ addhānamaggappaṭippanno hoti mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi

bhikkhusammuti

fem. permission from the monks; consent of the monks [bhikkhu + sammuti] ✓

Examples

VIN PAT NP 2 udositasikkhāpadaṃ

orena ce channaṃ vassānaṃ taṃ santhataṃ vissajjetvā vā avissajjetvā vā aññaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

bhijjati

pr. (+acc) is broken; is destroyed [√bhid + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of bhindati, trans (+acc)
Meaning is broken; is destroyed
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ya (break, split)

Construction bhijja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Sanskrit bhidyate
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

bhaven'amhi anatthiko,

añño ca na bhavissati.

parijiṇṇam'idaṃ rūpaṃ,
roganīḷaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ,
bhijjati pūtisandeho,
maraṇ'antañ'hi jīvitaṃ.

DHPa 2.25.3 kokālika vatthu

bhitti

fem. wall [√bhid + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhindati
Meaning wall
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction √bhid + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change d > t
Synonym kuṭṭa, kuḍḍa
Sanskrit bhitti
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rajako vā cittakārako vā rajanāya vā lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā suparimaṭṭhe phalake vā bhittiyā vā dussapaṭṭe vā itthirūpaṃ vā purisarūpaṃ vā abhinimmineyya sabb'aṅgapacc'aṅgiṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kūṭ'āgāre vā kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ vā pācīnavātapānā sūriye uggacchante vātapānena rasmi pavisitvā kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
bhittikhila
