Grammar masc, comp
Meaning peg on a wall; lit. wall post
Construction bhitti + khila
Commentary (NIDD1a) bhittikhile'ti bhittiyaṃ ākoṭitakhāṇuke.
bhittipāda

masc. foot or foundation of a wall ✗
bhitvāna

abs. (+acc) having divided; having broken; having split [√bhid + tvāna] ✓

Grammar abs of bhindati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having divided; having broken; having split
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction √bhid + tvāna
Phonetic Change dt > t
Variant bhinditvā, bhetvāna
Commentary (ITIa) bhetvānā'ti pubbe vuttalakkhaṇena saṅghabhedena bhinditvā.
Sanskrit bhittvā
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

āpāyiko nerayiko,
kappaṭṭho saṅghabhedako,
vaggarato adhammaṭṭho,
yogakkhemā padhaṃsati,
saṅghaṃ samaggaṃ bhitvāna,
kappaṃ nirayamhi paccatī'ti.

AN 10.39 paṭhamaānandasuttaṃ
bhidura

adj. fragile; breakable; brittle; perishable [√bhid + ura] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhijjati
Meaning fragile; breakable; brittle; perishable
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction √bhid + ura
Derivative kita (ura)
Synonym pabhaṅgu, pabhaṅguna, pabhaṅgura, saderita
Commentary (THIa) bhiduro'ti bhijjanasabhāvo, anicco'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhidura
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

bhidur'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kāyo, viññāṇaṃ virāgadhammaṃ, sabbe upadhī aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā'ti. etam'atthaṃ bhagavā avoca.

ITI77 bhidurasuttaṃ
bhidurasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 77 (ITI 77) ✗
bhindati 1

pr. (+acc) breaks; splits; shatters [√bhid + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning breaks; splits; shatters
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Base √bhid + ṃa > bhinda
Construction bhinda + ti
Synonym padāleti
Sanskrit bhinatti
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, gāmaṇi, puriso sappikumbhaṃ vā telakumbhaṃ vā gambhīre udakarahade ogāhetvā bhindeyya.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

rudha'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato apaccayo hoti kattari, pubbe niggahit'āgamo hoti. rundhati, chindati, bhindati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 446
bhindati 2

pr. (+acc) breaks out (into) [√bhid + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning breaks out (into)
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Base √bhid + ṃa > bhinda
Construction bhinda + ti
Sanskrit bhinatti
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

sac'assa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpema, na tv'eva mayaṃ, bhante, tappaccayā vācaṃ bhindāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

pubbe kho, gahapati, vitakketvā vicāretvā pacchā vācaṃ bhindati, tasmā vitakkavicārā vacīsaṅkhāro.

SN 41.6 dutiyakāmabhūsuttaṃ
bhindati 3

pr. (+acc) (of a posture or sitting position) breaks; changes; moves [√bhid + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of a posture or sitting position) breaks; changes; moves
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Base √bhid + ṃa > bhinda
Construction bhinda + ti
Commentary (MNa) bhindissāmī'ti ... mocessāmī'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhinatti
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

idha, sāriputta, bhikkhu pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā, na tāv'āhaṃ imaṃ pallaṅkaṃ bhindissāmi yāva me n'ānupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuccissatī'ti.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
bhindati 4

pr. (+acc) cause a schism (in); splits apart (the community); lit. splits [√bhid + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning cause a schism (in); splits apart (the community); lit. splits
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Base √bhid + ṃa > bhinda
Construction bhinda + ti
Commentary (UDa) devadatto saṅghaṃ bhindissatī'ti bhedakarānaṃ sabbesaṃ devadattena sajjitattā ek'aṃsen'eva devadatto ajja saṅghaṃ bhindissati dvidhā karissati. adhammaṃ dhammo'tiādīsu hi aṭṭhārasasu bhedakaravatthūsu yaṃkiñci ekam'pi vatthuṃ dīpetvā tena tena kāraṇena imaṃ gaṇhatha, imaṃ rocethā'ti saññāpetvā salākaṃ gāhetvā visuṃ saṅghakamme kate saṅgho bhinno hoti.
Sanskrit bhinatti
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

ajja, bhante, devadatto saṅghaṃ bhindissati, uposathañ'ca karissati saṅghakammāni cā'ti.

UD48 saṅghabhedasuttaṃ
bhindati 5

pr. completes (a course of action) [√bhid] ✗
bhindana

nt. breaking up [√bhid] ✗
bhindanta 1

prp. (+acc) shooting down; lit. breaking; splitting [√bhid + ṃa + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of bhindati, trans (+acc)
Meaning shooting down; lit. breaking; splitting
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Base √bhid + ṃa > bhinda
Construction bhinda + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Variant vobhindanta
Commentary (MNa) te bhindantā maññe carantī'ti vālavedhi viya vālaṃ sukhumāni'pi paresaṃ diṭṭhigatāni attano paññāgatena bhindantā viya carantī'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhindat
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

katamāni cattāri? idh'āhaṃ, bho, passāmi ekacce khattiyapaṇḍite nipuṇe kataparappavāde vālavedhirūpe, te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
bhindanta 2

prp. (+acc) breaking; splitting apart [√bhid + ṃa + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of bhindati, trans (+acc)
Meaning breaking; splitting apart
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Base √bhid + ṃa > bhinda
Construction bhinda + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym phalanta
Variant bhidura
Sanskrit bhindat
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

bhindant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kāyo, viññāṇaṃ virāgadhammaṃ, sabbe upadhī aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā'ti. etam'atthaṃ bhagavā avoca.

ITI77 bhidurasuttaṃ
bhindi

aor. broke, split, severed [√bhid] ✗
bhindita

pp. broken, split, severed [√bhid] ✗
bhindituṃ

inf. (+acc) to break, to split, to sever [√bhid] ✗
bhinditvā

abs. (+acc) having broken; having shattered; having split up [√bhid + ṃa + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of bhindati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having broken; having shattered; having split up
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Base √bhid + ṃa > bhinda
Construction bhinda + itvā
Synonym bhetvā
Commentary (VINa) bhinditvā vā'ti sitthāni bhinditvā udakagatikāni katvā chaḍḍeti.
Sanskrit bhittvā
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

kārāpeyyā'ti karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ. paṭilābhena bhinditvā pācittiyaṃ desetabbaṃ.

VIN 2.5.9.4 sūcigharasikkhāpadaṃ

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, uddharitvā vā bhinditvā vā paṭiggahe vā nīharitvā vā chaḍḍeti, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo
bhindisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 17.31 (SN17.31) ✗
bhinna 1

pp. broken; cracked; damaged [√bhid + na] ✓

Grammar pp of bhijjati
Meaning broken; cracked; damaged
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction √bhid + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Antonym abhinna
Synonym ghaṭita, chinna
Commentary (MNa) se bhinne'ti taṃ bhinnaṃ.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit bhinna
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

atha kho āyasmā aṅgulimālo bhinnena sīsena, lohitena gaḷantena, bhinnena pattena, vipphālitāya saṅghāṭiyā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

MN 86 aṅgulimālasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puthusilā dvedhābhinnā appaṭisandhikā hoti. evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, ākiñcaññ'āyatan'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye āneñjasaṃyojane se bhinne.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
bhinna 2

pp. split; split apart; broken [√bhid + na] ✓

Grammar pp of bhindati
Meaning split; split apart; broken
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction √bhid + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Antonym abhinna
Sanskrit bhinna
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

iti bhinnānaṃ vā sandhātā sahitānaṃ vā anuppadātā samagg'ārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puthusilā dvedhābhinnā appaṭisandhikā hoti. evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, ākiñcaññ'āyatan'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye āneñjasaṃyojane se bhinne.

bhinnaka 1

adj. broken, damaged, divided [√bhid] ✗

Meaning divided; lit. broken

bhinna + ka

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bhinnapaṭadhara

adj. wearing rag robe; wearing torn cloth; wearing broken garment [bhinna + paṭa + dhara] ✓

Meaning wearing rag robe; wearing torn cloth; wearing broken garment
Construction bhinna + paṭa + dhara

Commentary (VINa) agghaphassavaṇṇabhedena bhinnaṃ paṭaṃ dhāretī'ti bhinnapaṭadharo.
Sanskrit bhinna + paṭa + dhara

Example

bhikkhū'ti bhikkhako'ti bhikkhu, bhikkhācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu, bhinnapaṭadharo'ti bhikkhu, samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu

bhiyyo

ind. (+abl) more (than); greater than (than); better than (than); superior (to) [√bhū + ya + o] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, compar of bhūri (+abl)
Meaning more (than); greater than (than); better than (than); superior (to)
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhī + ya + o
bhiyya + o
Phonetic Change ū > ī
īy > iyy
Antonym nīceyya
Variant bhīyo
Commentary (MNa) bhiyyo'ti atirek'atthe nipāto.
Sanskrit bhūyas
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, ye kho keci atītam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayiṃsu, etāvaparamaṃ, na'y'ito bhiyyo.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

yo ca sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca,
tiṇā bhiyyo na maññati,
karaṃ purisakiccāni,
so sukhā na vihāyati.

TH 174 mātaṅgaputtattheragāthā
bhiyyokamyatā

Meaning desire for more; greed for more; wanting more

Examples

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sūpam'pi byañjanam'pi odanena paṭicchādenti bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāya

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo

Synonym vinibbaya
Sanskrit bhūyobhāva

Examples

tattha appasannā c'eva pasīdanti, pasannānañ'ca bhiyyobhāvo hoti.

aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, hetū aṭṭha paccayā ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattanti. katame aṭṭha?

nt. names of Koṇāgamana Buddha's pair of chief disciples; Bhiyyosa and Uttara ✗

Examples

janapadakalyāṇī naccati gāyatī'ti kho, bhikkhave, bhiyyosomattāya mahājanakāyo sannipateyya.

evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, puriso bhiyyosomattāya tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvediyetha.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
bhisa

nt. lotus stalk (eaten as a delicacy) ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning lotus stalk (eaten as a delicacy)
Non IA bis (Santali)
Sanskrit bisa, vīsa

Examples

so bajjhataṃ pāsasatehi chabbhi,
rammā vanā niyyatu rājadhāniṃ,
tuttehi so haññatu pācanehi,
bhisāni te brāhmaṇa yo ahāsi.

JA 488 bhisa jātakaṃ

bhisamuḷālaṃ gaṇhitvā,
agamaṃ buddhasantikaṃ,
tañ'ca buddhassa pādāsiṃ,
pasanno sehi pāṇibhi.

APA 67 bhisadāyaka therāpadānaṃ
bhisakka

masc. doctor; physician; healer ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning doctor; physician; healer
Synonym tikicchaka
Commentary (APt) bhisajjati cikicchatī'ti bhisakko, a, jassa ko.
Notes MW suggests abhi √saj, ‘to attach, plaster’
Sanskrit bhiṣaj

Examples

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sallena viddho assa savisena gāḷh'ūpalepanena. tassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā bhisakkaṃ sallakattaṃ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṃ.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

aham'asmi, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇo yācayogo sadā payatapāṇi antimadehadharo anuttaro bhisakko sallakatto.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
bhisajātaka

nt. Jātaka 488 (JA 488) ✗
bhisapuppha

nt. lotus flower; Nelumbo nucifera [bhisa + puppha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning lotus flower; Nelumbo nucifera
Construction bhisa + puppha
Compound kammadhāraya (bhisa + puppha)
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelumbo_nucifera
Sanskrit bisapuṣpa

Example

yo rāgam'udacchidā asesaṃ,
bhisapupphaṃ'va saroruhaṃ vigayha,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1
bhisamuḷāla

nt. lotus stalk and root [bhisa + muḷāla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning lotus stalk and root
Construction bhisa + muḷāla
Compound dvanda (bhisa ca muḷāla ca)
Non IA bis (Santali), muḷari (Tamil)
Sanskrit bisa + mulālin

Examples

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, araññ'āyatane mahāsarasī. taṃ nāgā upanissāya viharanti. te taṃ sarasiṃ ogāhetvā soṇḍāya bhisamuḷālaṃ abbuhetvā suvikkhālitaṃ vikkhāletvā akaddamaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharanti.

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ

bhisamuḷālaṃ gaṇhitvā,
agamaṃ buddhasantikaṃ,
tañ'ca buddhassa pādāsiṃ,
pasanno sehi pāṇibhi.

APA 67 bhisadāyaka therāpadānaṃ
bhisi

fem. cushion; pillow; bolster; mattress ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning cushion; pillow; bolster; mattress
Synonym bibbohanā, bimbohanā
Commentary (VIN 2.5.2.4) bhisi nāma pañca bhisiyo, uṇṇabhisi, coḷabhisi, vākabhisi, tiṇabhisi, paṇṇabhisi.
Notes (MW) the seat of a religious student or of an ascetic
Sanskrit bṛsī

Example

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 14 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
bhisicchavi

fem. mattress cover; pillow cover; lit. cushion skin [bhisi + chavi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning mattress cover; pillow cover; lit. cushion skin
Construction bhisi + chavi
Commentary (VINa) bhisicchavī'ti mañcabhisiyā vā pīṭhabhisiyā vā chavi, sace pūritā hoti vidhunitvā'pi gahetuṃ vaṭṭati.
bhisibibbohana

nt. cushions and pillows [bhisi + bibbohana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cushions and pillows
Construction bhisi + bibbohana
Variant bhisibimbohana
Sanskrit bṛsī + bimbopadhāna
bhisibimbohana

nt. cushions and pillows [bhisi + bimbohana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cushions and pillows
Construction bhisi + bimbohana
Variant bhisibibbohana
Sanskrit bṛsī + bimbopadhāna
bhisī

fem. raft ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning raft
Commentary (SNPa) tattha bhisī'ti pattharitvā puthulaṃ katvā baddhakullo vuccati loke. ariyassa pana dhammavinaye ariyamaggassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

Example

baddhā'si bhisī susaṅkhatā,
tiṇṇo pāragato vineyya oghaṃ,
attho bhisiyā na vijjati,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
bhismā

fem. terror; dread; fear [√bhis] ✗
bhismākāya

adj. with a terrifying body; with awesome physical form [bhismā + kāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a terrifying body; with awesome physical form
Construction bhismā + kāya
bhiṃsana

adj. horrible, dreadful, awe-inspiring [√bhis] ✗
bhiṃsanaka

adj. frightening; terrifying; scary; (comm) producing fear [√bhis + ṃa + ana + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhiṃsana
Meaning frightening; terrifying; scary; (comm) producing fear
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa (fear)
Base √bhis + ṃa > bhiṃsa
Construction bhiṃsa + ana + ka
bhiṃsana + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change sṃ > ṃs (metathesis)
Synonym lomahaṃsana
Variant bhīsanaka
Commentary (MNa) bhiṃsanakānī'ti bhayajanakāni, passato'pi suṇato'pi bhayaṃ janenti.
Sanskrit bhīṣaṇaka
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)

Examples

vāḷamigasaṅghasevitaṃ,
kuñjaramattakareṇuloḷitaṃ,
asahāyikā gantum'icchasi,
rahitaṃ bhiṃsanakaṃ mahāvanaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ yā tā rattiyo abhiññātā abhilakkhitā, cātuddasī pañcadasī aṭṭhamī ca pakkhassa, tathārūpāsu rattīsu yāni tāni ārāmacetiyāni vanacetiyāni rukkhacetiyāni bhiṃsanakāni salomahaṃsāni tathārūpesu sen'āsanesu vihareyyaṃ app'eva nām'āhaṃ bhayabheravaṃ passeyyan'ti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
bhiṃsanakata

nt. fearfulness; dreadfulness; terribleness; horribleness [√bhis + ṃa + ana + ka + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from bhiṃsanaka
Meaning fearfulness; dreadfulness; terribleness; horribleness
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa (fear)
Base √bhis + ṃa > bhiṃsa
Construction bhiṃsa + ana + ka + tta > ta
bhiṃsanaka + tta > ta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change sṃ > ṃs (metathesis)
tt > t
Variant bhiṃsanakatta
Commentary (MNa) bhiṃsanakatasmin'ti bhiṃsanakabhāve'ti attho. ekassa takārassa lopo daṭṭhabbo. bhiṃsanakattasmin'ti'y'eva vā pāṭho, bhiṃsanakatāya iti vā vattabbe liṅgavipallāso kato, nimitt'atthe c'etaṃ bhummavacanaṃ.
Sanskrit bhīṣaṇatva
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)

Example

atrāssudaṃ, sāriputta, bhiṃsanakassa vanasaṇḍassa bhiṃsanakatasmiṃ hoti, yo koci avītarāgo taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ pavisati, yebhuyyena lomāni haṃsanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
bhiṃsā

fem. fright; fear; terror [√bhis + ṃa + ā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from bhiṃsati
Meaning fright; fear; terror
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa (fear)
Base √bhis + ṃa > bhiṃsa
Construction bhiṃsa + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change sṃ > ṃs (metathesis)
Synonym bhīru
Sanskrit bhīṣā
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)
bhiṃsāpana

nt. frightening; terrifying; scaring; lit. causing fear [√bhis + ṃa + *āpe + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from bhiṃsāpeti, caus
Meaning frightening; terrifying; scaring; lit. causing fear
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa + *āpe (fear)
Base √bhis + ṃa + āpe > bhiṃsāpe (caus)
Construction bhiṃsāpe + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change sṃ > ṃs (metathesis)
Synonym santāsana
Commentary (VINt) rūp'ādīnaṃ upasaṃhārena, bhayānakakathākathanena vā upasampannassa bhiṃsāpane.
Sanskrit bhīṣaṇa
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)
bhiṃsāpanasikkhāpada

nt. rule about frightening; Pācittiya 55 [bhiṃsāpana + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about frightening; Pācittiya 55
Construction bhiṃsāpana + sikkhāpada
bhiṃsāpīyamāna

prp. (+acc) being frightened; being terrified; being scared; lit. causing to be fearful [√bhis + ṃa + *āpe + īya + māna] ~

Grammar prp of bhiṃsāpīyati, caus, pass, trans (+acc)
Meaning being frightened; being terrified; being scared; lit. causing to be fearful
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa + *āpe + īya (fear)
Base √bhis + ṃa + āpe + īya > bhiṃsāpīya (caus, pass)
Construction bhiṃsāpīya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change sṃ > ṃs (metathesis)
Sanskrit bhyasayamāna
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)
bhiṃsāpeti

pr. (+acc) frightens; terrifies; scares; lit. causes fear [√bhis + ṃa + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of bhiṃseti, trans (+acc)
Meaning frightens; terrifies; scares; lit. causes fear
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa + *āpe (fear)
Base √bhis + ṃa + āpe > bhiṃsāpe (caus)
Construction bhiṃsāpe + ti
Phonetic Change sṃ > ṃs (metathesis)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.6.5) bhiṃsāpeyyā'ti upasampanno upasampannaṃ bhiṃsāpetu'kāmo rūpaṃ vā saddaṃ vā gandhaṃ vā rasaṃ vā phoṭṭhabbaṃ vā upasaṃharati.
Sanskrit bhyāsayati
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ bhiṃsāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 55 bhiṃsāpanasikkhāpadaṃ
bhiṃsāpetukāma

adj. wanting to frighten; wishing to scare; lit. wanting to cause to fear [bhiṃsāpetuṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting to frighten; wishing to scare; lit. wanting to cause to fear
Construction bhiṃsāpetuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (bhiṃsāpetuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit bhyas + kāma

Example

bhiṃsāpeyyā'ti upasampanno upasampannaṃ bhiṃsāpetu'kāmo rūpaṃ vā saddaṃ vā gandhaṃ vā rasaṃ vā phoṭṭhabbaṃ vā upasaṃharati. bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.5 bhiṃsāpanasikkhāpadaṃ
bhiṃsāpetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to frighten; to terrify; to scare; lit. to cause to fear [√bhis + ṃa + *āpe + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of bhiṃsāpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to frighten; to terrify; to scare; lit. to cause to fear
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa + *āpe (fear)
Base √bhis + ṃa + āpe > bhiṃsāpe (caus)
Construction bhiṃsāpe + tuṃ
Phonetic Change sṃ > ṃs (metathesis)
Sanskrit bhyas
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)

Example

bhiṃsāpeyyā'ti upasampanno upasampannaṃ bhiṃsāpetu'kāmo rūpaṃ vā saddaṃ vā gandhaṃ vā rasaṃ vā phoṭṭhabbaṃ vā upasaṃharati. bhāyeyya vā so na vā bhāyeyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.5 bhiṃsāpanasikkhāpadaṃ
bhīta 1

pp. (+gen) afraid (of); frightened (of); terrified (of) [√bhī + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhāyati (+gen)
Meaning afraid (of); frightened (of); terrified (of)
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym abhīta
Synonym utrasta, ubbigga, saṃvijita
Sanskrit bhīta
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Examples

apuññalābho ca gatī ca pāpikā,
bhītassa bhītāya ratī ca thokikā,
rājā ca daṇḍaṃ garukaṃ paṇeti,
tasmā naro paradāraṃ na seve.

DHP 310 nirayavaggo

yass'eva bhīto na dadāti maccharī,
tadev'ādadato bhayaṃ,
jighacchā ca pipāsā ca,
yassa bhāyati maccharī,
tam'eva bālaṃ phusati,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ
bhīta 2

nt. fear; terror; danger; lit. feared [√bhī + ta] ~

Grammar nt, pp of bhāyati
Meaning fear; terror; danger; lit. feared
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym bhaya
Sanskrit bhīta
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)
bhītatta

nt. state of fear; state of terror [√bhī + ta + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from bhīta
Meaning state of fear; state of terror
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī + ta + tta
bhīta + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Commentary (THa) bhītattan'ti bhītabhāvo, bhayan'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhīta + tva
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Example

tassa te n'atthi bhītattaṃ,
bhiyyo vaṇṇo pasīdati,
kasmā na paridevesi,
evarūpe mahabbhaye.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
bhītāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.75 (SN1.75) ✗
bhīti

fem. fear [√bhī] ✗
bhīma

adj. dreadful, horrible [√bhī] ✗
bhīmasenajātaka

nt. Jātaka 80 (JA 80) ✗
bhīyo

ind. (+abl) more (than); greater than (than); better than (than); superior (to) [√bhū + ya + o] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, compar of bhūri (+abl)
Meaning more (than); greater than (than); better than (than); superior (to)
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū > bhī + ya + o
bhīya + o
Phonetic Change ū > ī
Antonym nīceyya
Variant bhiyyo
Sanskrit bhūyas
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

idha tappati pecca tappati,
pāpakārī ubhay'attha tappati,
pāpaṃ me katan'ti tappati,
bhīyo tappati duggatiṃ gato.

DHP 17 yamakavaggo
bhīyoso mattāya

idiom. still more ✗
bhīru 1

adj. timid; cautious; fearful; cowardly [√bhī + ru] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhāyati
Meaning timid; cautious; fearful; cowardly
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī + ru
Derivative kita (ru)
Synonym kātara, sabhīru
Sanskrit bhīru
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Example

yo pāṇabhūtāni aheṭhayaṃ caraṃ,
par'ūpavādā na karonti pāpaṃ,
bhīruṃ pasaṃsanti na hi tattha sūraṃ,
bhayā hi santo na karonti pāpan'ti.

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ
bhīru 2

fem. fear; terror [√bhī + ru] ✓

Grammar fem, from bhāyati, neg
Meaning fear; terror
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī + ru
Derivative kita (ru)
Synonym bhiṃsā, bherava
Commentary (ANa) bhītassa parittāyakattā bhīruttāṇan'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit bhīru
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Example

puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
bhīruka 1

adj. fearful; afraid; scared [√bhī + ru + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhīru
Meaning fearful; afraid; scared
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī + ru + ka
bhīru + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (MNa) bhīrukajātikā'ti bhīrukapakatikā, gāmadārakā viya bhayabahulā asūrā kātarā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit bhīruka
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Example

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā chambhī bhīrukajātikā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, chambhibhīrukajātikasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
bhīruka 2

adj. timid, cowardly [√bhī] ✗
bhīrukajātaka

nt. Jātaka 132 (JA 132) ✗
bhīrukajātika

adj. naturally fearful; scared in nature [bhīruka + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning naturally fearful; scared in nature
Construction bhīruka + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (bhīruka + jātika)
Commentary (MNa) bhīrukajātikā'ti bhīrukapakatikā, gāmadārakā viya bhayabahulā asūrā kātarā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit bhīruka + jātīya

Example

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā chambhī bhīrukajātikā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, chambhibhīrukajātikasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
bhīruttāṇa

nt. protection against fear; refuge from fear; (comm) being a protector of the afraid [bhīru + tāṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning protection against fear; refuge from fear; (comm) being a protector of the afraid
Construction bhīru + tāṇa
Commentary (ANa) bhītassa parittāyakattā bhīruttāṇan'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit bhīru + trāṇa

Example

tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rog'ātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti, akataṃ vata me kalyāṇaṃ, akataṃ kusalaṃ, akataṃ bhīruttāṇaṃ, kataṃ pāpaṃ, kataṃ luddaṃ, kataṃ kibbisaṃ.

AN 4.184 abhayasuttaṃ
bhīruttāna

nt. protection against fear; refuge from terror [bhīru + tāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning protection against fear; refuge from terror
Construction bhīru + tāna
Variant bhīruttāṇa
Commentary (ANa) bhītassa parittāyakattā bhīruttāṇan'ti vuccati. (ITIa) dukkhabhīrūnaṃ saṃsārabhīrūnañ'ca rakkhan'aṭṭhena bhīruttāṇan'ti ca vuccati.
Sanskrit bhīru + trāṇa

Example

devapuragatānañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, devānaṃ etadahosi, bhīruttānagatena kho dāni mayaṃ etarahi attanā viharāma akaraṇīyā asurehī'ti. asurānam'pi, bhikkhave, etadahosi, bhīruttānagatena kho dāni devā etarahi attanā viharanti akaraṇīyā amhehī'ti.

AN 9.39 devāsurasaṅgāmasuttaṃ
bhīruttānagata

adj. entered the refuge; gone into the shelter; lit. fear refuge gone [bhīruttāna + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning entered the refuge; gone into the shelter; lit. fear refuge gone
Construction bhīruttāna + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhīruttānaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit bhīru + trāṇa + gata

Example

devapuragatānañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, devānaṃ etadahosi, bhīruttānagatena kho dāni mayaṃ etarahi attanā viharāma akaraṇīyā asurehī'ti. asurānam'pi, bhikkhave, etadahosi, bhīruttānagatena kho dāni devā etarahi attanā viharanti akaraṇīyā amhehī'ti.

AN 9.39 devāsurasaṅgāmasuttaṃ
bhīsana

adj. dreadful, horrible ✗
bhīsanaka

adj. frightening; terrifying; scary; (comm) producing fear [√bhis + ṃa + ana + ka] ~

Grammar adj, from bhīsana
Meaning frightening; terrifying; scary; (comm) producing fear
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa (fear)
Base √bhis + ṃa > bhiṃsa > bhīsa (irreg)
Construction bhīsa + ana + ka
bhīsana + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym lomahaṃsana
Variant bhiṃsanaka
Commentary (VINa) bhiṃsanake'ti bhayānake bhayajananake.
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)
bhukkaraṇa

nt. barking (of a dog) ✗
bhukkāra

masc. barking (of a dog) ✗
bhuṅkata

pp. barked ✗
bhuṅkatvā

abs. having barked ✗
bhuṅkaraṇa

nt. barking ✗
bhuṅkari

aor. barked ✗
bhuṅkaritvā

abs. having barked ✗
bhuṅkaroti

pr. barks ✗
bhuṅkaronta

prp. barking ✗
bhuṅkāra

masc. barking (of a dog) ✗
bhuja 1

masc. hand [√bhuj] ✗
bhuja 2

nt. hand [√bhuj] ✗
bhuja 3

masc. arm; lit. bender [√bhuj] ✗
bhuja 4

adj. crooked, bending [√bhuj] ✗
bhujaga

masc. snake ✗
bhujagī

fem. name of a female deity; king Vessavaṇa's daughter ✗
bhujaṅga

masc. snake ✗
bhujaṅgama

masc. snake; lit. moving on the earth [bhū + jaṅgama] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning snake; lit. moving on the earth
Construction bhū + jaṅgama
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhuyaṃ + jaṅgama)
Synonym pādudara, sappa, uraga
Sanskrit bhujaṃgama

Examples

gāme vā yadi v'āraññe,
yattha passe bhujaṅgamaṃ.
daharo'ti n'āvajāneyya,
na naṃ paribhave naro.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ

tasmā hi paṇḍito poso,
sampassaṃ attham'attano,
bhujaṅgamaṃ pāvakañ'ca,
khattiyañ'ca yasassinaṃ,
bhikkhuñ'ca sīlasampannaṃ,
samma'd'eva samācare'ti.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
bhujaṅgasīsajā

fem. kind of pearl from a snake's head ✗
bhujapatta

masc. Bhurja tree, kind of willow ✗
bhujissa 1

adj. cleansing; freeing; liberating ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning cleansing; freeing; liberating
Commentary (ANa) tāni pan'etāni taṇhādāsabyato mocetvā bhujissabhāvakaraṇato bhujissāni
Sanskrit bhujiṣya

Example

puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, ariyasāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṃvattanikāni.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
bhujissa 2

masc. freed slave; free man ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning freed slave; free man
Commentary (MNa) bhujisso'ti attano santako.
Sanskrit bhujiṣya

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso dāso assa anatt'ādhīno par'ādhīno na yenakāmaṃgamo. so aparena samayena tamhā dāsabyā mucceyya att'ādhīno apar'ādhīno bhujisso yenakāmaṃgamo.

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
bhujissabhāva

masc. state of being a free man [bhujissa + bhāva] ~

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning state of being a free man
Construction bhujissa + bhāva
bhujissabhāvakaraṇa

nt. acting as a free man [bhujissabhāva + karaṇa] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning acting as a free man
Construction bhujissabhāva + karaṇa
bhujji

aor. (+acc) was used; was employed [√bhuj + ya + i] ~

Base √bhuj + ya > bhujja (pass)
Construction bhujja + i
Sanskrit abhoji
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)
bhuñjaka

masc. who eats or enjoys [√bhuj] ✗
bhuñjati 1

pr. (+acc) eats; consumes [√bhuj + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning eats; consumes
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Base √bhuj + ṃa > bhuñja
Construction bhuñja + ti
Synonym āhāreti, paribhuñjati
Sanskrit bhujati
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.

MN 65 bhaddālisuttaṃ

ahaṃ kho, samaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi. tvam'pi, samaṇa, kasassu ca vapassu ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjassū'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhuñjati 2

pr. (+acc) (of sensual pleasures) uses; enjoys; partakes (of); indulges (in) [√bhuj + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of sensual pleasures) uses; enjoys; partakes (of); indulges (in)
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Base √bhuj + ṃa > bhuñja
Construction bhuñja + ti
Synonym āharati, nisevati, paricarati
Sanskrit bhujati
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

yuvā'si tvaṃ pabbajito,
tiṭṭhāhi mama sāsane,
bhuñja mānusake kāme,
ahaṃ vittaṃ dadāmi te,
saccaṃ te paṭijānāmi,
aggiṃ vā te harām'ahaṃ.

TH 224 sundarasamuddattheragāthā

tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā'ti?

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
bhuñjatī

bhuñjana

nt. eating; dining [√bhuj + ṃa + ana] ✓

Meaning eating; dining
Root Family √bhuj

Examples

idaṃ te khāditabbaṃ, idaṃ te na khāditabbaṃ, idaṃ te bhuñjitabbaṃ, idaṃ te na bhuñjitabbaṃ, idaṃ te sāyitabbaṃ, idaṃ te na sāyitabbaṃ, idaṃ te pātabbaṃ, idaṃ te na pātabbaṃ

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo

gilānasamayo nāma na sakkoti ek'āsane nisinno yāva'd'atthaṃ bhuñjituṃ, gilānasamayo'ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.

VIN 2.5.4.3 paramparabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā

Examples

jegucchaṃ me na vijjati.

TH 261 mahākassapattheragāthā

na khv'āhaṃ taṃ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya, yassa so pāyaso bhutto sammā pariṇāmaṃ gaccheyya, aññatra tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhutta 2

pp. used; enjoyed [√bhuj + ta] ✓

Meaning used; enjoyed
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change j > t
Commentary (SNa) bhuttaṃ theyyena tassa tan'ti sabbo'pi tassa catupaccayaparibhogo theyyena paribhutto nāma hotī'ti devatā bhagavantaṃ sandhāya vadati. (SNt) tassa kuhakassa. taṃ catunnaṃ paccayānaṃ paribhuñjanaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

aññathā santam'attānaṃ,
aññathā yo pavedaye,
nikacca kitavass'eva,
bhuttaṃ theyyena tassa taṃ.

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
bhuttāvinā kataṃ

idiom. (vinaya) done by one who has eaten [bhuttāvinā + kataṃ] ✓

Grammar idiom, app + pp
Meaning (vinaya) done by one who has eaten
Construction bhuttāvinā + kataṃ
Antonym abhuttāvinā kataṃ
Commentary (VINa) bhuttāvinā kataṃ hotī'ti anantare nisinnassa sabhāgassa bhikkhuno pattato ekam'pi sitthaṃ vā maṃsahīraṃ vā khāditvā katam'pi bhuttāvinā'va kataṃ hotī'ti veditabbaṃ.
Sanskrit bhukta + kṛta

Example

atirittaṃ nāma kappiyakataṃ hoti, paṭiggahitakataṃ hoti, uccāritakataṃ hoti, hatthapāse kataṃ hoti, bhuttāvinā kataṃ hoti, bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā avuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti

bhuttāvī 1

Phonetic Change j > t
Antonym abhuttāvī
Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.5) bhuttāvī nāma pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññataraṃ bhojanaṃ antamaso kus'aggena'pi bhuttaṃ hoti.

Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

VIN PAT PC 35 paṭhamapavāraṇāsikkhāpadaṃ

anatirittaṃ nāma akappiyakataṃ hoti, appaṭiggahitakataṃ hoti, anuccāritakataṃ hoti, ahatthapāse kataṃ hoti, abhuttāvinā kataṃ hoti, bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā vuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti

SN 1.41 ādittasuttaṃ

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
bhutvāna 2

abs. (+acc) (of sensual pleasures) having enjoyed; having partaken (of) [√bhuj + tvāna] ✓

Meaning (of sensual pleasures) having enjoyed; having partaken (of)
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj + tvāna
Phonetic Change jt > t
Sanskrit bhuktvā
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

abhutvā bhikkhasi bhikkhu,
na hi bhutvāna bhikkhasi,
bhutvāna bhikkhu bhikkhassu,
mā taṃ kālo upaccagā'ti.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
bhumma 1

adj. earthly; terrestrial [√bhū + mi + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhūmi
Meaning earthly; terrestrial
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + mi + ya
bhūmi + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Variant bhūma
Sanskrit bhūmya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni,
bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe,
sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu,
atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

dīghassa parajanassa yakkhassa saddaṃ sutvā bhummā devā saddam'anussāvesuṃ, lābhā vata bho vajjīnaṃ, suladdhalābhā vajjipajāya, yattha tathāgato viharati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
bhumma 2

masc. terrestrial deity; earth god [√bhū] ✗
bhumma 3

adj. having stages or stories [√bhū] ✗
bhumma 4

nt. (gram) locative case [√bhū] ✗
bhummajaka

masc. name of one of the group of six monks ✗
bhummaṭṭha

adj. standing on the ground; situated on the earth; lit. standing on the earth [bhumma + ṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from bhumma
Meaning standing on the ground; situated on the earth; lit. standing on the earth
Construction bhumma + ṭha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhummasmiṃ + ṭṭha)
Variant bhūmaṭṭha
Sanskrit bhūma + stha

Example

pamādaṃ appamādena,
yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha,
asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhummaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.

DHP 28 appamādavaggo
bhummattha

masc. (gram) locative meaning [bhumma + attha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) locative meaning
Construction bhumma + attha
Commentary (MNt) samaye'ti bhumm'atthe samayan'ti upayogavacanaṃ.
bhummattharaṇa

nt. ground covering, carpet ✗
bhummantara

nt. different stages or planes ✗
bhummantalikkha

nt. terrestrial and celestial portents; earthly and atmospheric omens [bhumma + antalikkha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning terrestrial and celestial portents; earthly and atmospheric omens
Construction bhumma + antalikkha
Compound dvanda > bahubbīhi (bhumma ca antalikkha ca)
Sanskrit bhaumī + āntarikṣa

Example

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ ... bhūmikampaṃ disādāhaṃ bhumm'antalikkhaṃ jotisaṃ lok'āyatikaṃ sācakkaṃ migacakkaṃ antaracakkaṃ missak'uppādaṃ sakuṇarutaravitaṃ sikkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
bhummavacana

Meaning (gram) locative case; lit. term for earth
Construction bhumma + vacana

Synonym sattamī
Sanskrit bhūmya + vacana

Example

evarūpe mahabbhaye'ti edise mahati maraṇabhaye upaṭṭhite. hetuatthe vā etaṃ bhummavacanaṃ.

THa 248 adhimuttattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
bhummavāra

masc. Tuesday; lit. day of Mars [bhumma + vāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Tuesday; lit. day of Mars
Construction bhumma + vāra

Example

pañca-cattāḷisa-saṃvaccharāni vasitvā, sappa-saṃvacchare, vesākha-puṇṇamiyaṃ bhummavāre parinibbāyi.

Sri Lanka buddha-vassa-sajjhāyanā
bhuyya

ind. more; greater [√bhū + ya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, in comps, compar of √bhū
Meaning more; greater
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change ūy > uyy
Variant bhūya
Sanskrit bhūyas
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

dvayanissito khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena, atthitañ'c'eva natthitañ'ca.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

hoti so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ ayaṃ loko saṃvaṭṭati. saṃvaṭṭamāne, bhikkhave, loke yebhuyyena sattā ābhassarasaṃvattanikā bhavanti.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
bhusa 1.1

adj. strong; powerful; mighty; intense; potent [√bhus + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning strong; powerful; mighty; intense; potent
Root Family √bhus
Root √bhus×3 ya (fall heavily)
Construction √bhus + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ugga, thāmavant, balavant, balasampanna, balī, bahala, mahanta, vaccasī
Commentary (SNa) bhusā'ti balavatiyo.
Sanskrit bhṛśa
Sanskrit Root √bhṛś √bhraś √bhraṅś 1, 4 (fall)

Examples

evaṃ sammā vimuttacittassa, bhante, bhikkhuno bhusā ce'pi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, n'ev'assa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

yassa chattiṃsati sotā,
manāpasavanā bhusā,
vāhā vahanti duddiṭṭhiṃ,
saṅkappā rāganissitā.

DHP 339 taṇhāvaggo
bhusa 2.1

nt. chaff; husk; straw; debris ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning chaff; husk; straw; debris
Synonym bhusikā
Sanskrit busa

Examples

atha kho te thūṇeyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā udapānaṃ tiṇassa ca bhusassa ca yāva mukhato pūresuṃ, mā te muṇḍakā samaṇakā pānīyaṃ apaṃsū'ti

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ

sudassaṃ vajjam'aññesaṃ,
attano pana duddasaṃ,
paresaṃ hi so vajjāni,
opunāti yathā bhusaṃ,
attano pana chādeti,
kaliṃ'va kitavā saṭho.

DHP 252 malavaggo
bhusapetavatthu

nt. Petavatthu 29 (PV 29) ✗
bhusamuṭṭhi

fem. handful of chaff; fistful of straw [bhusa + muṭṭhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning handful of chaff; fistful of straw
Construction bhusa + muṭṭhi
bhusaṃ 1

ind. intensely; exceedingly; very; strongly [√bhus + a + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of bhusa
Meaning intensely; exceedingly; very; strongly
Root Family √bhus
Root √bhus×3 ya (fall heavily)
Construction √bhus + a + aṃ
bhusa + aṃ
Synonym atibyā, ativiya, ativyā, atīva, gāḷhaṃ
Sanskrit bhṛśam
Sanskrit Root √bhṛś √bhraś √bhraṅś 1, 4 (fall)

Example

ye ariyasaccāni vibhāvayanti,
gambhīrapaññena sudesitāni,
kiñ'cā'pi te honti bhusaṃ pamattā,
na te bhavaṃ aṭṭhamam'ādiyanti,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
bhusaṃ 2

ind. harshly; violently; severely [√bhus + a + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of bhusa
Meaning harshly; violently; severely
Root Family √bhus
Root √bhus×3 ya (fall heavily)
Construction √bhus + a + aṃ
bhusa + aṃ
Commentary (SNa) tasmiṃ pakkamate bhusan'ti tasmiṃ puggale balavaupakkamaṃ upakkamati.
Sanskrit bhṛśam
Sanskrit Root √bhṛś √bhraś √bhraṅś 1, 4 (fall)

Example

ṭhānañ'hi so manuj'indo,
rajjaṃ laddhāna khattiyo,
so kuddho rājadaṇḍena,
tasmiṃ pakkamate bhusaṃ,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
bhusāgāra

nt. threshing house ✗

prp. barking [√bhuss] ✗

aor. barked [√bhuss] ✗

abs. having barked [√bhuss] ✗
bhū 1.1

root. (gram) √bhū (be) [√bhū + ū] ✓

Grammar root, masc
Meaning (gram) √bhū (be)
Root Family √bhū

Construction √bhū + ū
Derivative kita (ū)
Sanskrit bhū
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 475

brū bhū'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ āha bhūva'icc'ete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ parokkhāyaṃ vibhattiyaṃ. āha, āhu, babhūva, babhūvu. parokkhāyam'iti kim'atthaṃ? abravuṃ

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 475
bhū 1.2

fem. earth; ground [√bhū + ū] ✓

Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)

Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

gāme vā yadi v'āraññe,
yattha passe bhujaṅgamaṃ.
daharo'ti n'āvajāneyya,
na naṃ paribhave naro.

Meaning brow; eyebrow

bhūjati

fem. name of a female deity; king Vessavaṇa's daughter ✗
bhūta 1

pp. existing; born; living; lit. become [√bhū + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhavati
Meaning existing; born; living; lit. become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym abhūta
Synonym jīva
Commentary (MNa) bhūtasaddo pañcakkhandh'āmanussa-dhātu-vijjamāna-khīṇ'āsava-satta-rukkh'ādīsu dissati.
Sanskrit bhūta
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

cattāro'me, āvuso, āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā, sambhav'esīnaṃ vā anuggahāya.

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
bhūta 2

pp. true; correct; genuine; accurate; lit. become [√bhū + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhavati
Meaning true; correct; genuine; accurate; lit. become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym abhūta
Synonym yathābhucca, sacca, saccika
Commentary (MNa) bhūtasaddo pañcakkhandh'āmanussa-dhātu-vijjamāna-khīṇ'āsava-satta-rukkh'ādīsu dissati ... bhūtasmiṃ pācittiyan'tiādīsu vijjamāne. (DNa) bhūtā'ti sabhāvato vijjamānā.
Sanskrit bhūta
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

idha, potaliya, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇ'ārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇ'ārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.

AN 4.100 potaliyasuttaṃ
bhūta 3

nt. being; living being; entity; lit. become [√bhū + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of bhavati
Meaning being; living being; entity; lit. become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (MNa) bhūtasaddo pañcakkhandh'āmanussa-dhātu-vijjamāna-khīṇ'āsava-satta-rukkh'ādīsu dissati ... sabb'eva nikkhipissanti bhūtā loke samussayan'ti ettha sattesu.
Sanskrit bhūta
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

sukhakāmāni bhūtāni,
yo daṇḍena vihiṃsati,
attano sukham'esāno,
pecca so na labhate sukhaṃ.

DHP 131 daṇḍavaggo

alaṅ'kato ce'pi samaṃ careyya,
santo danto niyato brahmacārī,
sabbesu bhūtesu nidhāya daṇḍaṃ,
so brāhmaṇo so samaṇo sa bhikkhu.

DHP 142 daṇḍavaggo
bhūta 4

pp. become; born [√bhū + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhavati
Meaning become; born
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Antonym sambhavesī, abhūta
Commentary (MNa) bhūtasaddo pañcakkhandh'āmanussa-dhātu-vijjamāna-khīṇ'āsava-satta-rukkh'ādīsu dissati ... bhūtam'idan'ti, bhikkhave, samanupassathā'tiādīsu hi ayaṃ pañcakkhandhesu dissati.
Sanskrit bhūta
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

upādānapaccayā bhavo,
bhūto dukkhaṃ nigacchati,
jātassa maraṇaṃ hoti,
eso dukkhassa sambhavo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, atthi ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ, tasmā jātassa bhūtassa katassa saṅkhatassa nissaraṇaṃ paññāyetha

UD 73 tatiya nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
bhūta 5

nt. state; elemental state; element; lit. become [√bhū + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of bhavati, in comps
Meaning state; elemental state; element; lit. become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (MNa) bhūtasaddo pañcakkhandh'āmanussa-dhātu-vijjamāna-khīṇ'āsava-satta-rukkh'ādīsu dissati ... cattāro kho, bhikkhu, mahābhūtā hetū'ti ettha dhātūsu.
Sanskrit bhūta
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhu catunnaṃ mahābhūtānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ettāvatā kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno dassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ hotī'ti.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ
bhūta 7

masc. non-human being; non-physical being; ghost; lit. become [√bhū + ta] ✓

Meaning non-human being; non-physical being; ghost; lit. become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (MNa) bhūtasaddo pañcakkhandh'āmanussa-dhātu-vijjamāna-khīṇ'āsava-satta-rukkh'ādīsu dissati ... yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatānī'ti ettha amanussesu.
Sanskrit bhūta
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni,

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
bhūta 8

pp. like; as; similar to; lit. become [√bhū + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bhavati
Meaning like; as; similar to; lit. become
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym upanibha, upama, disa, nibha, paṭibhāga, sannibha
Commentary (MNa) rogo'va bhūto'ti rogabhūto. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit bhūta
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

ayaṃ kho pana, māgaṇḍiya, kāyo rogabhūto gaṇḍabhūto sallabhūto aghabhūto ābādhabhūto, so tvaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ rogabhūtaṃ gaṇḍabhūtaṃ sallabhūtaṃ aghabhūtaṃ ābādhabhūtaṃ, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānan'ti vadesi.

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ
bhūtagāmapātabyatā

fem. causing destruction to plants; harming plantlife [bhūtagāma + pātabyatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning causing destruction to plants; harming plantlife
Construction bhūtagāma + pātabyatā
Commentary (VINa) bhūtagāmapātabyatāyā'ti ettha bhavanti ahuvuñ'cā'ti bhūtā, jāyanti vaḍḍhanti jātā vaḍḍhitā cā'ti attho. gāmo'ti rāsi, bhūtānaṃ gāmo'ti bhūtagāmo, bhūtā eva vā gāmo bhūtagāmo, patiṭṭhita-harita-tiṇa-rukkh'ādīnam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. pātabyassa bhāvo pātabyatā, chedanabhedan'ādīhi yathāruci paribhuñjitabbatā'ti attho. tassā bhūtagāmapātabyatāya, nimitt'atthe bhummavacanaṃ, bhūtagāmapātabyatāhetu, bhūtagāmassa chedan'ādipaccayā pācittiyan'ti attho.
bhūtagāmavagga

masc. Section 2 of the monk's offences requiring confession; lit. section on plants [bhūtagāma + vagga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Section 2 of the monk's offences requiring confession; lit. section on plants
Construction bhūtagāma + vagga
bhūtagāmasikkhāpada

nt. rule about (damaging) plants; Pācittiya 11 [bhūtagāma + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about (damaging) plants; Pācittiya 11
Construction bhūtagāma + sikkhāpada
bhūtagāha

masc. possession by a demon ✗
bhūtajigucchaka

adj. who is repulsed by being; who is disgusted with being [bhūta + jigucchaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is repulsed by being; who is disgusted with being
Construction bhūta + jigucchaka
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bhūtena + jigucchaka)
Sanskrit bhūta + jugupsu

Example

ahesuṃ kho ye, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ ... bhūtagarahakā bhūtajigucchakā, devagarahakā devajigucchakā, pajāpatigarahakā pajāpatijigucchakā, brahmagarahakā brahmajigucchakā

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
bhūtato

ind. as existence; as being [√bhū + ta + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of bhūta
Meaning as existence; as being
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta + to
bhūta + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Sanskrit bhūtāt
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, cakkhumanto passanti? idha bhikkhu bhūtaṃ bhūtato passati, bhūtaṃ bhūtato disvā bhūtassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cakkhumanto passantī'ti.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ
bhūtatta 1

nt. beingness; fact of being [√bhū + ta + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from bhūta
Meaning beingness; fact of being
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ta + tta
bhūta + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit bhūtatva
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

viññāṇaṃ anidassanaṃ anantaṃ sabbato pabhaṃ, taṃ ... bhūtānaṃ bhūtattena ananubhūtaṃ, devānaṃ devattena ananubhūtaṃ, pajāpatissa pajāpatittena ananubhūtaṃ, brahmānaṃ brahmattena ananubhūtaṃ

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
bhūtatta 2

nt. fact of being a ghost [√bhū] ✗
bhūtattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 232 (TH232) ✗
bhūtanirodhesakabhikkhuvatthu

nt. the story of the monk searching for the cessation of being ✗
bhūtapati

masc. Lord of Beings; Lord of the Demons; Lord of the Underworld [bhūta + pati] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Lord of Beings; Lord of the Demons; Lord of the Underworld
Construction bhūta + pati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhūtānaṃ + pati)
Sanskrit bhūtapati

Example

so puṇṇako kāmavegena giddho,
irandhatiṃ nāgakaññaṃ jigiṃsaṃ,
gantvāna taṃ bhūtapatiṃ yasassiṃ,
iccabravī vessavaṇaṃ kuveraṃ.

JA 546 vidhura jātakaṃ
bhūtapariñña

adj. completely comprehending reality; fully understanding existence [bhūta + pariññā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning completely comprehending reality; fully understanding existence
Construction bhūta + pariññā + a
bhūtapariññā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhūtaṃ + pariñña)
Commentary (ITIa) save bhūtapariñño so'ti ettha pana save'ti nipātamattaṃ. so bhūtapariñño bhūtassa atikkaman'ūpāyena maggena bhavataṇhāparikkhayā pariññātakkhandho tato eva yathābhūte nibbāne adhimutto.
Sanskrit bhūta + parijñā

Example

sa ve bhūtapariñño,
so vītataṇho bhav'ābhave,
bhūtassa vibhavā bhikkhu,
n'āgacchati punabbhavan'ti.

ITI49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ
bhūtapasaṃsaka

adj. who praises being; who approves of being [bhūta + pasaṃsaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who praises being; who approves of being
Construction bhūta + pasaṃsaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhūtaṃ + pasaṃsaka)
Sanskrit bhūta + praśaṃsaka

Example

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ ... bhūtapasaṃsakā bhūt'ābhinandino, devapasaṃsakā dev'ābhinandino, pajāpatipasaṃsakā pajāpat'ābhinandino, brahmapasaṃsakā brahm'ābhinandino, te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
bhūtapubba

adj. happened before; existed previously [bhūta + pubba] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning happened before; existed previously
Construction bhūta + pubba
bhūtapubbaṃ 1

ind. formerly; previously; in the past; lit. become past [bhūta + pubba + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of bhūtapubba
Meaning formerly; previously; in the past; lit. become past
Construction bhūta + pubba + aṃ
bhūtapubba + aṃ
Synonym atītamaddhānaṃ, pubbassudaṃ, pubbe, puratthā, pure
Sanskrit bhūtapūrvam

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bho gotama, sārīrikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambho'pi nāma bhavissati, hadayam'pi nāma phalissati, uṇham'pi lohitaṃ mukhato uggamissati, ummādam'pi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepaṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bhūtapubbaṃ 2

ind. once upon a time; in days of old; lit. become past [bhūta + pubba + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of bhūtapubba
Meaning once upon a time; in days of old; lit. become past
Construction bhūta + pubba + aṃ
bhūtapubba + aṃ
Sanskrit bhūtapūrvam

Examples

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sakuṇagghi lāpaṃ sakuṇaṃ sahasā ajjhappattā aggahesi.

SN 47.6 sakuṇagghisuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo sāy'anhasamayaṃ anunadītīre gocarapasuto ahosi. siṅgālopi kho, bhikkhave, sāy'anhasamayaṃ anunadītīre gocarapasuto ahosi.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
bhūtapubbāhaṃ

sandhi. formerly I; in the past I; once upon a time I; lit. become past I [bhūtapubbaṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning formerly I; in the past I; once upon a time I; lit. become past I
Construction bhūtapubbaṃ + ahaṃ
Sanskrit bhūtapūrvam + aham

Examples

bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhante, sirī nāma rājā ahosiṃ dāyako dānapati dānassa vaṇṇavādī.

SN 2.23 serīsuttaṃ

bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhante, rohitasso nāma isi ahosiṃ bhojaputto iddhimā vehāsaṅ'gamo.

SN 2.26 rohitassasuttaṃ
bhūtabhabya

adj. who are and who will be; who exist and could exist [bhūta + bhabya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who are and who will be; who exist and could exist
Construction bhūta + bhabya
Compound dvanda (bhūta ca bhabya ca)
Commentary (MNa) bhūtabhabyānan'ti ... tattha aṇḍajajalābujā sattā antoaṇḍakose c'eva antovatthimhi ca bhabyā nāma, bahi nikkhantakālato paṭṭhāya bhūtā.
Sanskrit bhūtabhavya

Example

eso hi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto añña'd'atthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṃ.

bhūtamidaṃ

sandhi. this is; this exists; this has become; this has come to be [bhūtaṃ + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pp + pron
Meaning this is; this exists; this has become; this has come to be
Construction bhūtaṃ + idaṃ
Sanskrit bhūta + idam

Examples

bhūtam'idan'ti, sāriputta, passasī'ti? bhūtam'idan'ti, bhante, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ

bhūtam'idan'ti, bhikkhave, passathā'ti? evaṃ, bhante. tadāhārasambhavan'ti, bhikkhave, passathā'ti? evaṃ, bhante. tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ, taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti, bhikkhave, passathā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
bhūtarata

adj. delighting in being; (or) enjoying (other) beings [bhūta + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning delighting in being; (or) enjoying (other) beings
Construction bhūta + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhūte + rata)
Commentary (UDa) bhūtaratā'ti bhūtesu mātāpituputtadār'ādisaññāya aññasattesu taṇhāya ratā, bhūte vā khandhapañcake anicc'āsubha-dukkh'ānatta-sabhāve taṃsabhāv'ānavabodhato itthipuris'ādiparikappavasena nicc'ādivasena att'attaniyagāhavasena ca abhiratā.
Sanskrit bhūta + rata

Example

lokam'imaṃ passa, puthū avijjāya paretā bhūtā bhūtaratā aparimuttā, ye hi keci bhavā sabbadhi sabbatthatāya sabbe te bhavā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā'ti.

UD30 lokasuttaṃ

Example

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

fem. "beingness," becoming, coming-to-being ✗

adj. composed of elements [√bhū] ✗

Examples

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, vacanapathā yehi vo pare vadamānā vadeyyuṃ, kālena vā akālena vā, bhūtena vā abhūtena vā, saṇhena vā pharusena vā, atthasaṃhitena vā anatthasaṃhitena vā, mettacittā vā dosantarā vā.

duddiṭṭhaṃ vata, bho bhāradvāja, addasāma, duddiṭṭhaṃ vata, bho bhāradvāja, addasāma! ye mayaṃ tassa bhoto gotamassa bhūnahuno seyyaṃ addasāmā'ti.

bhūnahacca

Notes (MW) bhrūṇahan one who kills a learned Brāhman

Examples

duddiṭṭhaṃ vata, bho bhāradvāja, addasāma, duddiṭṭhaṃ vata, bho bhāradvāja, addasāma! ye mayaṃ tassa bhoto gotamassa bhūnahuno seyyaṃ addasāmā'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

ye mayaṃ tassa bhoto gotamassa bhūnahanassa seyyaṃ addasāmā'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

sammukhā ce'pi mayaṃ, bho bhāradvāja, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ passeyyāma, sammukhā'pi naṃ vadeyyāma, bhūnahu samaṇo gotamo'ti. taṃ kissa hetu? evañ'hi no sutte ocaratī'ti.

bhūma 1

masc. earth; ground [√bhū + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps
Meaning earth; ground
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Synonym pathavī, bhū, bhūmi
Variant bhumma
Sanskrit bhūma
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

pamādaṃ appamādena,
yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha,
asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.

DHP 28 appamādavaggo

bhūma 3

adj. having floors or stories [√bhū] ✗
bhūmaka 1

Examples

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.

bhūmaṭṭha 1

adj. standing on the ground; situated on the earth; lit. standing on the earth [bhūma + ṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning standing on the ground; situated on the earth; lit. standing on the earth

Variant bhummaṭṭha
Sanskrit bhūma + stha

Example

pamādaṃ appamādena,
yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha,
asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.

DHP 28 appamādavaggo
bhūmaṭṭha 2

adj. underground; situated under the earth; lit. standing in the earth [bhūma + ṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning underground; situated under the earth; lit. standing in the earth
Construction bhūma + ṭha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhūmasmiṃ + ṭha)
Antonym thalaṭṭha
Variant bhummaṭṭha
Commentary (VINa) bhūmaṭṭhaṃ thalaṭṭhan'tiādinā nayena mātikaṃ ṭhapetvā, bhūmaṭṭhaṃ nāma bhaṇḍaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhittaṃ hotī'tiādinā nayena tassa vibhaṅgaṃ āha.
Sanskrit bhūma + stha

Example

bhūmaṭṭhaṃ nāma bhaṇḍaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti nikhātaṃ paṭicchannaṃ.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
bhūmaṭṭhaka

adj. standing on the ground; situated on the earth ✗
bhūmattharaṇa

nt. ground cover; ground sheet; lit. ground spread [bhūmi + attharaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning ground cover; ground sheet; lit. ground spread
Construction bhūmi + attharaṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (bhūmi + attharaṇa)
Variant bhummattharaṇa
Commentary (VINa) bhūm'attharaṇaṃ nāma bhūmiyaṃ attharitabbā kaṭasārak'ādivikati.
Sanskrit bhūmi + āstaraṇa

Example

seyyaṃ nāma bhisi, cimilikā uttar'attharaṇaṃ, bhūm'attharaṇaṃ, taṭṭikā, cammakhaṇḍo, nisīdanaṃ, paccattharaṇaṃ, tiṇasanthāro, paṇṇasanthāro.

VIN 2.5.2.5 dutiyasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
bhūmi 1

fem. earth; ground [√bhū + mi] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning earth; ground
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + mi
Derivative kita (mi)
Synonym chamā, pathavī, bhū, bhūma
Sanskrit bhūmi
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

so na khulukhulukārakaṃ pattaṃ dhovati, na samparivattakaṃ pattaṃ dhovati, na pattaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipitvā hatthe dhovati, hatthesu dhotesu patto dhoto hoti, patte dhote hatthā dhotā honti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'eva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ anujāneyya

VIN 4.5.158 mahākaccānassa pañcavaraparidassanā
bhūmi 2

fem. land; region; area; realm [√bhū + mi] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning land; region; area; realm
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + mi
Derivative kita (mi)
Synonym disā
Sanskrit bhūmi
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

so karohi dīpam'attano,
khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava,
niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo,
dibbaṃ ariyabhūmiṃ upehisi.

DHP 236 malavaggo

abhijānāsi no tvaṃ, rājañña, divā seyyaṃ upagato supinakaṃ passitā ārāmarāmaṇeyyakaṃ vanarāmaṇeyyakaṃ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakaṃ pokkharaṇīrāmaṇeyyakan'ti

DN 23.10 pāyāsisuttaṃ
bhūmi 3

fem. grounds; basis; foundation [√bhū + mi] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning grounds; basis; foundation
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + mi
Derivative kita (mi)
Synonym seyyā
Sanskrit bhūmi
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

yā uṇṇatī s'āssa vighātabhūmi,
mān'ātimānaṃ vadate pan'eso,
etam'pi disvā na vivādayetha,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

Construction √bhū + mi
Derivative kita (mi)
Sanskrit bhūmi
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.

SN 25.1 cakkhusuttaṃ

appañ'hi etaṃ na alaṃ samāya,
duve vivādassa phalāni brūmi,
etam'pi disvā na vivādayetha,
khem'ābhipassaṃ avivādabhūmiṃ.

Sanskrit bhūmigata

Examples

MN 82 raṭṭhapālasuttaṃ

bhūmiṃ gato bhūmigato, sabbarattiṃ sobhaṇo sabbarattisobhaṇo. apāyaṃ gato apāyagato, issarena kataṃ issarakataṃ, sallena viddho sallaviddho, kathinassa dussaṃ kathinadussaṃ

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge pokkharaṇī caturaṃsā ālibaddhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āliṃ muñceyya, āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleasant as a place; lovely as a land area; delightful as a region
Construction bhūmi + rāmaṇeyyaka
Compound kammadhāraya (bhūmi + rāmaṇeyyaka)
Commentary (ANa) bhūmirāmaṇeyyakan'ti jetavanavihāra-magadhakkhett'ādisadisaṃ samaṃ bhūmiṭṭhānaṃ.
Sanskrit bhūmi + rāmaṇīyaka

Examples

gāme vā yadi v'āraññe,
ninne vā yadi vā thale,
yattha arahanto viharanti,
taṃ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakaṃ.

DN 23.10 pāyāsisuttaṃ

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who exist on the earth; lit. sleeping on earth
Construction bhūmi + saya
Compound sattamī tappurisa (bhūmiyaṃ + saya)

Sanskrit bhūmiśaya

Example

yo mahāmeruno kūṭaṃ,
vimokkhena aphassayi,
vanaṃ pubbavidehānaṃ,
ye ca bhūmisayā narā.

DN 19.11 mahāgovindasuttaṃ
bhūmyā

fem. from the earth [√bhū + mi + iyā] ✓

Grammar fem, abl sg of bhūmi, irreg form of bhūmiyā
Meaning from the earth
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + mi + iyā
bhūmiyā > bhūmyā
Derivative taddhita (iyā)
Phonetic Change iyā > yā (contraction)
Sanskrit bhūmya
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

ekapaṇṇo ayaṃ rukkho,
na bhūmyā caturaṅgulo,
phalena visakappena,
mahāyaṃ kiṃ bhavissatī'ti.

JA 149 ekapaṇṇa jātakaṃ

bhūri 1

adj. vast; extensive; abundant [√bhū + ri] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning vast; extensive; abundant
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ri
Derivative kita (ri)
Synonym uḷāra, oḷāra, mahanta, vipula
Sanskrit bhūri
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

imañ'ca kāyaṃ ārabbha,
bhūripaññena desitaṃ,
pahānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ,
rūpaṃ passatha chaḍḍitaṃ.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

sambādhe vata okāsaṃ,
avindi bhūrimedhaso,
yo jhānam'abujjhi buddho,
paṭilīnanisabho munī'ti.

SN 2.7 pañcālacaṇḍasuttaṃ
bhūri 2

fem. wisdom; discernment [√bhū + ri] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning wisdom; discernment
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + ri
Derivative kita (ri)
Synonym buddhi
Sanskrit bhūri
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Example

yogā ve jāyatī bhūri,
ayogā bhūrisaṅkhayo,
etaṃ dvedhāpathaṃ ñatvā,
bhavāya vibhavāya ca,
tath'āttānaṃ niveseyya,
yathā bhūri pavaḍḍhati.

DHP 282 maggavaggo
bhūrikamma

nt. earth rite ✗
bhūridattajātaka

nt. Jātaka 543 (JA 543) ✗
bhūripañña

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of extensive understanding; of vast wisdom
Construction bhūri + pañña
Compound kammadhāraya (bhūri + paññā)
Antonym parittapañña
Commentary (MNa) bhūripaññassā'ti bhūri vuccati pathavī, tāya pathavīsamāya paññāya vipulāya mahantāya vitthatāya samannāgatassā'ti attho. (SNa) bhūripaññā'ti bahupañña ussannapañña.
Sanskrit bhūri + prajña

Examples

imañ'ca kāyaṃ ārabbha,
bhūripaññena desitaṃ,
pahānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ,
rūpaṃ passatha chaḍḍitaṃ.

sayaṃ samādāya vatāni jantu,
ucc'āvacaṃ gacchati saññasatto,
vidvā ca vedehi samecca dhammaṃ,
na ucc'āvacaṃ gacchati bhūripañño.

Sanskrit bhū + ādi + gaṇa

Example

masc. frog ✗
bhecchati

bhejja 1

nt. torture; maiming; lit. breaking [√bhid + *a + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from bheda
Meaning torture; maiming; lit. breaking

Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction √bhid > bhed + *a + ya
bheda + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change i > e
dy > jj
Sanskrit bhedya
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

rājāno nāma pathabyārājā padesarājā maṇḍalikā antarabhogikā akkhadassā mahāmattā, ye vā pana chejjabhejjaṃ karontā anusāsanti. ete rājāno nāma.

bheti

pr. (+inf) fears (to); is scared (to); is afraid (to) [√bhī + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, intrans (+inf)
Meaning fears (to); is scared (to); is afraid (to)
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Base √bhī + a > bhe
Construction bhe + ti
Synonym tasati, bhāyati
Commentary (SNa) na'pi bhemi sottun'ti yathā ekacco sīhapath'ādīsu'y'eva supituṃ bhāyati, evaṃ ahaṃ supitum'pi na bhāyāmi.
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)
bhettar

masc. breaker; divider; splitter [√bhid + *e + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from bhedeti, caus
Meaning breaker; divider; splitter
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 *e (break, split)
Base √bhid + *e > bhede (caus)
Construction bhede + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym padāletar, bhedetar
Sanskrit bhettṛ
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

pisuṇavāco hoti. ito sutvā amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya. iti samaggānaṃ vā bhettā, bhinnānaṃ vā anuppadātā, vagg'ārāmo vaggarato vagganandī vaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
bhetvā

abs. (+acc) having broken; having shattered; having destroyed; lit. having caused to break [√bhid + *e + tvā] ~

Grammar abs of bhedeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having broken; having shattered; having destroyed; lit. having caused to break
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 *e (break, split)
Base √bhid + *e > bhede (caus)
Construction bhede + tvā
Synonym bhañjitvā, bhinditvā, saṃchinditvā
Commentary (THa) bhetvā'ti .. bhañjitvā. (BVa) bhetvā'ti ... vināsetvā'ti
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)
bhetvāna

abs. (+acc) having caused division; having broken; having ruptured [√bhid + *e + tvāna] ✓

Grammar abs of bhedeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having caused division; having broken; having ruptured
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 *e (break, split)
Base √bhid + *e > bhede (caus)
Construction bhede + tvāna
Phonetic Change bhede > bhe (contraction)
Variant bhinditvā, bhitvāna
Commentary (ITIa) bhetvānā'ti pubbe vuttalakkhaṇena saṅghabhedena bhinditvā.
Sanskrit bhittvā
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

āpāyiko nerayiko,
kappaṭṭho saṅghabhedako,
vaggarato adhammaṭṭho,
yogakkhemā padhaṃsati,
saṅghaṃ samaggaṃ bhetvāna,
kappaṃ nirayamhi paccatī'ti.

AN 10.39 paṭhamaānandasuttaṃ
bheda 1

masc. (+gen) death; lit. breakup [√bhid + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhindati (+gen)
Meaning death; lit. breakup
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction √bhid > bhed + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym kālaṅkiriyā
Sanskrit bheda
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

vītataṇho purā bhedā,
pubbam'antam'anissito,
vemajjhe n'upasaṅkheyyo,
tassa n'atthi purakkhataṃ.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

yo so yodh'ājīvo saṅgāme ussahati vāyamati, tam'enaṃ ussahantaṃ vāyamantaṃ pare hananti pariyāpādenti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā parajitānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī'ti.

SN 42.3 yodhājīvasuttaṃ
bheda 2

masc. (vinaya) schism; split; breakup [√bhid + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhindati
Meaning (vinaya) schism; split; breakup
Root Family √bhid
Root √bhid･2 ṃa (break, split)
Construction √bhid > bhed + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (VIN 1.2.10) bhedāya parakkameyyā'ti, kathaṃ ime nānā assu, vinā assu, vaggā assū'ti pakkhaṃ pariyesati, gaṇaṃ bandhati.
Sanskrit bheda
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Examples

VIN PAT SA 10 saṅghabhedasikkhāpadaṃ

sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññam'aññaṃ kāressāma, siyā'pi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.

DHP 138 daṇḍavaggo

ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātā-pettika-sambhavo odana-kummāsa-upacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

VIN PAT SA 10 saṅghabhedasikkhāpadaṃ

tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo, yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te bhikkhu patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

VIN PAT NP 22 ūnapañcabandhanasikkhāpadaṃ
bhedanakaṃ

ind. involving breaking up; having to be dismantled [√bhid + *ana + ka + aṃ] ✓

bhedanaka + aṃ

Sanskrit bhedanaka
Sanskrit Root √bhid 1, 7 (split)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu aṭṭhimayaṃ vā dantamayaṃ vā visāṇamayaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ kārāpeyya, bhedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 86 sūcigharasikkhāpadaṃ
bhedanadhamma

adj. subject to breaking up; liable to perish; lit. breaking nature [bhedana + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning subject to breaking up; liable to perish; lit. breaking nature

Compound kammadhāraya (bhedana + dhamma)
Commentary (SNa) bhedanadhammo'ti bhijjanasabhāvo.
Sanskrit bhedana + dharma

Examples

ye'pi te, mahārāja, bhikkhū arahanto khīṇ'āsavā vusitavanto katakaraṇīyā ohitabhārā anuppattasadatthā parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojanā samma'd'aññāvimuttā, tesaṃ'p'āyaṃ kāyo bhedanadhammo nikkhepanadhammo'ti.

SN 3.3 jarāmaraṇasuttaṃ

kiṃ te idha sārasammataṃ,
kuṇapapūramhi susānavaḍḍhane,
bhedanadhamme kaḷevare,
yaṃ disvā vimano udikkhasi.

bhedādhippāya

adj. intending to cause discord; with the desire for dissension; with the purpose to break apart [bheda + adhippāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning intending to cause discord; with the desire for dissension; with the purpose to break apart
Construction bheda + adhippāya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhedassa + adhippāya)
Antonym nabhedādhippāya
Commentary (VINa) bhed'ādhippāyassa vā'ti evam'ayaṃ etena saddhiṃ bhijjissatī'ti parassa parena bhedaṃ icchantassa vā.
Sanskrit bheda + abhiprāya

Example

pesuññaṃ nāma dvīh'ākārehi pesuññaṃ hoti, piyakamyassa vā bhed'ādhippāyassa vā. dasah'ākārehi pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati, jātito'pi, nāmato'pi, gottato'pi, kammato'pi, sippato'pi, ābādhato'pi, liṅgato'pi, kilesato'pi, āpattito'pi, akkosato'pi.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
bhedeti

pr. causes to break, divide or disunite [√bhid] ✗

abs. having caused to break, divide or disunite [√bhid] ✗

aor. caused to break, divide or disunite [√bhid] ✗
bheraṇḍa

masc. jackal ✗
bheraṇḍaka

masc. cry of a small jackal; little jackal's yelp ✗
bherava 1

adj. frightful; terrifying [√bhī + ru + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhīru
Meaning frightful; terrifying
Root Family √bhī
Root √bhī･1 a (fear)
Construction √bhī > bhe + ru > rav + *a
bhīru + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > e
u > av
Sanskrit bhairava
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Examples

devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,
ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi,
tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato,
n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.

TH 155 sambulakaccānattheragāthā

phassena yadā phuṭṭhassa,
paridevaṃ bhikkhu na kareyya kuhiñci,
bhavañ'ca n'ābhijappeyya,
bheravesu ca na sampavedheyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

Meaning fear; terror

bhīru + *a

Phonetic Change ī > e
u > av

Sanskrit bhairava
Sanskrit Root √bhī 1, 3, 10 (fear)

Examples

ucc'āvacesu sayanesu,
kīvanto tattha bheravā,
yehi bhikkhu na vedheyya,
nigghose sayan'āsane.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

paradhammikānam'pi na santaseyya,
disvā'pi tesaṃ bahubheravāni,
ath'āparāni abhisambhaveyya,
parissayāni kusal'ānuesī.

bheri

fem. kettle drum ✓

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso kusalo bherisaddassa. so addhānamaggappaṭipanno bherisaddaṃ suṇeyya. tassa na h'eva kho assa kaṅkhā vā vimati vā, bherisaddo nu kho, na nu kho bherisaddo'ti! atha kho bherisaddotv'eva niṭṭhaṃ gaccheyya.

AN 4.191 sotānugatasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato khamo hoti sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ bheripaṇavasaṅkhatiṇavaninnādasaddānaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khantā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
bhericāraṇa

nt. proclamation through sounding a drum ✗
bheritala

nt. skin of a kettle drum [bheri + tala] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning skin of a kettle drum
Construction bheri + tala
bheripaṇavavaṃsasaṅkhaḍiṇḍimaninnādasaddā

masc. noisy sounds of kettle drums, cymbals, flutes, conches and other drums [bheri + paṇava + vaṃsa + saṅkha + ḍiṇḍima + ninnāda + sadda + ā] ~

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning noisy sounds of kettle drums, cymbals, flutes, conches and other drums
Construction bheri + paṇava + vaṃsa + saṅkha + ḍiṇḍima + ninnāda + sadda + ā
bheripaṇavavaṃsasaṅkhaḍiṇḍimaninnādasadda + ā
bheripaṇavasaṅkhatiṇavaninnādasadda

masc. noisy sound of kettle drums, cymbals, conches and other drums [bheri + paṇava + saṅkha + tiṇava + ninnāda + sadda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning noisy sound of kettle drums, cymbals, conches and other drums
Construction bheri + paṇava + saṅkha + tiṇava + ninnāda + sadda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bheripaṇavasaṅkhatiṇavānaṃ + ninnādasadda)
Variant bheripaṇavavaṃsasaṅkhaḍiṇḍimaninnādasadda
Sanskrit bherī + paṇava + śaṅkha + trivalī + nināda + śabda

Example

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato khamo hoti sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ bheripaṇavasaṅkhatiṇavaninnādasaddānaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khantā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
bherivādaka

masc. drummer ✗
bherivādakajātaka

nt. Jātaka 59 (JA 59) ✗
bherivādana

nt. sounding of a drum ✗
bherisadda

masc. sound of the kettle drum [bheri + sadda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sound of the kettle drum
Construction bheri + sadda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bheriyā + sadda)
Sanskrit bherī + śabda

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso kusalo bherisaddassa. so addhānamaggappaṭipanno bherisaddaṃ suṇeyya. tassa na h'eva kho assa kaṅkhā vā vimati vā, bherisaddo nu kho, na nu kho bherisaddo'ti! atha kho bherisaddotv'eva niṭṭhaṃ gaccheyya.

AN 4.191 sotānugatasuttaṃ
bhesakalāvana

nt. name of a wood in the Bhagga country; lit. Bhesakalā's wood [bhesakalā + vana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a wood in the Bhagga country; lit. Bhesakalā's wood
Construction bhesakalā + vana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhesakalya + vana)
Variant bhesagaḷāvana, bhesakaḷāvana
Commentary (MNa) bhesakaḷāvane'ti bhesakaḷānāmake vane. bhesagaḷāvane'ti'pi pāṭho.
bhesakaḷāvana

nt. name of a wood in the Bhagga country; lit. Bhesakaḷā's wood [bhesakaḷā + vana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a wood in the Bhagga country; lit. Bhesakaḷā's wood
Construction bhesakaḷā + vana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhesakaḷāya + vana)
Variant bhesagaḷāvana, bhesakalāvana
Commentary (MNa) bhesakaḷāvane'ti bhesakaḷānāmake vane. bhesagaḷāvane'ti'pi pāṭho.

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahāmoggallāno magadhesu kallavāḷaputtagāme pacalāyamāno nisinno hoti.

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.

MN 15 anumānasuttaṃ
bhesagaḷā

fem. name of a forest ✗
bhesajja

nt. medicine; remedy; tonic; drug [bhisakka + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bhisakka
Meaning medicine; remedy; tonic; drug
Construction bhisakka > bhesakka > bhesajja + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
k > j
Synonym agada, osadha, osadhi
Sanskrit bheṣaja

Examples

sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi sappāyāni bhesajjāni, ahaṃ āyasmato channassa sappāyāni bhesajjāni pariyesissāmi.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

so na labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, na labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, na labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, na labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ

upanissāya viharatī'ti tattha paṭibaddhā honti cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārā

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
bhesajjapariyanta

adj. limited to medicine [bhesajja + pariyanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning limited to medicine
Construction bhesajja + pariyanta
Compound kammadhāraya (bhesajja + pariyanta)
Antonym rattipariyanta
Commentary (VIN 2.5.5.7) bhesajjapariyantā nāma bhesajjāni pariggahitāni honti, ettakehi bhesajjehi pavāremī'ti.
Sanskrit bheṣaja + paryanta

Example

tato ce uttari sādiyeyyā'ti atthi pavāraṇā bhesajjapariyantā na rattipariyantā, atthi pavāraṇā rattipariyantā na bhesajjapariyantā, atthi pavāraṇā bhesajjapariyantā ca rattipariyantā ca

bhesika

masc. name of a washroom attendant ✗
bhesma

adj. terrible; terrifying; fearful [√bhis + mā + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhismā
Meaning terrible; terrifying; fearful
Root Family √bhis
Root √bhis･2 ṃa (fear)
Construction √bhis > bhes + mā + *a
bhismā + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym vibhiṃsana, sadara, saddara
Commentary (VINa) bhesmā'ti bhayānako. (ITIa) bhesmā'ti vipulabhāvena gambhīrabhāvena ca bhiṃsāpento viya, vipulagambhīro'ti attho.
Sanskrit bhīṣma
Sanskrit Root √bheṣ √bhyas 1 (fear)

Example

samuddaṃ visakumbhena,
yo maññeyya padūsituṃ,
na so tena padūseyya,
bhesmā hi udadhi mahā.

ITI89 devadattasuttaṃ
bho

masc. (respectful address; especially between Brahmans) sir; sirs; master; masters; friend; friends; good man; good men [√bhū + o] ✓

Grammar masc, nom and voc sg and pl of bhavant, irreg
Meaning (respectful address; especially between Brahmans) sir; sirs; master; masters; friend; friends; good man; good men
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Construction √bhū + o
Synonym bhavant
Sanskrit bhavan
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

tam'enaṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya, ummujja, bho puthusile, uplava, bho puthusile, thalam'uplava, bho puthusile'ti.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhikkhave, bakaṃ brahmānaṃ etadavocaṃ, avijjāgato vata, bho, bako brahmā, avijjāgato vata, bho, bako brahmā. yatra hi nāma aniccaṃ'y'eva samānaṃ niccan'ti vakkhati

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
bhoga 1.1

masc. wealth; possessions; property; riches [√bhuj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhuñjati
Meaning wealth; possessions; property; riches
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj > bhog + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Antonym abhoga
Sanskrit bhoga
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

rājato vā upasaggaṃ,
abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,
parikkhayañ'ca ñātīnaṃ,
bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.

DHP 139 daṇḍavaggo

appamattikā esā, bhikkhave, parihāni yadidaṃ bhogaparihāni. etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī'ti.

AN 1.78 kalyāṇamittādivaggo
bhoga 1.2

masc. pleasure; enjoyment [√bhuj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhuñjati
Meaning pleasure; enjoyment
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj > bhog + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Antonym abhoga
Synonym abhinanda, assāda
Sanskrit bhoga
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

ayaṃ varāko kiñ'cā'pi idāni sukhito susajjito bhoge paribhuñjati, atha kho tīsu dvāresu ekenā'pi katassa kalyāṇakammassa abhāvā idāni apāyesu anappakaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedissatī'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ
bhoga 1.3

nt. wealth; possessions; property; riches [√bhuj + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bhuñjati
Meaning wealth; possessions; property; riches
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj > bhog + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Synonym dhana, vitta
Commentary (ANa) bhogāni pariyesatī'ti bhoge gavesati
Sanskrit bhoga
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā'ti?

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

ath'āparāyaṃ akkhāto,
ekacakkhu ca puggalo,
dhamm'ādhammena saṭhoso,
bhogāni pariyesati.

Meaning mountain of wealth; pile of riches

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, āvuso, aparena samayena appaṃ vā bhogakkhandhaṃ pahāya mahantaṃ vā bhogakkhandhaṃ pahāya ... kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

siyā kho pana bhoto rañño mahāyaññaṃ yajamānassa koci'd'eva vippaṭisāro, mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchatī'ti, so bhotā raññā vippaṭisāro na karaṇīyo

fem. loss of wealth ✗

no ca pāragavesino,

bhogabyasana

nt. financial disaster; loss of wealth [bhoga + byasana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning financial disaster; loss of wealth
Construction bhoga + byasana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhogānaṃ + byasana)

Sanskrit bhoga + vyasana

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ñātibyasanena vā phuṭṭho samāno, bhogabyasanena vā phuṭṭho samāno, rogabyasanena vā phuṭṭho samāno na iti paṭisañcikkhati, tathābhūto kho ayaṃ lokasannivāso tathābhūto ayaṃ attabhāvapaṭilābho

AN 4.192 ṭhānasuttaṃ
bhogabyasanasaṃvattanika

adj. leading to financial disaster; conducive to loss of wealth; lit. leading to wealth misfortune [bhogabyasana + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to financial disaster; conducive to loss of wealth; lit. leading to wealth misfortune
Construction bhogabyasana + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bhogabyasanāya + saṃvattanika)
Commentary (ANa) bhogabyasanasaṃvattaniko'ti yathā kākaṇikāmattam'pi hatthe na tiṭṭhati, evaṃ bhogabyasanaṃ saṃvatteti.
Sanskrit bhoga + vyasana + saṃvartanīya

Example

adinn'ādānaṃ, bhikkhave, āsevitaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ nirayasaṃvattanikaṃ tiracchānayonisaṃvattanikaṃ pettivisayasaṃvattanikaṃ. yo sabbalahuso adinn'ādānassa vipāko, manussabhūtassa bhogabyasanasaṃvattaniko hoti.

bhogamada

masc. pride of wealth ✗
bhogavatā

Grammar fem, abstr, from bhogavant
Meaning wealthy; lit. wealthy state

j > g
Sanskrit bhogavat
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa evaṃ icchati, aho vat'āyaṃ na bhogavā assā'ti! taṃ kissa hetu? na, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa bhogavatāya nandati.

j > g
