Meaning claiming prosperity; boasting of wealth; lit. wealth speech
Construction bhogavā + vāda
Compound kammadhāraya (bhogavā + iti + vāda)
Sanskrit bhogavat + vāda

Example

seyyathāpi, āvuso, puriso daliddo'va samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeyya, adhano'va samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeyya, abhogo'va samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeyya.

AN 10.24 mahācundasuttaṃ
bhogavāsī

adj. living together for money [bhoga + vāsī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living together for money
Construction bhoga + vāsī
Commentary (VINa) bhogena vasatī'ti bhogavāsinī. udukkhalamusal'ādighar'ūpakaraṇaṃ labhitvā bhariyābhāvaṃ gacchantiyā janapad'itthiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
bhogavināsa

masc. loss of wealth; financial ruin [bhoga + vināsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning loss of wealth; financial ruin
Construction bhoga + vināsa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhogānaṃ + vināsa)
Sanskrit bhoga + vināśa
bhogavuddhi

fem. growth of wealth; increase in riches [bhoga + vuddhi] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning growth of wealth; increase in riches
Construction bhoga + vuddhi
Antonym bhogaparihāni
bhogasamappita

adj. wealthy; well-off; lit. filled with wealth [bhoga + samappita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wealthy; well-off; lit. filled with wealth
Construction bhoga + samappita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhogaṃ + samappita)
Sanskrit bhoga + samarpita

Examples

saddho sīlena sampanno,
yasobhogasamappito,
yaṃ yaṃ padesaṃ bhajati,
tattha tatth'eva pūjito.

DHP 303 pakiṇṇakavaggo

kiñ'cā'pi so tāni khādanto c'eva paribhuñjanto ca sukhito bhogasamappito viya gacchati, atha kho taṃ n'eva koci, sukhito ayaṃ mahābhogo'ti maññati

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
bhogasampadā

fem. successful attainment of wealth [bhoga + sampadā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning successful attainment of wealth
Construction bhoga + sampadā

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning because of the successful attainment of wealth
Construction bhogasampadā + hetu
bhogasaṃharapetavatthu

nt. Petavatthu 49 (PV 49) ✗
bhogasukha

nt. pleasure of enjoyment; happiness of using [bhoga + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning pleasure of enjoyment; happiness of using
Construction bhoga + sukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhogassa + sukha)
Commentary (ANa) bhoge paribhuñjantassa uppajjanakasukhaṃ bhogasukhaṃ nāma.
Sanskrit bhoga + sukha

Example

cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ
bhogasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.227 (AN5.227) ✗
bhogahetu

ind. for the sake of money; for the sake of wealth [bhoga + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of money; for the sake of wealth
Construction bhoga + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhogassa + hetu)
Sanskrit bhoga + hetu

Example

sv'āhaṃ idha pañca sikkhā karitvā,
paṭipajjitvā tathāgatassa dhamme,
dvepatham'agamāsiṃ coramajjhe,
te maṃ tattha vadhiṃsu bhogahetu.

VV 53 chattamāṇavaka vimānavatthu
bhogādhikaraṇaṃ

ind. due to wealth; on account of riches [bhoga + adhikaraṇa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to wealth; on account of riches
Construction bhoga + adhikaraṇa + aṃ
bhogādhikaraṇa + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (bhoga + adhikaraṇaṃ)
Sanskrit bhoga + adhikaraṇa

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññatha, sakkā, api nu so puriso bhogahetu bhoganidānaṃ bhog'ādhikaraṇaṃ ekaṃ vā rattiṃ ekaṃ vā divasaṃ upaḍḍhaṃ vā rattiṃ upaḍḍhaṃ vā divasaṃ ek'antasukhappaṭisaṃvedī vihareyyā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

AN 10.46 sakkasuttaṃ
bhogādhippāya

adj. aimed at wealth; with riches as goal [bhoga + adhippāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning aimed at wealth; with riches as goal
Construction bhoga + adhippāya
Commentary (ANa) bhog'ādhippāyā'ti bhogasaṃharaṇ'atthaṃ ṭhapit'ādhippāyā pavattaajjhāsayā.
bhogānamāsaya

masc. source of wealth; source of enjoyment; lit. home of wealth [bhogānaṃ + āsaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of wealth; source of enjoyment; lit. home of wealth
Construction bhogānaṃ + āsaya
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bhogānaṃ + āsaya)
Sanskrit bhogānām + āśraya

Examples

kiṃsu bandhati pātheyyaṃ,
kiṃsu bhogānam'āsayo,
kiṃsu naraṃ parikassati,
kiṃsu lokasmi dujjahaṃ,
kismiṃ baddhā puthū sattā,
pāsena sakuṇī yathā'ti.

SN 1.79 pātheyyasuttaṃ

saddhā bandhati pātheyyaṃ,
sirī bhogānam'āsayo,
icchā naraṃ parikassati,
icchā lokasmi dujjahā,
icchābaddhā puthū sattā,
pāsena sakuṇī yathā'ti.

SN 1.79 pātheyyasuttaṃ
bhogāma

masc. tributary village ✗
bhogika

masc. chief of a village; local official; lit. having wealth [√bhuj + *a + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from bhoga
Meaning chief of a village; local official; lit. having wealth
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj > bhog + *a + ika
bhoga + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Commentary (VINa) antarabhogikā nāma dvinnaṃ rājūnaṃ antarā katipayagāmasāmikā.
Sanskrit bhogika
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

rājāno nāma pathabyārājā padesarājā maṇḍalikā antarabhogikā akkhadassā mahāmattā, ye vā pana chejjabhejjaṃ karontā anusāsanti. ete rājāno nāma.

AN 6.11 paṭhamasāraṇīyasuttaṃ
bhogī 2.1

masc. snake [√bhuj] ✗
bhogga 1.1

adj. suitable for use; useful; profitable; lit. to be enjoyed [√bhuj + *ya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of bhuñjati
Meaning suitable for use; useful; profitable; lit. to be enjoyed
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj > bhog + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Synonym atthiya, upabhoga
Sanskrit bhogya
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi aṭṭhahi?

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
bhogga 1.2

nt. wealth; possession; lit. to be enjoyed [√bhuj + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, ptp of bhuñjati
Meaning wealth; possession; lit. to be enjoyed
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj > bhog + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Synonym vitta
Commentary (VINa) rājabhoggo'ti rājato bhoggaṃ bhuñjitabbaṃ ass'atthī'ti rājabhoggo
Sanskrit bhogya
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa rājā vā rājabhoggo vā brāhmaṇo vā gahapatiko vā dūtena cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇeyya, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādehī'ti.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
bhogga 2.1

adj. bent; crooked; curved [√bhuj + *a + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhoga
Meaning bent; crooked; curved
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･1 a (bend)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj > bhog + *a + ya
bhoga + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Synonym kujja, kuṭila, vaṅka
Commentary (DNa) bhoggan'ti khandhe, kaṭiyaṃ, jāṇūsū'ti tīsu ṭhānesu bhoggavaṅkaṃ. (MNa) bhoggan'ti bhaggaṃ, iminā'pi'ssa vaṅkabhāvam'eva dīpeti.
Sanskrit bhugna
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6 (bend)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.

DHP 70 bālavaggo

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti, indriyesu guttadvāro hoti, bhojane mattaññū hoti, jāgariyaṃ anuyutto hoti.

subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ,

kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve pasahati māro,
vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.

acelako ce'pi, kassapa, hoti, mutt'ācāro, hatth'āpalekhano ... iti evarūpaṃ addhamāsikam'pi pariyāyabhattabhojana-anuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

bhojanasutta 1

bhojaniya

Antonym khādanīya
Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.5) bhojanīyaṃ nāma pañca bhojanāni, odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

yam'pi no saddhā gahapatikā divā vikāle paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā denti, tatra'p'ime mukh'āvaraṇaṃ maññe karontī'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

tassa manussā khādanīyam'pi bhojanīyam'pi mālāgandhavilepanatambulāni'pi denti.

samaṇ'īdha araṇā loke,
samaṇānaṃ vusitaṃ na nassati,
samaṇā icchaṃ parijānanti,
samaṇānaṃ bhojissiyaṃ sadā

SN 1.81 araṇasuttaṃ
bhojī

adj. (+acc) eating; feeding (on); nourishing oneself (with) [√bhuj + *ī] ✓

Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ghasa
Sanskrit bhojin
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
bhojetabba

ptp. should be fed; lit. to cause to be eaten [√bhuj + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of bhojeti, caus
Meaning should be fed; lit. to cause to be eaten
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 *e (use, eat, enjoy)
Base √bhuj + *e > bhoje (caus)
Construction bhoje + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit bhojayitavya
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

ime te, ambho purisa, cattāro āsīvisā uggatejā ghoravisā kālena kālaṃ vuṭṭhāpetabbā, kālena kālaṃ nhāpetabbā, kālena kālaṃ bhojetabbā, kālena kālaṃ saṃvesetabbā.

SN 35.238 āsīvisopamasuttaṃ
bhojeti

pr. (+acc) feeds; treats (to); lit. causes to eat [√bhuj + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of bhuñjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning feeds; treats (to); lit. causes to eat
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 *e (use, eat, enjoy)
Base √bhuj + *e > bhoje (caus)
Construction bhoje + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit bhojayati
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

bhikkhū pana mayaṃ, bhante, ājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyā'ti jānissāma ājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojessāma, ājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapessāma.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
bhojetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to feed [√bhuj] ✗
bhojetvā

abs. (+acc) having fed; lit. having caused to eat [√bhuj + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of bhojeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having fed; lit. having caused to eat
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 *e (use, eat, enjoy)
Base √bhuj + *e > bhoje (caus)
Construction bhoje + tvā
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit bhuj
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
bhojenta

prp. (+acc) feeding [√bhuj] ✗
bhojesi

aor. (+acc) fed; treated (to); lit. caused to eat [√bhuj + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of bhojeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning fed; treated (to); lit. caused to eat
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 *e (use, eat, enjoy)
Base √bhuj + *e > bhoje (caus)
Construction bhoje + si
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit abūbhujat
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

mayañ'hi, bhante, pubbe aññatitthiye paribbājake anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyā'ti amaññimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapimha.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
bhojja 1

nt. food; staple food; lit. to be eaten [√bhuj + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, ptp of bhuñjati
Meaning food; staple food; lit. to be eaten
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym khajja
Sanskrit bhojya
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

annaṃ pānañ'ca ādāya,
khajjaṃ bhojjaṃ anappakaṃ,
gehato nikkhamitvāna,
uyyānam'abhihārayiṃ.

THI 53 sujātātherīgāthā

atthi, bhikkhave, dakkhiṇesu janapadesu dhovanaṃ nāma. tattha hoti annam'pi pānam'pi khajjam'pi bhojjam'pi leyyam'pi peyyam'pi naccam'pi gītam'pi vāditam'pi. atth'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dhovanaṃ, n'etaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

AN 10.107 dhovanasuttaṃ
bhojja 2

adj. fit to be eaten [√bhuj] ✗
bhotā

masc. by sir; with master [√bhū + a + tā] ✓

Grammar masc, instr sg of bhavant, irreg
Meaning by sir; with master
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bho
Construction bho + tā
Phonetic Change ū > o
Sanskrit bhavatā
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

kiṃ nu kho bhoto gotamassa sāvakā bhotā gotamena evaṃ ovadīyamānā evaṃ anusāsīyamānā sabbe accantaṃ niṭṭhaṃ nibbānaṃ ārādhenti udāhu ekacce n'ārādhentī'ti?

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhoti 1

fem. madam; dear [√bhū + a + ti] ✓

Grammar fem of bhavant
Meaning madam; dear
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bho
Construction bho + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change ū > o
Notes (JAa) bhotī'ti bhaginiṃ ālapati.
Sanskrit bhavati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

yagghe bhoti jāneyyāsi samaṇo udāyī dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ, sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāsetī'ti.

SN 35.133 verahaccānisuttaṃ

kummaggapaṭipannaṃ maṃ,
ariyamaggaṃ samānayi,
dak'ābhisecanā bhoti,
imaṃ sāṭaṃ dadāmi te.

THI 65 puṇṇātherīgāthā
bhoti 2

pr. is; becomes [√bhū + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning is; becomes
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bho
Construction bho + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change ū > o
Synonym bhavati, hoti
Sanskrit bhavati
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)
bhoto 1

masc. for sir; to master; for you [√bhū + a + to] ✓

Grammar masc, dat sg of bhavant, irreg
Meaning for sir; to master; for you
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bho
Construction bho + to
Phonetic Change ū > o
Sanskrit bhavate
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

sammādiṭṭhiṃ ce bhavaṃ garahati, ye ca micchādiṭṭhī samaṇabrāhmaṇā te bhoto pujjā, te bhoto pāsaṃsā.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ

okappaniyam'etaṃ bhoto gotamassa yathā taṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bhoto 2

masc. of sir; of master; of you [√bhū + a + to] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of bhavant, irreg
Meaning of sir; of master; of you
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bho
Construction bho + to
Phonetic Change ū > o
Sanskrit bhavataḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

sace bhavaṃ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati, bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati.

DN 4.2 soṇadaṇḍasuttaṃ

na kho pana mayaṃ passāma bhoto gotamassa yugaṃ vā naṅgalaṃ vā phālaṃ vā pācanaṃ vā balibadde vā.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
bhottabba

ptp. fit to be eaten [√bhuj] ✗
bhottar

masc. eater [√bhuj + *tar] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from bhuñjati
Meaning eater
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj + *tar
Derivative kita (*tar)
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)
bhottukamyatā

fem. desire to eat; wish to eat [bhottuṃ + kamyatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning desire to eat; wish to eat
Construction bhottuṃ + kamyatā
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (bhottuṃ + kamyatā)
Synonym bhuñjitukāmatā
Commentary (MNa) na bhottukamyatā assā'ti bhuñjitu'kāmatā na bhaveyya.
Sanskrit bhoktum + kāmyatva

Examples

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso manuññabhojanaṃ bhuttāvī chaḍḍeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu tassa purisassa tasmiṃ vante puna bhottu'kamyatā assā'ti?

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ uṭṭhahitvā apāpuritvā olokeyya. tassa sahadassanena amanāpatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, pāṭikulyatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jegucchatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, jighacchitānam'pi na bhottu'kamyatā assa, pageva suhitānaṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
bhottuṃ

inf. (+acc) to eat [√bhuj + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of bhuñjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to eat
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj + tuṃ
Phonetic Change u > o
j > t
Sanskrit bhoktum
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso manuññabhojanaṃ bhuttāvī chaḍḍeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu tassa purisassa tasmiṃ vante puna bhottuṃkamyatā assā'ti?

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

idh'ūragānaṃ pavaro paviṭṭho,
selassa vaṇṇena pamokkham'icchaṃ,
brahmañ'ca vaṇṇaṃ apacāyamāno,
bubhukkhito no visahāmi bhottuṃ.

JA 154 uraga jātaka
bhotvā

abs. (+acc) having eaten; having tasted; having enjoyed [√bhuj + *tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of bhuñjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having eaten; having tasted; having enjoyed
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj + *tvā
Phonetic Change u > o
Variant bhotvāna
Sanskrit bhuktvā
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

rasaṃ bhotvā sati muṭṭhā,
piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto,
sārattacitto vedeti,
tañ'ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ
bhotvāna

abs. (+acc) having eaten; having tasted; having enjoyed [√bhuj + tvāna] ✓

Grammar abs of bhuñjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having eaten; having tasted; having enjoyed
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 ṃa (use, eat, enjoy)
Construction √bhuj > bhoj + tvāna
Phonetic Change u > o
jt > t
Variant bhotvā
Sanskrit bhuktvā
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

rasañ'ca bhotvāna asāditañ'ca sāduṃ,
atho'pi bhotvāna asādum'ekadā,
sāduṃ rasaṃ n'ājjhosāya bhuñje,
virodham'āsādusu n'opadaṃsaye.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
bhonto

masc. gentlemen; masters [√bhū + a + nto] ✓

Grammar masc, nom pl of bhavant, irreg
Meaning gentlemen; masters
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + a > bho
Construction bho + nto
Phonetic Change ū > o
Sanskrit bhavantaḥ
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

ye'pi kho te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā jiṇṇā vuḍḍhā mahallakā addhagatā vayoanuppattā therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇ'ācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

addasā kho poṭṭhapādo paribbājako bhagavantaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ, disvāna sakaṃ parisaṃ saṇṭhapesi, appasaddā bhonto hontu, mā bhonto saddam'akattha. ayaṃ samaṇo gotamo āgacchati.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
bhovādī

masc. Brahman; lit. who says bho [bho + vādī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning Brahman; lit. who says bho
Construction bho + vādī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bhavantaṃ + vādī)
Sanskrit bhovādin

Example

na c'āhaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ brūmi,
yonijaṃ mattisambhavaṃ,
bhovādi nāma so hoti,
sace hoti sakiñcano,
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
